Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alecsandrino
Reviews.Content: i stayed just one night at Melia, but i realized soon after i checked in that the stuff is very friendly and eager to please the customers, that the hotel is well positioned, right in the heart of Berlin and that the services are great for the paid price. The room is large, very comfortable, very clean and quiet. I really enjoy it, since most of the hotel rooms don't offer to much space. but here the room is very big and spacious. I also had the chance to eat something in the restaurant and the food prepared was great, spanish cuisine wonderful cooked.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al G
Reviews.Content: In early April I spent three nights with a room on their concierge floor which Melia calls the Level. Everything from location to staff to room to Level amenities was outstanding. In my worldwide travels this was one of the most enjoyable places I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: janeyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in April and found it to be comfortable, quiet and good value. I booked it last minute online and got a very good deal. We asked for a quiet room and it was that and more. Beds were excellent. Great shower, but even better, the tub- perfect as I was really sick while we were there. The front staff was very helpful in directing us to a chemist and a place to get soup. This place is not deluxe, but good location near the train station, as well as major sights and excellent shopping/restaurants. Very helpful staff and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: VacationTimeGeneva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. Very good location, very close to public transport, so easy connection to sights and main train station. The rooms were large, clean, quiet and comfortable. Didn't eat at the restaurant or try the fitness facilities, so can't comment on these.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location! I Love Berlin Mitte!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimmie007
Reviews.Content: We found the offer on the Internet! a spanish Hotel co A very urban hotel, tooked a junior suite in eighth Floor. The view over the Spree was really nice from the balcony, to somebody who know to appreciate the romance of a big city ( like we do). The suite: two rooms, each with one television. mini-bar, etc.; a Spanish colonial style but very modern. Very well-kept furniture and a large bathroom, and as is typical in Spain with a separate toilet and bidet. A small nespresso is provided. However, the required capsules are not freely available. So bring along! Slippers and dressing gown to emphasize the four star standard. Anyone who wants can also iron, an iron is integrated in the room.( we did not) The rooms are medium-sized, but it can certainly stand there for a few days. A lounge access with breakfast (sufficient selection of hot and cold dishes, including access to the breakfast and tea time as well as an appetizer) were included. Also there was a smoking lounge available. And was located on the 7th floor. the tapas bar, connectedt to the hotel, was represented with a large assortment. Nice dedicated staff made the stay very pleasant. Good wines, delicious Tapas..... So for us a really round time we stay quite happy to recommend. Unfortunately we had only two nights in this pleasant hotel had, so we can not recommend about other virtues of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BigDtravlr
Reviews.Content: The Melia has all the extras of a new hotel. We upgraded to the Level because reviewers said that internet charges were expensive otherwise. We're glad we made that decision. The Level has free drinks throughout the day, a lovely breakfast each morning, and tapas in the evenings. Some evenings, the snacks are better than others, but the water, coffees, mixed drinks, and fruits were wonderful. Our room had a heated bathroom floor, slippers and robes, a very comfortable bed, and lots of closet space. Noise was not a problem. We did have a problem with the a/c and heating system; our room was very warm all four nights. We complained to the front desk several times, and their engineer finally came up and said we had a problem. At the end, they gave us a fair discount on our bill for our discomfort. We did not have to get a transportation pass because we could walk to all the major museums and attractions, such as museum island, Brandenburg Gate, the Bundestag, the German History Museum, the DDR Museum, Checkpoint Charlie, and boatrides. The Hauptbanhof is only a 5-minute taxi ride away, and there is a metro station one block away. We could see the Rive Spree from our room. Berlin businesses close down on Sundays, except for museums. I loved our stay there and would recommend this hotel to everyone. They even provide wash cloths which is a rarity in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsPinikity
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great hotel! Had a comfort/standard room. I was very impressed. The decor is tasteful. The room is spacious. The bathroom is stunning. The bed... well what can I say one of the best nights sleep I've had. The hotel is situated in the heart of Berlin, close to everything.. and yet when you open your window in the morning the most prominent sound you can hear is the singing of the birds. Absolutely fabulous! Staff were friendly and helpful. First time in Berlin. I was overwelmed by the spaciousness of such a grande city. It had a villiage feel to it. So to much to see and do. I will definately return to Berlin again and when I do I will be staying at this hotel with absolute certainty!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYBUG1970
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in a great location - can't say more than that . Will stay there again. I also stayed in the Radisson Blue - very nice also but for me not as good a location.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel. Room very nice and clean and friendly staff. Did not have breakfast (very expensive, you can get nice and cheap breakfast two minutes away). Location excellent. Hard mattress. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kisyulja06
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great, right in the center of Berlin, within walking distance from all the main tourist attractions. Nice view of the river from the restaurant and tapas bar. I requested a quiet room, as always. We got room designed f overlooking the yard which was very quiet. Nice size, windows open all the way to let fresh air in. Bed was pretty comfortable. Feather pillows and down comforters. Breakfast is very good, lots of choices. What I did not like that bed was 2 smaller beds put together and we had 2 super small comforters. I would have preferred 1 large one. We had 1 bathrobe for 2 people, which I thought was strange since we booked room for 2. Room had really funky smell, in fact not only the room, the same smell was in the restaurant as well. We were not able to air it out completely, but open windows helped allot. There were no bath tub, but the shower was large enough for 10 people, we realized that our room was designed for handicapped. Bedding was super clean and crisp, but strongly smelled of chlorine. One last thing, even though there is smoking indoors anywhere in Germany, Melia still has smoking rooms mixed with nonsmoking on the same floors. From time to time somebody would smoke on our floor or in the next room and I would smell the smoke quite often. When I brought it up at the reception I was told that people smoke in all the rooms and there is nothing they can do about it, not like they can check every single room in the hotel. I insisted they take care of it. I don’t know what they have done, but smoke had stopped. Overall experience in Melia was as usual, pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Eswee
Reviews.Content: We also booked at the Melia Hotel on the reviews on Tripadvisor of this hotel. We are glad that we did. When we booked in, we were upgraded to a room on the first floor on the corner of Friedrichstrasse and Am Weidendamm. We had a beautiful view over Friedrichstrasse as well as the Spree River. The Room was beautiful and the service was excellent. The breakfast was expensive, but excellent. We stayed there for 2 nights and my wife received a free bottle of champagne on the morning of her birthday. We will definitely stay over at the Melia again when we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, and location as well”
Reviews.Author: Auditor11
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend the hotel for those travelling to Berlin, it's well located, clean and very quiet. The clerks at the front desk are extremely helpful and friendly, typical good and effective german service! By the way, there is a Spanish restaurante Cafe Madrid inside the hotel which serves excellent food and spanish wines. Sehr gut!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: josequeimado
Reviews.Content: Very well situated, nice staff, perfect and well priced

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, perfect room”
Reviews.Author: NELLYDAIDA E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location in the heart of Berlin. Room with fabulous view of river. Bed was perfect for a great sleep. Staff were always nice and willing to help. Several bars and restaurants around for coffee and dinner. Easy to reach from Tegel airport. Room was bigsized for two.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: AndyC5975
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near to everything. The underground and overground station are conveniently near the hotel allowing you to get everywhere. Room is very comfortable. Great shower. Very good breakfast (don't purchase before hand- in the room you'll find a loyalty card which when filled out gives you 50% off) with different tastes catered for through the large selection. Service great - I emailed them from room asking to print off my BA Boarding Pass and 2 minutes later someone was at the door. Only thing at all negative is the internet access - have to purchase T Mobile Hotspot sessions (Unsecure), which I had to keep buying despite logging out each time. Would be great if the hotel could provide its own secure internet connection which you could purchase. I bought via hotwire.com 2 days before and got room for 59euro per night, far cheaper than elsewhere on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheBee99
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in an ideal location for sightseeing. The staff could not have been more helpful, and I would recommend staying on "The Level" for the excellent amenity of the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wilbur67
Reviews.Content: I cant recommend this hotel enough. It's in a fantastic location and the front of house staff are superb. The facilities are excellent too. My only complaint was about the very slow level of service between courses in the Cafe Madrid. However, the service int he tapas bar more than made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant birthday in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Stace15
Reviews.Content: This hotel really surpassed our expectations. We booked it on the basis of the reviews on here and really were not disappointed. The room was modern, and spotless, with all mod cons. The breakfast buffet had everything you could need. The hotel staff were accommodating on several requests - to book a restaurant for one evening, to print off boarding passes. And also as we were celebrating a birthday whilst staying, a friend organised a bottle of champagne to be left in the room, they delivered this request on the day of my birthday which was lovely. We also ate one meal in the tapas bar which I would defintely recommend. The hotel is close to all the great shops and restaurants that Berlin has to offer. We loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: markhenry2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, right in the center on Alexanderstrasse, very close to a train station and along the Spree river. Just make sure your room is not on main street side and you will be extremely happy: size of the room and bathroom, comfort, cleanliness, kindness of a helpful and well trained staff. Affordable prices if you book in advance. Internet is somewhat too expensive though. We'v been staying at this hotel every year since 2009.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stephanie g
Reviews.Content: staff at the hotel were exceptionally polite, friendly and helpful, rooms very spacious, beds extremely comfortable, bathroom spotless - only negatives were no tea & coffee making facilities and some noise from the trams outside (but to be fair this was pretty minimal) would stay there again. excellent location - walking distance to Unter den Linten, Brandenburg Gate Reichstag and shops. if flying to Schoenfeld i would highly recommend taking the train to the city - it is only 3 euros and stops at the main stations through the city - the Melia Hotel is less than a minute walk from Freidrichstrase Station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LittleEmma1978
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin is a lovely hotel in central Berlin, in a great location for visiting many of the sights! The staff are friendly and welcoming from the outset. I stayed in a Junior Suite, which was lovely. Big bed, extremely comfortable. Great bathroom with separate bath, shower and WC. The whole room was very clean and everything felt new and fresh. Buffet breakfast was good - a large selection of hot and cold food to choose from. Under half an hour in a taxi from Tegel airport, and close to Freidrichstrasse train station for travel to Schoenefeld. Would definitely stay there again if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, level service was great!”
Reviews.Author: Ronald-on-Tour
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, stayed whit new years eve what is à little bit expensive. The room on the level floor is worth the money. Only thing negative... Too hot in the rooms. Great and cheap tapas restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely city, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 263nimbus
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed a hotel before & have stayed in many luxury ones including Claridges, & George V, but this hotel just has something special at a very reasonable price even the room service was good value. Spotless rooms, most comfortable beds ever, friendly staff, great selection at breakfast incl.a dedicated egg chef & my favourite but unfortunately only discovered on last day - white & rose carva. Fantastic location with room overlooking the River Spree, lively tapas bar, pianist in lounge. And this is all before we explored Berlin which we absolutely loved. Not sure if they are still offering this deal but we also got a voucher for 15euros per person per night which they took off our final bill (we thought it would only be for their resturant meals). So that was the mini bar & room service covered! Can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schmitt663
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2012 while attending trade show at Messe Berlin. Great location for local sights and convenient access via public transport at the Freidrichstrasse station located 1 block from the hotel. Direct line right to Berlin Messe. Great breakfast buffet and really nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at Melia”
Reviews.Author: hopsolla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel during the middle of January. Everything about the hotel is clean, professional and well run. Staff are very friendly and keen to help. We speak a small amount of German however the staff we spoke to speak perfect English. Our room was on Floor 7, the executive part of the hotel called "The Level". The room was extremely clean, very comfortable and well decorated. Breakfast and snacks throughout the day was served in the executive lounge, again staff were extremely helpful and keen to talk to us. The hotel's location could not be any more perfect. Berlin has an amazing transport system and Friedrichstrasse S-Bahn and U-Bahn station is only a short 2 minute walk from the hotel's main entrance. Berlin's Schoenefeld Airport is approx 30 minutes to the hotel via train using the R2 or R7 line- getting off at Friedrichstrasse. From Friedrichstrasse, you can get to virtually every major tourist landmark using the S-Bahn or U-Bahn. The hotel gave us a free city map also containing the city's S-Bahn and U-Bahn routes. This was very handy and much needed to get around the city easily. Staff were willing to give us their recommendations for nice restaurants, however there are plenty to choose from in the area. We were very impressed with the Melia and will certainly not hesitate in returning if we visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: F E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Melia was perfect for our long weekend in Berlin, especially the location. The room was large, with a lovely bathroom. The only thing missing was a tea/coffee making facility. We managed to get a very reduced rate for the three nights we stayed, so it was definitely worth the money. We did not go for the €22 breakfast, instead we just went to one of the many cares which offer great breakfast for much less money. Another minus is the lack of free wifi in the rooms. On the plus side, it was very quiet, comfortable, we enjoyed the pillow menu, and service was friendly and efficient,

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinfjlewis
Reviews.Content: this is a great location to explore Berlin - a short walk to the metro . rooms were modern , clean and of a good size . if i go to berlin again i would happliy stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KCrC2011
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel. On advice from other Trip Advisors we paid the extra and stayed on "The Level" which gave you late check out, drinks each evening, private breakfast room and was just wonderful. It is a great location as you can walk everywhere - Checkpoint Charlie, wall, Topography of Terror, Reichstag, Unten den Linden etc. But it is also next to Fredrichstrasse U and S Station for transport links. The staff were always very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with a spanish touch”
Reviews.Author: ludo_swinnen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 3 day business trip with some time for some sightseeing. The hotel has a perfect location if you want to enjoy Berlin.The Brandenburger Tor, the Bundestag, the Museumsinsel...all the hot spots you can visit on foot. If you turn the other way, you are near the super store Kadewe and the Gendarmenmarkt and most theaters. And for other locations, the Metro and the S Bahn are 5 minutes away. The reception staff are friendly and have solutions for every problem. The rooms are comfortable with a very nice bathroom. The breakfast is included in the room price and offers everything your might desire. Melia belongs to a spanish hotel chain and this gave a special flair to my stay. There is an excellent tapas restaurant in the hotel, the rooms are decorated with pictures with spanish topics and there is often Spanish in the air but everybody also speaks German and English of course. I took an room on the executive floor. This just costs a little more and you can enjoy the executive lounge for breakfast and snacks the rest of the day. In short, Hotel Melia Berlin is an excellent choice when visiting this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the best hotels to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep M
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, I booked this hotel for my 2 night visit to Berlin with a friend. I managed to get a very good rate as I booked it as a Top Secret hotels through a site famous for its last minute deals, but I believe it is to the expensive side if you book directly. An elegant hotel right in the famous shopping street in Berlin. Many major attractions are just walking distance from the hotel and if you don't fancy walking, train station is only a two minute walk from the hotel. We did not eat from the main restaurant but tried the Tapas bar one evening and it was great. I am planning to go to Berlin again (in summer) and if I can get a good deal, I would love to stay there again. If you happen to be in the area, don't forget to try the Café Friedrichs 106 on the other side of the river which serve excellent breakfast and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my 5 year anniversary with my boyfriend and as everyone says, the location is fantastic (right next to the Freidrichstrasse station and in a very central location), the rooms are very large and modern and the staff at reception were very helpful and welcoming. There are two restaurants in the hotel, the tapas bar and a more upmarket pricey restaurant upstairs. When we stayed there they had an offer of 15 euros per person per night to spend in the hotel, so we had the 5 course meal on offer at the latter and it was excellent, with a table with a lovely view over the river. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: h00ked0ntravel
Reviews.Content: Melia Berlin is very well located. Only 3 minutes walk to the Friedrichstrasse S-Bahn/ U-Bahn station and there were many eateries around the area. There was also a supermarket, food outlets and a postal office at the S-Bahn station which was very useful. Being located on Friedrichstrasse meant that you were only about 10-15mins walk away from the designer shops on Friedrichstrasse including Quartier 206 and Galeries Lafayette. Museum island was a 10 min walk away and we actually walked all the way to Alexanderplatz from Museum island thereafter. We had a room overlooking the Spree. The room was well furbished and we liked it very much. It was most amazing to be able to open the balcony room doors at night to check out the night scenery and also, just before we checked out of the hotel, it started snowing in Berlin, so it was like having front row seats to the surrounding area turning white with snow within a matter of minutes. The only minor blemish in the stay was when we requested for a taxi at point of check out. The porter had gone off with some luggages for other guests so we checked at the front desk. The front desk pointed us to the taxi which was sitting out in the cold but when we got out there, there was no taxi driver. I went back in to check with the front desk again for a taxi, but the lady told me to go out there and just wait. We waited for 5-10 mins to no avail (driver was nowhere to be found) and we ended up running onto the main road to hail our own taxi. We are not prima donnas and are perfectly capable of getting our own taxis - but just that, at that point it felt as no one from the hotel / front desk could be bothered with us the moment we stepped out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: AS1986 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good stay in the Melia. The room view wasnt the best however the good rooms compensatyed for this. When booking, I was almost certain that easytobook had said immediate payment was required becasue of the special rate. At checkout we had to pay our rate, but upon checkin my bank account, at booking we were not charged. So all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyJoyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I booked the Melia Hotel after reading the good reviews on Tripadvisor, and also because it is close to Friederichstrasse train station, which looked fairly straightforward to reach from the airport on the train. We were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is well located in "The Mitte", 5 minutes walk from Museum Island, The Reichstag and the Brandemburg Gate. The hotel can be reached fairly easily from the airport by the express train (25-40 mins depending on whether the train is direct) - that said, I researched the times and numbers of the trains before we left the UK, and I am pleased I did as it was not that obvious at the airport which train to get. Our room was very clean and pleasantly furnished with a lovely bathroom. The beds were a little soft for our liking, but the linen was very clean and good quality, with a variety of different pillow types. Our room cost an average of £70 per night (we were there 3 nights over half term) excluding breakfast, which I thought was very reasonable given the standard of the hotel. Breakfast was initially priced at 22 euros per person per day, which we declined, as this is well above what I am prepared to pay. However, after discussion with the staff on reception, we found that if we applied for a "Mas" card (the hotel chain reward scheme - free to join), breakfast was discounted to 11 euros. We thought this a pretty good deal, and I have to say the breakfast was of a very high standard. I could have scoffed the whole fresh bread table! As we booked the room direct through the hotel website, we also benefitted from a special offer of 15 euros per person per day to spend in the hotel (excluding breakfast). We ate in the tapas bar one night, and spent the rest on drinks in the bar, both of which were very nice. There was even a pianist playing one night which I love. Unfortunately, the following night they screened the football in the bar instead, but this did at least please my husband! Staff were helpful and friendly, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGP
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good reviews and I can see why Location: right in the middle of mitte, perfectly located for all the sights, good restaurants, pubs, shopping. By the river as well. As someone else said, the trams are noisy going past, but they were here long before the hotel, so not sure what you expect them to do about that! Easy to get to the hotel, the TXL bus stops nearby, there are also tube stops very close. Rooms: Room was spacious and comfortable. I was in a normal room, not the level, but was still excellent. Only minor gripe was lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room and the choice of TV channels was rather limited. But then again, you probably are better off going out the hotel anyway I ate in the Tapas restaurant and it was excellent, Didn't eat in the other restaurant, Breakfast choice was large and was excellent. Service generally was excellent on check in and out. I took advantage of the 15 euro per day offer, be warned they need the actual print out with the booking number, and you claim it back when you check out so make sure to mention it as they won't take it off automatically. All in all an excellent hotel, Berlin is a great city and if I did come back I would recommend staying here again,

Reviews.Title: “4* Hotel with no free Internet.... in 2012... not even in the Lobby... "this Hotel is dead to me!"”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M
Reviews.Content: Melia is a great hotel, especially if you like Spain, or Spanish influence. The bar is expensive and the tapas are not any good. But the rest of the hotel is great, good location, calm, good staff, ok room.... but for me the worst is internet.... I mean really, come on!! 2012 and the internet cost a fortune per minutes, or hour or day. And they do not even have free machine in the Lobby!!!!! So for me this hotel goes from 5 to 3. Give me free internet and then it is in the top of my list in Berlin. Not only they obviously try to steal money for you with the internet prices, but the all thing just give a bad image to the hotel. "Come to hotel Melia, we are nice and professional but we are trying to get as much money from you as we can". From 4* and all around the world internet must be free, and of story! People need to Skype their girlfriend, read the news from their home country, send a business email, explore a card before going around in the city, download a map, upload Facebook pictures to share the good trip with the community, etc, etc, etc, in few word 2012! So Melia I will come back to Berlin but never to you because of your greedy internet move (Also the bar ;) )

Reviews.Title: “Nice but for one thing...”
Reviews.Author: johnshaft2000
Reviews.Content: A quick review as most things about this hotel have already been said. The location is great and the facilities are very nice and of a good quality. The only thing that wasn't great was noise. We were on the 2nd floor and with a street view. When trams go past they are quite loud and you can hear people on the street heading home after merry making. It wasn't enough to make use ask to be moved but was a touch annoying. Overall though this is a good hotel and I'd be more than happy to stay here again but might ask for a room away from the street or by the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: dopeycrazy2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Melia Berlin for our honeymoon in June 2011. We had a lovely river view from our room. The hotel is very conveniently placed in Berlin with the S-Bahn and U-Bahn nearby for easy access to all Berlin has to offer. The staff was friendly and polite. They sent a complementary bottle of champagne to our room when they realized it was our honeymoon, Currency exchanges could be made right at the front desk. Inexpensive rates were available for internet use in the lobby. Taxi service could also be arranged for with ease at the front desk. We also included the breakfast package in our plan which was very reasonable. The selection was great and it saved us money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Little_laura
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Melia Berlin for 4 nights before Christmas 2011 to visit the Christmas markets. The hotel is well located on the river Spree and very close to the Friedrichstrasse U/S Bahn station; however we walked everywhere we visited with ease. The Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz, Potsdamerplatz and Checkpoint Charlie were all within reach on foot. We had a standard room facing the street which was spotlessly clean. The noise from the street was not a problem, the only sound you could heard was the tram occasionally in the background, but not enough to cause annoyance. The rooms must be well sound proofed as during our entire stay not once did we hear another guest even walk down the corridor. The room was cleaned daily with new linen available daily if you so wished. Also available were a selection of pillows from a "pillow menu" - I didn't make use of this myself. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, so much so I checked the mattress name before leaving! We didn't eat in the restaurant of drink in the bar as we spent a lot of time at the Christmas markets - which I would also recommend, but everything looked good. The Melia Berlin is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at and I would recommend it to anyone considering a trip to the fantastic city of Berlin, I certainly hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The breakfast/brunch was very nice. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The room was big enough and very quiet and comfortable. The location is perfect, with nice views of the river, close tosightseeing points of interest, restaurants, shops and very close to the train

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: SXR101
Reviews.Content: We were ripped off when the bill came for this hotel. We had cancelled one night and rearranged another several weeks before. When it came to the bill we were charged full price for BOTH nights! We were told we were not allowed to cancel as we had 'booked on a promotion'. We had NOT booked on any promotion and had paid full price. We pointed this out, spoke to the management but they refused to listen. This was when the hotel was half empty in December too. Very disappointed and will not be staying at any Melia chain hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Rune&B
Reviews.Content: Modern spacious rooms. Everythin you need, maybe except wi-fi. We didn't have breakfast included, so I can't say anything about the food, but the dining area looked good. It's easy to fint hotels with good value in Berlin. Melia has a good location for most thingd.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous, stylish hotel in a terrific location...”
Reviews.Author: GRSimpson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very stylish room with excellent facilities. Super comfortable beds (very quiet, too, so great sleeps) and a cracker bathroom - with heated floor. And there was a safe - something really underestimated by hoteliers and in 9 months of traveling in USA and Europe, too few hotels had them... 4 nights in Berlin in one of the coldest snaps for many years and the Melia was a welcoming place to come back to after long days out sight-seeing in this wonderful city. The staff were friendly in that formal German way and very professional and helpful. Brilliant central location on Friedrichstrasse, near the River Spree and Unter den Linden and the best destinations. Across the road from a Bahnhof where you can hook into the excellent Berlin U-Bahn. We also got a very good online deal which included 30 euros a day to spend on food and drink in the hotel or from room service. The first night we enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine in the very pleasant bar in the lobby and the other nights we ordered from room service. With the very cold weather (one night a record of -19C) this was a good option. We prefer to go out and don't often order from room service - not usually a fan, but the food was really excellent. A good chef and brigade at work. Thanks Melia - we loved Berlin and a big part of that enjoyment was staying with you. Not an example of the sterility that comes with a hotel chain in any way. Spanish influence, perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “Great all-round”
Reviews.Author: Wireless2000
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel with all boxes checked. Good location, new hotel, great staff and good sized room and bathroom. Had dinner at the tapas restaurant which was also a pleasant experience. Seems to get a lot of external locals as guests. Breakfast buffet also good, missing fresh orange juice but them most hotels don't have it either. Did not check out gym on the top floor. Great value for the price, but them most Berlin hotels seems to be affordable compared to other major European cities.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL IN THE HEART OF THE FUN!”
Reviews.Author: SarahG1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Melia Berlin on The Level during our honeymoon. The bed is unbelievably comfortable! The hotel is incredible with views of the river. The breakfast buffet on The Level was delicious. I highly recommend The Level if it is in your price budget. We used their laundry service while we were there and the clothing was returned same day in a neat little package. We could not have been happier. The best part of Melia Berlin is that we walked to all of the main attractions! Everything is within walking distance! I give Melia Berlin a true 5-star! We loved the Melia brand so much that we cancelled our room reservation in Paris and booked through Melia (again, another 5-star experience).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience from check-in to Checkout”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were not disappointed with our stay. The lady on the from desk was amazingly helpful and friendly, and gave us all the information we could have wanted for our stay. Room - After a disappointing stay in Paris I even did a little dance when we got to our spacious room with a beautiful view over the river. Breakfast - In addition to this the breakfasts were amazing. The biggest buffet I have ever seen. Naturally a huge selection of fresh bread. But also loads of hot food and even eggs cooked to order. If I ever go back to Berlin I would not even bother looking at somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: morts109
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times, always for business. The hotel is very stylish, tastefully so and they have a great Spanish restaurant which doubles up as a bar. Location is excellent, rooms are comfortable and breakfast and lunches (with our meeting) were fab. Staff always friendly and professional and always try and meet your personal needs - quiet room for example .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding new hotel in Central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 737av8tor
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect: right next to the Freidrichstrasse station on the river bank about 800 metres north of Checkpoint Charlie. The rooms are large, quiet and comfortable with well equipped bathrooms. We didn't have breakfast but did use the bar which also serves food. Bar prices are the same as the local bars which is unusual for a hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Only minor drawback that I could possibly find is the lack of free wifi, but that really is being picky: very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean comfortable hotel with very friendly pleasant staff. If we were to return to Berlin would definately look at staying here again and would definately recommend to a friend. The hotel is close to the main attractions in Berlin with many places to eat close by as well as the restaurant in the hotel. The subway is very close by, but make sure before you go that you get a decent underground map. Any that we came across were hard to read which made using the underground not so easy to use. You can also purchase a ticket that allows you to use the trains, underground, buses and trams for a certain number of days, making it easier not to have to buy tickets each time. Definately a very safe area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the Center of Town”
Reviews.Author: Rick_On_The_Road
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days after Christmas visiting Berlin and selected the Melia based on other Trip Advisor recommendations. We're very glad we did. This is a hotel that KNOWS how important all of the little details are to its guests. Everything, from the time we checked in until the time we checked out was, without exception, an excellent experience. First, the hotel is located where the Friedrichstrasse crosses the Spree River, so there are lovely views of boats and small barges moving up and down the river. It is almost across the street from the Museum Island where many of Berlin's most famous museums and the Dom cathedral are located. It is within walking distance of Unter den Linden street with shopping and Humboldt University nearby, and if you are energetic, you can walk to the Brandenburg Gate and back again. The staff was exceptional, multi-lingual and service oriented. On arrival, we received complimentary bottles of mineral water and cookies from the kitchen. Whenever a small glitch happened (arriving too early for check-in, a broken plumbing fixture, recovering a lost cane), the staff was there immediately to assist and professional. We stayed on "the Level" (room 749) with its concierge floor and private breakfast room. It was well worth the extra money spent. The view out over the Spree river with sunsets over the city was great. Breakfasts were well appointed and the quality and service were very good. We were able to use the computers to check on our email, and at 6:00 there were appetizers and an open bar. Every morning an international newspaper (written in your native language) appeared on your door handle. The quality of the fixtures and furnishings in the rooms was top. The beds were turned down every night and the linens were SO comfortable. Everything was very clean and well maintained. After our visit I filled in the hotel's on-line review and received a very timely and personal response from a hotel employee commenting on my remarks (This is something no other hotel has done that I can remember). So, overall, it was a very good experience and a hotel I will definitely come back to again when I visit Berlin again. That being said, the downside of

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Koss333
Reviews.Content: Close to U-bahn and very close to many highlights of Berlin. Got a very good deal online at the Melia website itself. Highly recommended if you like staying in hotels! Forgot my shoes, where shipped to the Netherlands within a week.

Reviews.Title: “City to see!”
Reviews.Author: HannaMIsrael
Reviews.Content: Going to Berlin was a fantastic experience. It is after all a rebuilt city. The new arcitecture is amazing, the museums wonderful, not to be missed! The woods beautiful. Our hotel, the melia Berlin, excellent. The food is good. And to top it, it is not expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the international traveller”
Reviews.Author: LuqmanU
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin is an excellent hotel for the international traveller. Room tariffs are very reasonable at EUR 140 for the LEVEL floors, during my stay in early Dec, 2011. However, I had to cancel my advance booking at EUR 200+ and rebook again just a few days before my travel in order to get the better rates. Which was a bit strange to say the least. LEVEL rooms come with a few frills such as free drinks, snacks, internet in the lounge and priority checkout. Online booking makes you eligible for free coupons worth EUR 15 per person per day, which can be used for a couple of burgers or one main course at hotel rates. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful even. They speak english too. Rooms, beds, toilets are all top class. TV doesnt offer much for the non european traveeler. The room came with iron and ironboard which came in handy for me. Location is great. Friedrichstrasse U-6 station across the road is a major interchange with both S and U bahn. The station offers wide choice of eateries at very affordable rates. Complimentary breakfast is pretty good and more or less standard continental fare. Location is excellent and very suitable for the window shopper. The Brandeburg Tor is just a brisk walk away or a couple of stations away on the S bahn. Many other places of interest are also close by and easily reachable by trains. The Day Ticket can come in prettty handy. Restaurant BOMBAY which is just a minute's walk over the bridge across the river, offers very good indian cuisine at very reasonable rates. Generous portions ensure that two main courses can easily feed three people. Hope you find this review useful and enjoy your stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay and still quality”
Reviews.Author: Karen90
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin for 3rd new year in row. Always stayed in this hotel. Great location, friendly staff. stay on level and get free drinks and snacks in exclusive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: HungerfordSharky
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin In December to see the Christmas markets. The hotel could not be in a better location with easy access to all the major sites including Brandenburg Gate etc. There are at least 4 big markets within easy reach of the Hotel. The metro/train station is right outside the hotel on Friederichstrasse and access to the airport couldn't be simpler. You simply hop on the airport express at Friederichstrasse and get the train all the way to Schoenefeld airport. The hotel itself is very clean and modern inside. The bar serves lovely cocktails in the evening but it is a bit pricey. I have no complaints about the hotel or location at all. We had a very enjoyable stay. If you like being in a good location with easy access to all amenities as well as quality accomodation, this Hotel is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant New Year's stay at the Melia”
Reviews.Author: JJJR
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an enjoyable two nights' stay at the Melia in Berlin. We had two adjoining rooms, one of which was a "Guestroom" with a little bit more space, more closet room, and a large bathroom, including a wonderful corner shower and an oversized bathtub. The shower heads were delightful. This room was not particularly cheap. The adjoining room was a bit simpler with less storage space and just a normal bathroom with a regular sized tub. Both rooms were spacious and comfortable. I liked the large beds very much. The walls must be very thick, as we didn't hear hardly a peep from anyone else anywhere, and this over new year's! A particular highlight for me, as someone who loves sleeping amidst many pillows: the pillow menu! You could order up a variety of special pillows at no extra charge: a neck support one, a dinkel one, one with some kind of wood pellets that was very firm and comfortable, a lavender one, an anti-allergic one, and a couple others. Fantastic! Breakfast was plentiful, fresh, and delicious. My little boys liked the soft pretzels very much while I enjoyed the roll selection and fat, fluffy croissants. The location is wonderful, right on the lively Friedrichstraße, a one-minute walk to the subway, and along the canal. It's easy to walk to Unter den Linden and the Brandenburger Tor, not to mention the Bundestag area. Alexanderplatz and Potsdamer Platz are also a reasonable distance away. If you don't want to eat at the hotel, there are many other possibilities within a few blocks. We all had a good time and would be glad to return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Deb500Midlands
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend to Berlin and stayed at the Melia. Couldn't fault it. The hotel was comfortable with helpful and friendly staff. Best of all, the location was perfect. Minutes from train and subway stations, but also on a main shopping street with Checkpoint Charlie and the Berlin Wall within easy walking distance. We ate tapas in the restaurant one night and used the bar a few times, both were excellent. We breakfasted locally as there was such a huge choice of places and breakfasts. Giving great value for money as well, couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - 50% Discount for breakfast- Free trasport to Tegel”
Reviews.Author: YS_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three days. The hotel is location on the main streat FriedrichStrase. You can find MacDonalds, Starbucks and many shops 5 minutes from the hotel. I booked a standard room without breakfast (since our flight was very early in the morning). The reseption guy told me to sign to mas card www.solmelia.com do get discount on breakfast. The card gives 25% discount on upgrade to a superior room or 50% discount on breakfast ON THE FIRST STAY. The breakfast is fantastic, huge choices not a regular breakfast for the hotels. BTW - there is a free bus from the Tegel airport (bus TXL) to the city and stops very close to the hotel. Taxi from the airport to Melia - 17euro.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Berlin, absolut wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: kajcopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This time we got an juniorsuite with view to River Spree and it is absolut a really good room about 45 m2. We never got so a wonderfull room, breakfast is absolut the best we have. We are sure that Melia Berlin is absolut a high class hotel and Berlin in december with all the christmasmarket is so beatefull.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, spacious rooms, top location!”
Reviews.Author: Arietta183
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned from a holiday trip to Berlin, We stayed 5 nights at Melia Berlin, after a friend recommented it to us. The hotel is in the Mitte, Berlin's center, right in front of U/S undreground stations. All major attractions are within short walking distance. From Parizer Platz to Alexanderplatz and from the Raichstag to Museum island, you won't need to walk more than 15 mins. Also many top designers shops and good restaurants are around. Our room, a double standard, was huge and with wonderful views over Spree river. The bed was so wide and comfortable, a sofa and two armchairs, a table and a desk! Also spacious and ergonomic bathroom. We had informed the hotel when we booked it, that we were staying in Berlin for our anniversary and we were so pleased to find a personalised card and some sweets for our anniversary. Also on st Nicholas day, we fould a gingerbread house waiting for us in our room. Small details like this add another plus to this great 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice if you don't mind spending more than average”
Reviews.Author: minoshag
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Berlin are really affordable, especially comparing to other European capitals, such as Rome, Paris and London. Generally Berlin offers a great deal of bargains. Melia hotel isn't a bargain ( about 125€ a double per night in July ) but I still recommend it to anyone who wants to have a good time in Berlin. With a nice view of the river, it's a few metres from Friedrichstraße station and at an excellent spot wherever you want to go. We stayed at a clean, spacious room, bright and nicely decorated. Cleaning service was rather slow - one day we returned at about 6:30pm and our room wasn't made up yet. The reception was helpful and if you know spanish, then that's an advantage, since I think all speak spanish. But then doesn't that apply to all Melia hotels? You 'd better book through the hotel's site since this way you might get a 15€ daily voucher.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: eddie2558
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on the 7th floor and used the excellent facilities in the "Level Club" which provides a great selection of light snacks and alcoholic beverages throughout the day completely free of charge. Standard of room was excellent with ample space and attention to detail. All members of staff were friendly, helpful and highly professional. Location is perfect for getting around all the attractions due to proximity of train station for U-Bahn and S-Bahn routes and within walking distance of Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag to name but a few. Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value especially when on sale”
Reviews.Author: mmj55
Reviews.Content: We had our first stay with this hotel chain at the Melia Berlin in August for 5 days, and were very pleased with the whole experience. First, it is on Friedrichstrasse, right in the centre of Berlin Mitte, and about 300 yards from a subway entrance. It is situated on the bank of the river Spree, and you can walk to the Reichstag from it - a leisurely walk along the river, about 20 mins. Taking the subway is the easiest way to get around, and from this location everything is in easy distance. The hotel itself is well maintained and the staff were extremely helpful. We started off with a regular room as a bed and breakfast, but, about 3 weeks before we left Canada, I went to the web site and found they had a sale on. We were able to get the special executive floor called The Level for less than the regular room, so we changed our booking. This was the best thing we did. The Level is on the 7th floor, and has a private breakfast room, with an extensive buffet, and made to order egg dishes. During the afternoon, it is a lovely quiet lounge where you can have a drink (included) and then at 6pm they have Tapas (it is a Spanish chain) which were excellent, and made it unnecessary for us to go out to find a restaurant that first night. They were plentiful and tasty. In the room the furnishings were smart and comfortable (my husband wanted me to buy a duvet just like the ones we had at Melia!) and there were tea and coffee making supplies. All in all this is a lovely, well situated, well run, comfortable hotel, which is even greater when they give a special on The Level. It would be sensible for hotels to give deals on their special rooms more often, as this visit certainly has me sold on returning to the Melia chain, and looking at rooms in The Level category.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Caroline12349
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Melia Berlin Hotel one night for a business meeting the next day. The hotel is very clean and modern. The reception staff are very helpful and patient. There is a tapas bar in the hotel, with a very good atmosphere. We were given a 30 euro voucher to spend in the bar. Breakfast good, and also in a good location, within short walking distance of the trains. Would highly recommend this hotel, and stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent starting point to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SvetlanaM
Reviews.Content: Placed strategically in the upper part of Friedrichstrasse, Melia Hotel is an excellent place to start your walks through Berlin. For those fond of exploring cities on foot, Melia provides a spot from where you can plan al your daily trips. The room price includes breakfast, which has a great variety of food, fresh fruits, cereals, etc. Rooms are spacy enough, very clean and well maintained. The only things I was not particularly impressed with were that wi-fi internet is charged (EUR 20 for 10 hrs! - which, to be fair, you can use during the course of your stay, you just have to bear in mind to turn off the wi-fi option on your smart phones, iPads etc.). The problem is if you are on a business trip, internet connection is something you really need. Also, the only English programs on TV are BBC and CNN, for all others you have to pay EUR 5). I think that, for a hotel of this category, these services could be complimentary).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda101
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the hotel Melia with my boyfriend at the beginning of November in order to attend an interview nearby. The hotel is in a great central location ideal for exploring the city and close to plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. We were allocated a room over looking the river and found it to be extremely well sound proofed both from the noise out on the street and from other rooms. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were spacious and absolutely spotlessly clean, furnishings were modern and looked to be recently updated though being a chain hotel the room lacked character and really could have been anywhere in the world. The staff we encountered were efficient and spoke impeccable English and on the most part were very friendly. As we booked early the price was very reasonable and my rating is based on that, I'm not sure I would have happily paid the rack rate as for that price I would have expected something a little more special. Over all we had a very relaxing and stress free stay and would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SwissWI
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a three day business trip in a clean and comfortable room. I have chosen a room towards the backyard to have it quiet. The situation of the hotel within walking distance to the "Museumsinsel" with Bode and Pergamon museum but also not too far from the "Reichstag" and Bahnhof Friedrichstrasse makes it a perfect location to explore former East Berlin. Staff was extremely discrete at a point one would almost think of them being ignorant of your presence! Anyway perfect place to spend a few days exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Huttiheita
Reviews.Content: Melia hotel was centrally located in Mitte. The hotel was good compared to just 170 euro for 2 night without breakfast. I asked for a room with a view over the river , which i got. Heard a little from the traffic, but not much. I would recommend a room with a view over the river. The room itself was big and spacious with a large bath and a bathtube. Nothing to complain about there. If you use their own homepage to order the room ( was the same price as the other hotels site) you can get a voucher for 15 euro pr night pr person to spend on the minibar or the restaurant. ( the minibar was very expensive, so good to have some free euros there )

Reviews.Title: “Conceirge team”
Reviews.Author: Warka
Reviews.Content: i am event planners in one of the big companies in middle east i arranged to send groub of guests to Melia Berlin but there was no activtes arranged for this group at all but Mr.Fragner in the conceirge team was very helpfull and arragned a full program for them ...the group came back from their trip and they are very happy will the whole program so i thinnk Melia Berlin is lucky to have Mr.Fragner and his team working for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jewol
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family group one week ago and found the hotel to provide a great base for our 3 nights and exceeded our expectations. The location is ideal, in easy walking distance to many tourist spots, next to a rail station for easy connection to Schonefeld airport and overlooking the river where there are cruise boats (or for pleasent walking). We stayed on the Level which provided extra facilities i.e. the Lounge, that was worth the higher room rate.Luckily, having booked direct with Melia, we also enjoyed a hotel promotion that allowed upto 30Euro per room discount each day on hotel charges, which we managed to use in the bar and in the enjoyable tapas restaurant which has live music a couple of nights each week (Thursday currently being one). Even though the hotel was full, the internal facing Level rooms were really quite and the lounge area was never crowded, with good choice in the evening of complimentarty tapas and drinks. Staff were very helpfull and frieindly. We experienced no problems during our stay and would definitely consider this hotel again plus consider Melia hotels in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Central very good hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dalaroe
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotels I have stayed in, in Berlin. It is situated very well, quite close to Unter dem Linden. The rooms are excellent and I have seldom slept so well in a central hotel in a European capital. Very comfortable beds and quiet rooms with responsive air-condition. Don't miss the breakfast buffé, not the biggest but fresh, well organized and tasty. A hotel worth to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: 171999cathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Melia Berlin for four nights the beginning of October. We have previously stayed in the melia chain of hotels and agin this prompted us to choose this hotel. The hotel is right in the heart of Berlin with tram and underground transport just a few meters from the hotel. We got a direct train the schonefeld express to the airport from the station.There are fabulous restuarants near the hotel.I cant remember the name of one, the grill I think..it was along the riverbank down steps. A reservation is needed and it is a little pricey but really worth the treat.There is lots to do in Berlin and Max at the concierge desk answered by emails prior to travelling and recommended some really good shows. We went to YMA it a short walk from the hotel and Max choose us good seat tickets without paying extra for tickets up front.The staff are very friendly and so helpful. The rooms very comfortable and clean. We had a room on the 6th floor facing the river spree. We had drinks and dessert in the cafe it was lovely..very nice cocktails.We booked through the melia website and got €30 worth of vouchers to spead each day in the hotel...a lovely extra! I would have no problem staying at this hotel again or recommending it. Thank you Melia Berlin for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: DrJohnChris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights early October. Very near Friedrichstrasse station and next to River Spree, 5 mins walk from the Reichstag. Very good location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was fine and exactly the cost of the internet booking - no hidden extras. We paid 548 euros for 4 nights including breakfast (very good buffet). The room was fine and we really have no grumbles. Would stay there again. I went to a conference and my wife enjoyed the city with local friends. Travel to the conference at the ICC was very easy on the S bahn. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location, Wonderful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: amelia9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia Berlin for 7nights in early Oct 2011. The location of this hotel is perfect, right in the Mitte area on Friedrichstrasse. The train station is literally a few steps from the hotel with connections all over the city of Berlin and beyond, including a train to Schonefeld Airport. Museum Island is very close to the hotel (approx 7mins walking). There are loads of shops and restaurants nearby as Friedrichstr. is one of the main streets in Berlin. On check-in we were informed by a very friendly lady that we had been upgraded to a premium room due to a problem we had encountered when making our booking - this gesture showed that this hotel cares about their guests' experience and we really appreciated this indeed. Our room was a very large clean room with full length french windows overlooking the River Spree. It had a king size bed, minibar, desk, great lighting, large wardrobe, safe and a nice bathroom with shower over the bath and a bidet. The toiletries were replaced daily and bed linen was changed when requested. We received a complimentary bottle of water daily and an english newspaper on certain days. There was also a pillow menu from which you could choose from 5 different types of pillows. Although you could hear the grumble of passing trains with the busy station so close, it was not an issue for us and we slept well despite this. The Tapas Bar on the ground floor was very nice indeed and a popular lively spot, as was the lounge. I must mention the location again - very central with everything at your fingertips including supermarkets, restaurants, shops and Museums, perfect IMO. However, the best hing about this hotel for me was the Staff who were most helpful and kind at all times. The receptionist who checked us in (Ms. Rodriguez, I believe) was so very pleasant and helpful and also inquired on how we enjoyed our stay when we were leaving. I have stayed at many Melia hotels in Europe and they are all of a high quality if a little expensive, however I have to say the Melia Berlin wins hands down for excellent staff, great service and good value. I will absolutely return to stay at this hotel, in fact it intices me to return to Berlin ust to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good vibe.”
Reviews.Author: kvanniko
Reviews.Content: I spent about four days in Berlin on business and stayed at the Melia. Overall the place is very clean, fairly stylish, and comfortable. In the evenings it was easy to sneak out and see the sights of the center of the city. The only thing that was not ideal was parking fees - a flat 20euro per day which is additional to the normal hotel fees. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet at night (facing into the center courtyard). All in all an excellent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Neat.”
Reviews.Author: psychoactive
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Excellent location on Friedrichstrasse, VERY close to the Museum Island - Nice breakfast buffet - Comfortable rooms / bed - Very nice room amenities Contras: - No free internet (Telekom fee service) - Quite expensive hotel overall Next time I would rather stay in a more average hotel if I really wanna be located centrally, or rather pick a more splurge/luxury hotel even if not so conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city break”
Reviews.Author: rosita061
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin was a great choice for our recent 3 night city break. It has an excellent location in the Mitte District close to the underground station. The TXL bus from the airport stopped at only a short distance away on Unter Den Linden. Our room was comfortable and quiet with all the facilities expected of a hotel of this standard. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a good Tapas bar on the ground floor but the hotel is surrounded by lots of restaurants within walking distance. There is a fitness centre on the 8th floor for gym fanatics like me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ant_obrie
Reviews.Content: Very good service, Excellent location ten minutes walk to mayor attractions. One block to de metro station Surrounded by great places to eat

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Lara_M1
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels! The Melia Berlin was a fantastic hotel, with excellent service. We stayed in a junior suite room on the 8th floor which gave us access to the level room. This access meant we had free drinks, snacks and internet use throughout our stay. The actual hotel room was also great, spacious, large tv, and all the usual amenities you would expect. The hotel is also centrally located, walking distance to restaurants, river cruises and other attractions. And it was so helpful that it was located next to a train/metro station. After this stay, i plan to try other Melia hotels around europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CY_foodie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in this lovely and conveniently located hotel. The room was big and comfortable, we had a nice view of the river and the location was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: ikey1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia for 5 nights and it was a great stay. The hotel is very centrally located to the train station, to lots of restaurants, to the river and to the museums on the island. Even the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag are within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and the service overall was excellent. The concierge also made a great breakfast suggestion which became our staple, namely Einsteins. My only complaint is that wireless was not only not free but extremely expensive at 17-20 Euros per day. I still cannot figure out why the more expensive hotels all charge for wireless and yet the less expensive hotels do not. Otherwise i would recommend the Melia very highly.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: brindlenoi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia hotel for 2nights had a superb time.We had a room on the Level which gave access to the Executive Lounge.The drinks and snacks were plentyfull.The staff were very friendly and helpfull.The location is superb.1 minute from the railway and underground stations,easy walking distance to many attractions(be sure to have comfortable shoes. Overall a SUPERB hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy5
Reviews.Content: This Melia Berlin is one of the best! As rewards customers we had a room on The Level, with it's executive lounge. There was always fresh fruit, soft drinks and coffee to be had, and after 6 p.m.there were plentiful snacks and alcoholic drinks as well. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Our room was very pleasant with a very large bed with pillow menu. The hotel is situated in the middle of Berlin right beside the Bahnhof station and museums. The Reichstag and Brandenburg gate are a few minutes away. The Spanish Customer Relations Manageress is really lovely, and when I was unwell she was very caring, as were all the staff. There are restaurants nearby on the River Spree. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Unmistakably The Right Choice!”
Reviews.Author: samhayn
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Berlin and what a marvelous introduction to a superb city. The receptionists were friendly and willing to help. The Level executive lounge was magnificent. Choice of food and drinks was abundant and staff even provided some alternative foods on separate occasions due to my nut and seafood allergies! In a great location (shopping district) I cannot fault this hotel at all!!

Reviews.Title: “sauna on the roof - beatiful view, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dercharles
Reviews.Content: I visit the Melia frequently and I really love it. Visit the sauna on the roof with a beautiful view over Berlin. Also need to mention the excellent breakfast. Also the hotel is located in the middle of Berlin which has become a vivid centre of the city, right beside Bahnhof Friedrichstraße (palace od tears), 5 minutes walk from the famous Brandenburger Tor.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - best stay in Berlin so far!”
Reviews.Author: markus_sterky
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a busy business trip! Friedrichstrasse close to the Ubahn and Sbahn! The Level service on the 7th floor was impressive. Will stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Everything right!”
Reviews.Author: Perplex
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, great rooms, cleaning, and the quietest room I had for years! Even we had a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Mrpegs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Melia Berlin great hotel very clean good staff good location no real negatives only expensive breakfast so avoided I guess if you are on business this may or may not be of concern 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MainzSleeper
Reviews.Content: Great location, everything is close by. The rooms are very nice and the beds comfortable. Breakfast is superb but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: amidtheclouds
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful 10-day stay at the Melia in Berlin. The staff is friendly and helped us many times to locate various sites, restaurants, etc. around the city. The hotel is ideally located in a great neighborhood, close to Museum Island, and very near the S-bahn and U-bahn subway lines. The restaurant in the hotel is also extremely good; after having tapas there one night, we were prepared to many times...A hotel that's definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: jeff.francis
Reviews.Content: If you want a quality hotel in the centre of Berlin, this is a great place to stay, The staff are very helpful and always there when you need them, the room are immaculate and very well appointed. If you get the chance make sure you take the level package, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MsrMain
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay here. The important things for us were done so well. The beds were comfy with a selection of pillows for you to choose from, we had a decent size room for a 'standard room' - the bathroom was clean and unpokey. Breakfast we didn't try and there are heaps of yummy bakeries nearby. Such a perfect location, we were so pleased to find ourselves in the centre of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Jmrodriguezesq
Reviews.Content: Located near the train station and lots of good restaurants. The museums are also very close. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Melia Berlin best hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kajcopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Melia Berlin is a wonderfull hotel direct to River Spree and Friedrichsstrasse. We make our booking at Expedia homepage and upgrade to Level Room including breakfast, coffe, snacks, tapas in the evening with drinks. Room is very clean, and if you are going to Berlin go to Melia Berlin where you get a lot for your money.

Reviews.Title: “see you again soon”
Reviews.Author: angel729
Reviews.Content: good hotel worth the money and best service I ever meet.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable but rooms were so-so, will not return”
Reviews.Author: PacoandLupe
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel purely for its location PLUS it had reasonable rates during the dates we visited. Lucky for us because I don't think I would have paid their regular rates for a second stay. The lobby is definitely 4* but the rooms may need an upgrade soon. It was so hot&humid during the 3 days we were there and the A/C was not working. When we called reception, they were reluctant to send someone up to help asking us if "are you sure it's on?", "how long was it turned on?", "did you turn the dial the right way", etc... Finally, they sent a "technician". When that person came, we were certain she wouldn't be helpful. She kept turning the knobs back and forth and back and forth...and finally said, she couldn't do anything about it and that we had to wait until tomorrow for a technician to look at it. In the meantime, she said just to open the window (um, extreme traffic noise) and remove the comforters (what?). Ah, right! That was helpful...NOT! With the cold-ish reception staff and the A/C issue, I would give this hotel below OK rating for us. We will try somewhere else next time. Oh, I forgot...WIFI is extra. Seriously...it's 2011. Just go to Starbucks. WIFI is free there.

Reviews.Title: “Still great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amnonvekill
Reviews.Content: been in that hotel 4 times and i must say that is worth living there. Good service,great food at breakfast,comfortable and clean rooms. and best of all is that it placed near to everything! plus only 100 m from the train to/from the airport. the only minus is that i believe that this hotel should have free Wi.Fi ! and the possibility to make tea/coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, comfortable hotel on Spree River”
Reviews.Author: 2tango
Reviews.Content: I loved this location, a stones throw from Museum Island and within walking distance of many East Berlin sites....The hotel was comfortable and staff friendly and helpful. I particularly liked my second room overlooking the Spree River...The breakfast room overlooked the Spree and food was quite good. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiaris
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at Melia's Berlin executive floor and we were very satisfied! The room was very clean, the breakfast had a lot of varieties and the bed (+ pillows) was perfect!!! During the afternnon we had beers and tapas for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMo11
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Melia and I wasn't disappointed. It's close to the major transport links, and a short walk to the main tourist sites. Being so close to everything makes for a very relaxing holiday. Breakfast is excellent with a terrific range of fresh food on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Bern_3012
Reviews.Content: The extraordinary thing about Melia if you like sauna, is that you can use it around the clock, whenever you want. Just inform them and they heat it up for you. The sauna area is on the top floor and you can even get fresh air on a balcony. What I dislike in a hotel of this quality, is that there is no coffee or tea facility in the room (although I have been told that you can order one and will have to pay daily 5€). Sooner or later they will have to offer free WiFi in the lobby at least because competitors of similar standard do. But all in all a great stay and breakfast of good quality, quantity and variety

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Carol227125
Reviews.Content: E-mailed in advance to ask for a higher floor away from the main road as I can hear a pin drop!! Got an immediate reply noting our requirements. On arrival we got a 6th floor inward facing room and never heard a sound. Really enjoyed our meals in both the Restaurant and tapas bar. Hotel immaculate and in a great location for sightseeing. Within walking distance of Brandenburg gate, Holocaust memorial site and the Bundestag. Plenty of eating places nearby and a supermarket along from the hotel on left hand side (downstairs)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron_the_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Melia is a good value hotel in Berlin. Nice rooms, got an upgrade to a better room with a nice view on the river Spree. U and S-bahn nearby at Friedrichstrasse bahnhoff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but they sting you for the extras”
Reviews.Author: NBJohnston
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend, and was excellent value for money however be warned that while the room rate was very reasonable they sting you for extras. On checkin we were offered breakfast for 22Euros each which we declined. Straight away they then offered it to us for a special of 15 Euros each which we also declined. When we came back that evening we thought we might take up the offer of 15 Euros each. We were then told this offer was only if we booked breakfasts for all days. As we had to leave early after our second night we declined. We were then offered 11 breakfast for 11 Euro if we signed up to the Melia club. In the end we just had breakfast at McDonalds across the road for ~3.50 Euro each! The internet was the most expensive I've ever seen. 20 Euro a day!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: IanRobertson
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Berlin and what a start! When we arrived at the hotel we were given an upgrade to a fantastic room right on the corner overlooking the river. The room was comfortable and well appointed, the staff friendly and helpful throughout our 4 day stay. The hotel is in a great location just beside the river and a couple of hundred yards from Museum island. We'll be back in Berlin and our first choice of hotel will be a return to the Melia. Only downside of the stay was the ridiculous price for Internet access - I did without rather than pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated and confortable”
Reviews.Author: calatoru
Reviews.Content: Well situated,very close to center,many shops and restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ORGMemphis_Tennessee
Reviews.Content: What a great place tom stay in Berlin. One block from the train station in from the airport. Very convenient transportation just outside the door. Rooms are large and the service is impeccable. Hotel restaurant is a very good tapas place. Charge for wifi but free at the Starbucks down the block. Eat breakfast anywhere within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a superb location almost on the river”
Reviews.Author: kennytaylor
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property close to train station and the river,great for sightseeing and shopping breakfast and tapas was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: D1000_11
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel located in Mitte just few minutes walk from main attractions. The subway station is just 50 meters away. The staff was very service minded and friendly. Rooms are spacious and very clean with a modern design. Highly recommended. Very suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “I can highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aulddub
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Berlin Melia for 3 nights in July 2011 and had a very enjoyable stay. I got a free upgrade to the 'Level' area on the seventh floor which was very welcome. This did not include entry to the lounge area of the Level but it did mean that the double room was spacious, and as it is soundproofed, very quiet at night.
