Air conditioning is standard in the hotel and was adjustable in the room. The bar area was convivial and comfortable for a late beer at night. The hotel location is excellent right beside the Friedrichstrasse U Bahn and S Bahn systems and with both buses and trams outside the hotel door. There are easier transport systems in Europe to figure out and it does pay off to plan your journey well in advance to see which transport option suits your needs best. I used a 48 hour Berlin Welcome Card Berlin costing 16.50 Euros which made travel very easy even though most of the historic sites are in easy walking distance. Berlin is a big tourist destination and all the major sites were very crowded, especially after 11am, if you hit these before that time you will have easier access and little or no queues. The river cruises are very good value and I followed a previous TripAdvisor tip and took the 1 hour cruise which covers the major riverside sights adequately. With such a wealth of history Berlin is a great city to visit but it lacks the charm of Vienna or Paris, not helped by a surly native population whose manner borders on rudeness and could never be described as friendly. Berlin is certainly well worth a visit but it will not call you back as others do.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JandS-Edin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Most of the main sites are in walking distance and for those that aren't Friedrichstasse train station and u-bahn are only about 100m away. The rooms themselves are a good size. A couple of negatives is the lack of tea and coffee in the room - they charge 5 euros on room service! The other was that we returned to our room at 3:30 (having been out since 9) and the room still hadn't been cleaned. One other negative, which is outside the hotels control, but worth bearing in mind is that the hotel seems to be in a mobile phone 'dead' zone. We struggled to get a reception in the room (although we were in a courtyard facing room so this may have contributed).

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: Gogogaijingirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Found it a really good choice - there may be hotels with more character in Berlin but it was in a really good location right next to the Spree with easy access to everywhere we wanted to go. Room was spacious with a good sized bathroom, a large comfortable bed and bathrobes and slippers. Really easy to relax in...there were champagne glasses in the room and while the mini bar was a bit pricey the shop down the street sold very cheap cava! Staff were helpful and friendly. We didn't have breakfast but there were places nearby which were fine. All in all, we were very happy with the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: martin_ww
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) stayed for 4 nights at the Melia. Very friendly staff welcomed us and noted this polite friendliness throughout our stay, whether at breakfast, with concierge or at the bar. Given the not-so-friendly reputation of Berlin in general, which is regrettably still encountered frequently, this was doubly welcome. The rooms are of good size and are well furnished. Soundproofing is excellent. The breakfast buffest is generous. Highlight is the location: walking distance from the most relevant sightseeing spots of the new Berlin: Reichstag, Brandenburger Tor, Unter den Linden, Gendarmenmarkt, Museumsinsel, Hackesche Höfe, all are easily reached by foot. The sightseeing boats on the Spree depart right outside the hotel. And for more distant locations, there is Bahnhof Friedrichstrasse approx. 100m down the road. Could not be better! The only disappointment: the hotel still practizes the stone-age approach to internet connectivity, with outrages charges and inconvenient package deals.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, good value.”
Reviews.Author: julian_davies1961
Reviews.Content: This was a great base for my first visit to Berlin since the wall fell, and my partner's first ever. The centre of gravity of the city is now back in the (aptly named) Mitte district, and you can't get much more central than Friedrichstrasse. We booked on a walking tour round the city and the hotel was pretty much in the centre of the zone we covered. Even if you are too bone idle to walk, there are trams right outside the door, and the rail and U-bahn a matter of yeards away. The room was pretty big and well equipped. The river view was part of the lastminute.com package, but we would still have been content looking over the street. The only minus was that the one radio channel I particularly wanted (BBC Radio 5 at football results time) seemed to be the only oneof hundreds on offer which didn't work. There was also a daily charge for listening to the international stations which seemed a bit tight, although it was promptly removed from the bill when I pointed out that my desired station had not been available. Obviously it's a Spanish hotel (I say obviously but it didn't really occur to me when I booked) and the restaurant has a spanish menu, which didn't appeal, but fortunately there are some excellent restaurants in the area, and any number of Wurstbude and Imbissstuben where you can buy german fast food to your heart's content.particularly along the river where there was a great Saturday antique/junk/art market, washed down with Gluhwein or hot chocolate with rum; just the thing for a snowy Berlin February day. All in all it is a great base for first time visitors to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great people!”
Reviews.Author: Whitty-Ten
Reviews.Content: Although the room was a little hot and the air con was not working well, the hotel was great value for money. The service was friendly, it's in a location central to eating/drinking, shopping and a reasonable walk to the main sights. The rooms were clean, with comfy beds and we even got a free bottle of Melia fizz as it was my wife's bday! The only thing was wifi was not free which in this day and age was disappointing. Overall would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern style, centrally located, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SirCanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our visit to Berlin. The Melia is very centrally located on Friedrichstraße, right beside the Spree River . S-Bahn, U-Bahn and tram cars all stop right outside the hotel! Our room faced Friedrichstraße, so it was quite noisy night and day. The tram/street cars were the main noise makers, banging by at all hours. Not a huge deal for us, but if you're a light sleeper, make sure your room faces another direction. Our room was large and well appointed with a king bed. There was a large safe in the room. The hotel appears new or recently renovated. Our luggage didn't make a connection, so the hotel staff arranged delivery for us; we were very satisfied with the professionalism and attentiveness of all staff at this hotel. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. We did not park a car. There is no free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Berlin - Wunderbar!”
Reviews.Author: Fergal1
Reviews.Content: An very good hotel, but for the annoying intermittent buzzing sound in room 17 on the fifth floor. The room was very comfortable and clean. Be careful of the slippery bath though! Staff were very friendly and Cafe Madrid did excellent tapas at reasonable prices. Breakfast was too expensive, but lots of places nearby to eat instead. Wifi expensive, but free at Starbucks 50m away! All in all, a great break in Berlin, which in itself, is a fantastic city. Will return - so much to see. Booked through Secret Hotel and got room at 1/3 of the price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BethCarl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Melia during a 5 week trip around Europe in June and absolutely loved it! The hotel is within walking distance to all the major sights, and is surrounded by great shopping and food. We stayed on 'The Level' which offered free access to an executive lounge where we had breakfast, free canapes and drinks in the evening, and the use of a PC. The rooms were huge, extremely clean, very quiet, and had a great view of the Spree River. The staff were very friendly. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: atrejseeratleve
Reviews.Content: Right on the corner of Friedrichstrasse and the river Spree, the hotels is in an excellent location for almost any activity -- walking around, sightseeing, going out, eating, shopping. Rooms are tastefully appointed and modern, feel very new and clean. Nice linens and bathrooms. I had a room facing Friedrichstrasse -- a very busy street with a tram -- but with the windows closed, it was not noticeable, no problem. Wifi works well but is a bit pricey, but this seems to be the case in many hotels. Excellent service, very easy to get a taxi too (or book with the front desk). Will definitely consider staying here again when in Berlin. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cant believe how good this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: ddickson11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia having booked a really good deal over the internet. When we got there we upgraded to executive level which gave us breakfast and access to the lounge with free beer, soft drinks, fruit and snacks. I have stayed in many hotels but this is the BEST. The staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. This was our first time in Berlin and the Melia made our short break. Anytime I go away now I will be looking for a Melia to stay in. Well done to a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Teresaann29
Reviews.Content: We statyed at the Melia in Berlin for the first time. I booked online so I wasn't sure what to expect. I chose it because of its excellent location. I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. The rooms were flawless, good size, spotlessly clean, great black-out drapes and 100% quiet! No noise at all, despite being on a main street. The staff was friendly and helpful and spoke English. I really can't say enough about my experience there. It was my first time abroad, and this hotel and staff put me immediately at ease. Also, it is is walking distance to just about everything, and if there is something further away you wish to visit, the S-bahn station is just steps away. We did order room service one night and it was prompt and hot, and the staff member who delivered it was very friendly. I would not stay anywhere else if I ever return!!

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel With Many Comforts, Expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: hopki87520
Reviews.Content: Fancy lobby. Large Bed. Large bathroom. Prime location next to trains and metro and tourist sites. Semi-friendly staff. I was not surprised to see that there was a fee for wireless internet within the rooms, but was shocked to see that there was no discount for using the computer stations in the lobby. This seemed like it would be a great place to stay on business, but only decent for a couple traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaJolla3160
Reviews.Content: My husband and and I stayed at this hotel for four nights and enjoyed it very much. The staff were very courteous and professional. The establishment was well managed, clean and efficient. Our room was very attractive, extremely quiet and spotless. The location of the hotel is perfect. The Friedrichstrasse has everything. My only complaint is that wifi isn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: californianonthemove
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in an ideal location of Berlin on Friedrichsrasse. Easy walking distance to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, park, and many other key sites. Our room (#652) looked out on the Spree River, which runs right by the hotel. Our room was spacious, attractively appointed with new modern furniture, tv, carpet, etc. Basic room rate was $170 a night. That did not include breakfast, for which they charged approx $30 for each guest. Also, no free internet connection in the room, and pricey at $23 a day. Good breakfast fare, attractive lobby and the entire facility was clean and fresh. Would definitely go back. Close to a wonderful row of restaurants across the street and on the other side of the Spree River.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for a short 3 day stay in Berlin last year in July and chose the Melia Berlin hotel. It was a great choice as the check in was fast and the staff very friendly and helpful. Very clean room and enough space for 2 people with 2 big suitcase and hand-luggage. Room service was good, staff helpful and very apologetic when they mixed up my order (I didn't mind though, the german sausage dish was so yummy, worth waiting for!) Excellent location, the Friedrichstrasse is filled with cafes, shops, buses, taxi stands, etc and close to tour stops, also not far from the Tegel airport, a short taxi ride. I felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night (after doing all-day tours) I would recommend this hotel to all travellers, especially first-time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_People
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best ever visited hotels! Kind service, gorgeous rooms and a very, very optimal situation for a city trip! All tickets for sightseeing and concerst direct available in the lobby. And very nice view to the river Spree.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Every detail is a surprise.”
Reviews.Author: -Genau-00
Reviews.Content: Melia is a Spanish hotel, and lik emost of the spanish hotels teh quelity of the service is excellent. Elegant, modern, clean... you feel special in this place. The service is friendly and polite. A very good option if you visit Berlin.. and you can pay it...

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CrunchbiteJr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Melia in December for the Christmas markets and what a location! Just by the train station and a short walk to Unter Den Linden it's perfect for taking the in the sites around Brandenburg Gate. The hotel itself is standard fare for a chain like Melia. It's big, clean and efficiently run. The staff at the front desk spoke perfect English and were everything a customer could want. We stayed in the deluxe double a few floors up and had a fantastic view of the river and the city. The room itself was large and had a fantastic large bed perfect for collapsing after a hard day of wandering around the city. The room was particularly warm, at points unbearably so. This was compounded by an air conditioning which failed to cool the room well but managed to dry you out if you left it on for any length of time. We managed to survive with the icy December wind from an open window but it did detract from the room considerably. Worst thing is the lack of free wifi, something hotels across Europe have to wise up to. It should be a staple of hotel travel in 2011. All in all it's an affordable and safe hotel for Berlin, you could do a lot worse and won't find anything stand out but won't find anything terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, if a little dull, hotel, good location,”
Reviews.Author: keviline
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a convenient location. Clean, neat, friendly, inexpensive. Specious rooms, great breakfasts. Rooms do not have free internet. Although this is a marginal cost, it still feels exorbitant that one has to pay Eur 17/day for internet accress.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Service/Great Room”
Reviews.Author: MikeMaui
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our recent stay. Excellent service. Fabulous rooms. Location is greatr for touring. 5 minute taxi ride to Central Station. If possible, stay on the Concierge Floor (7th floor). Computers with internet available, great breakfast, cocktails and snacks in the evening. Only complaint... must pay for in room WiFi (very expensive and should be free for the price of the rooms). Had two great meals at nearby Berliner Republik... loud, young and fun. Also make sure to take boat tour on the Spree. Berlin hop on/hop off bus a great way to see the City. Concierge very helpful with these.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the major sites”
Reviews.Author: bluedook
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, nice rooms, great breakfast but the best thing about the hotel is the location with easy walking to the major sites and close to the S and U stations. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way - Fantastic Melia Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dippyjay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my wife for our 5th wedding anniversary. Arriving at schoefeld airport via easy jet we ended up getting the RE7 express to friedrichstrasse. The RB14 is the other express train you can use to get to the centre (cost 2euro 30cent) The journey took 20mins. The melia berlin is literally a couple of minutes walk from the station. On arrival we received a nice welcome by the staff. I had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival requesting a river view and informing them the trip was for our wedding anniversary but had not had a reply. I should not have doubted the professionalism of the Melia as we were allocated room 650 on the 6th floor. The view of the river and city was great. The rooms are very modern and finished to a very high standard. Nice comfy beds and pillows which is always high on my wifes agenda! The hotel is in an excellent location and walking distance to alot of the main sights. If your legs let you down then the transport network is cheap and first class. We wandered down to Oranienburger strasse, where we found a good choice of bars and places to eat. We had dinner at oranium which had a good choice of local and international foods and was a very reasonable price. We had room only at the hotel which allowed us to have brekkie at a different place everyday ( 22 euros pp if you want). Although on 2 days we simpley got a starbucks coffee and cake and sat out in the nice weather. We did the usual open top bus trips, lots of companies can be found on unter den linden and we paid 20euros pp for a day hop on/off ticket and they go to all the major sights. Nice touch by the hotel with a nice bottle of champagne for our wedding anniversary. We picked Boccas di Bacco for our anniversary meal. We made a last minute decision to go here and did not reserve so felt lucky to get a table when we turned up. The food was excellent but the service very poor (read seperate review). Berlin is a very clean modern city and i would thoroughly recommend Berlin and the Melia Berlin for a great break.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: USA123WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This is my second time I stayed at Melia Berlin. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location is outstanding on the banks of the river, walking distance from most of the attractions like the museum Island, Brandenburg Gate, Hackescher Markt and Alexander Platz. Has a subway stop right next to it. It is in the upscale Mitte district. The rooms are nice and large, well kept and very comfortable. Love to get there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: non-stop-orb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days for a birthday celebration at the Melia and what a treat it was. Located 3 minuets walking distance from the main train station. The staff were all friendly, helpful and spoke very good English. The room was lovely. Spotlessly clean, comfortable, roomy and had loads of natural light. The mini bar fridge was ideal for storing your own drinks in, and there was also a complimentary room safe to use. The bed was huge and comfortable. We had no disturbances at all, and slept well every night. You have your own room temperature control, which was excellent. I also liked the added security that you had to swipe your room card to use the lifts to gain access to all floors.There is an excellent steak house (block house) located just to the right of the hotel main entrance, a definite visit for steak lovers and vegetarians alike. We found the supermarket, located on the same side as the hotel, again a few minuets walk perfect for breakfast items and so cheap for alcohol. 85 cents for a 500ml bottle of beer, 2.50 euro for a litre of red wine, 7euro for 70cl 40% vodka. You cant go wrong. This was our first stay with this hotel chain and we will definitely look to book again either here or in other countries. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MiguelNewYork
Reviews.Content: Melia Berlin is an excellent place to stay; the rooms are very comfortable and modern, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the tapas bar was our favorite hang out place for tapas and sangria. Breakfast was a feast of options. The location is also superb.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL....EXCELLENT LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: lastminutebobyork
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Melia Berlin in the Level rooms and had a brilliant time. Hotel is in great location with easy access to all attractions Berlin has to offer. Level rooms offer access to executive lounge for breakfast and alcohol/soft drinks from 6.00 - 10.00pm along with tapas, so after a long days sightseing/walking its a lovely touch. We could not fault the hotel and would recommend to anyone for business or leisure..

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: sunchaserJ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful reception staff could not do enough to help, the concierge knows everything there is to know about whats going on in the city, we had a basic room and it was great, large enough and very very clean. The bed was one of the most comfortable i've slept in. We were there on our wedding anniversary and the hotel surprised us with a bottle of champagne. No kettle in the room and room service is expensive but just go down and get tea and coffee from the bar and take it to your room. There are loads of places to eat and drink, Que Pasa is a mexican restaurant, we went there for magaritas and nachos but the food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing, we ate traditional german food at a restaurant called 1840, lunch at a place called Oranium, all the places we ate at were lovely, cocktails were cheapest in Que Pasa. Restaurant to AVOID is called Buddah (indian restaurant) in a little side street. across the road from the hotel down by the side of the river there is a litle piano bar called van gough, good atmosphere. Getting to the Melia couldn't be easier, come out of Schoenfeld airport, straight in front of you is the train station, you have to buy a ticket from the machine that covers areas ABC, you have to validate your ticket on the platform, you do this by going to one of the red boxes on the platform and putting your ticket in it will stamp the date on the ticket, it is really important to validate the ticket otherwise it's 60 euro fine when you get to your destination, the ticket costs 3 euros each, you can buy what they call a welcome card but to be honest the hotel is so close to all the sights it may not be worth it as everything is within 20 minutes walking distance, anyway, once you get to the train station and you've got your ticket go to platform 4 and catch the the RB14 express train it goes right into the city centre every half hour and takes about half hour to get to friedrichstasse, come out of Friedrichstasse turn left and the Melia hotel is on the right overlooking the river. On the way back to Schoenfeld airport you get the RB14 from platform 1 at friedrichstasse. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel, top breakfast, decent price!”
Reviews.Author: aandriolli
Reviews.Content: Top location to visit Berlin, walking distance from main tourist sights, and very close to metro station and lots of nice bars and restaurants. Expensive internet access, however. The rooms are great, and the hotel appearance is very good. The breakfast was an excellent surprise. Make sure you apply for the MAS card, the Melia fidelity program - it can be done on spot, and gets you a 50% discount on the breakfast (from 22 to 11 EUR).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gateway_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for several days at the Melia in Berlin. I cannot fault the hotel in anyway. It was perfectly located for my needs (I was siteseeing for a few days). You can easily walk to the famous museums and parliament etc. Shopping in your door step as are many restaurants. I didn't eat at teh hotel but the tapas bar did look very nice (I very rarely eat at any hotel I stay, tend to be a little bit more adventurous). Getting to hotel is super easy as well. I got the bus from the airport and it dropped me off less than 10 minutes away from the hotel - perfect. I would definetly recommend this hotel. I tend to give ratings based on location, and service. First class on both criteria.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Berlin, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cavogreco_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April, this is a great hotel, the rooms are large, clean and soundproofed, (we booked a river view which was worth it). The breakfast was amazing, the best I have ever had and the quality was 1st class. Staff were helpful and friendly. The position is central and on the river so excellent for sight seeing. All in all a top class hotel that I would recommend to anyone thinking of visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Pay extra for refundable”
Reviews.Author: rd333104
Reviews.Content: I'll try and be fair with my review... I understand that non-refundable means non-refundable. But, when I booked this hotel online, the only option available was non-refundable. Normally, you are able to make a choice; pay a higher price for refundable, or pay a discounted price for non-refundable. Unfortanately, I had car trouble two days after I booked this hotel. I emailed the hotel because I was out of town, no response. I called to try and negotiate staying at the hotel at a later date after getting my car fixed. The hotel was not willing to accomodate. I cannot say whether the hotel itself is nice or not, but, I can say, they will give you a whole whopping 10% of your money back if you have to cancel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel @ 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: milnetIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels by far. staff, comfort, service etc cannot fault. But at 22 euro Each!!!for breakfast, go else were, Hakescher markt was good from 9am onwards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jad311
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located, and high end. Walkable to most major sites in East Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient 4* hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelPlanner
Reviews.Content: The Melia was a great deal! We stayed in a junior suite with a river view and enjoyed club level access. The club provided food all day-- a good breakfast in the morning, light lunch food mid day, cakes in the afternoon, and tapas in the evening. Our bed was comfortable, and the extra was, too. We had a nice sitting area with a small couch and two comfortable chairs in a separate sitting area. We were on Friedrickstrasse and around the corner from Unter den Linde within easy walking distance to Museum Island, Humboldt University, and the Brandenburg Gate. It was a good value for all the free food, comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: snowtiger223
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. This hotel is in a fantastic location. It's super clean, stylish, great staff and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a good location for sightseeing or the city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Car67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia Berlin for 4 nights in April 2011. The hotel in a €20 taxi or €2.5 bus ride (TXL) and a short walk from Tegel airport - the U-and S-bahn runs past the hotel too with stops a short walk away. The hotel itself is superbly appointed with large, very comfortable bedrooms, great bathrooms and one of the widest, tastiest selections for buffet breakfast I have ever seen. There is a restaurant/tapas bar on site although we didn't eat there, preferring to go out each evening. Situated on Friedrichstrasse next to the bridge over the Spree it is a few blocks away from Unter-den-Linden and an easy walk into the city - in one evening I walked to Checkpoint Charlie, Potzdamer Platz, Brandenburg Tor and back past the Reich Stag building in about an hour. Boat trips along the Spree are available close by. Going north along Friedrichstrasse and into Oranienburger Strasse takes you past quite a few restauarants with lots of choice - the Mirchi Singapore-style restaurant was excellent. Along the river there are bars / eateries, most of which also got very busy in the evenings. Also in the area are some excellent museums for wet (or dry...) days - the German History, DDR and Holocaust museums are well worth a visit. Internet access via Wi-Fi is expensive according to the brochure, although there was a CAT5 ethernet connection in the bedroom which appeared to be free... Our room was on the front of the hotel overlooking the river and the bridge - there is some traffic noise although we didn't find it at all intrusive. All in all I would strongly recommend this hotel for its rooms. breakfast and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: junara
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 nights over the weekend and Melia Berlin has an excellent location at the cross-section between Museum Island and shopping belt Friedrichstrasse. The breakfast buffet was quite adequate with very good sausages. Must commend the staff at the reception and concierge for being extremely helpful. They made it a point to inquire if we needed help and the concierge gave the best directions and tips. He pointed us to the currywurst joint across the street under the Friedrichstrasse U-bahn station (give it a try!). The rooms are spacious. Liked that they gave a selection of pillows, it was a nice touch. The room I got on the 2nd floor opened to ground level (a small grassy patch), if that won't work for you, ask for a higher floor. Wished they didn't charge for internet though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location, but expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: RuneOslo
Reviews.Content: Splendid hotel with great location, very nice rooms and good and varied breakfast! But 10 Euros for 24 hrs internet access is ridiculously expensive! Should have been free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “All Round Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyle H
Reviews.Content: Melia Hotel is in an excellent location, only 1 minute from the S-Bahn or U-Bahn station (Friedrichstrasse). It's one station away from Berlin Central Station. All staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very modern, furnishings are fairly new and in great condition, and the rooms are very clean. The buffet breakfast was delicious with a wide selection of food. I will stay here again. Only one problem: The bathtub is a little narrow and slippery and the drain needs to be less restrictive to allow the water to drain better while taking a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwreck
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Melia Berlin, very central and within walking distance to a lot of attractions. Enjoyed a lovely meal in the restaurant service was great. if i ever get back to Berlin i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunbeam30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend at beginning of March. Hotel is 2 mins from the station, and is in a really good location. Hotel was clean and pleasant and staff were really helpful..we asked for an iron and extra robe, and by time we got upstairs to the room they were already there! Concierges were helpful for getting about and advise on travel. Soundproofing in the rooms is excellent, we didn't hear any noise. There is a lovely italian restaurant over the bridge and taking a left called Vaporetto, the food was lovely. When we return to Berlin, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “My parents loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MariaLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay at Melia but my parents did (i booked the hotel for them as a gift for my dad's birthday) and they asked me to write this review here and let every body know how wonderful the hotel and the staff was (especially Nina). I emailed the hotel and asked for a nice high floor room with a view for my parents and they got a lovely room on the 6th floor, river view (even though they payed only for a standard room). They told me that the location couldn't be more central, everything was around (shopping, eating, transportation) they were also very impressed with the breakfast, they said it was the richest and most delicious breakfast they ever had and the staff was wonderful too, especially Nina who arranged a bottle of bubbly to be delivered for my dad's birthday! My mother says she wants to go to Berlin again (she loved the city too) and she wouldn't consider staying at another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't choose it, wouldn't choose anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: LeoAT
Reviews.Content: My mother and father booked this for me and my girlfriend as a Christmas present for 2 nights in December, from the minute we walked out of the train station and saw the place I had a good feeling. Excellent check-in and front desk staff, lovely big room, big comfy bed, extortionate Wifi (but they decided not to charge me for some reason.... nice touch!), sparkling bathroom with very powerful underfloor heating and a superb location. Honestly, there wasn't really anything to complain about. The high price of breakfast was in my view a rip off but then there are plenty of nice places across the road to get breakfast. the lightest sleepers may want to stay off the 3rd floor facing the main road (the first floor with rooms on I believe) as there was noticeable noise, but not overly, and the higher you go, the quieter it will be I'm sure. Finally the lack of power outlets next to the bed makes me knock off one star for room quality, and the TV had only 2 English language channels, news, (I anticipated this) and no connections for my portable DVD player due to it being built into the desk/cabinet. Minor things, but did bug me (i fact i nearly contemplated paying £10 to watch inception on pay per view! I'm still shuddering now just thinking about it). If i ever return to Berlin, i can't see why i would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very central location”
Reviews.Author: pam89
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with good rooms. I stayed on the "Level" floor. This hotel is good quality and has a superb location on Friedrichstraße, right in the center of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, excellent location in Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: grahamdonohoe
Reviews.Content: First visit to the Melia chain, and was very impressed. The Melia Berlin has modern, very comfortable rooms of a standard easily competitive with more expensive chain hotels in Berlin. The location is great - next to the river literally only metres from the U/S-bahn Friedrichstrasse, walking distance to the Museumsinsel or Brandenburger Tor. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CharlesandCharlie
Reviews.Content: If you book an executive room you automatically have access to free snacks and drinks (alcholic and soft). We stayed here for New Years for 4 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. Staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms were fantastic quality. Great breakfast selection and large dining facility. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a touch of class and creature comforts. Walking distance to main attractions such as the Brandenburg Gates and many bars and restaurants. Enjoy the free booze if you stay "Executive"! - There is a smoking lounge with TV and sofa's for all you smokers out there. Very pampered! Make the most of the indoor luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday saved by the Melia”
Reviews.Author: IrishjohnTipperary
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 5 nights in jan then murphys law struck first airline goes on strike did not know if we would fly .Hotels rules state if you cancel within 48 hours they are not obliged to refund you .Hotels.com contacted hotel and explained about some flights canceled at 12 hours notice they agreed to waive rule no prob.Next thing we could not make flight due to family problem .First holiday in two years rapidly going down tube rang hotels.com and asked if hotel would allow us to change dates for following week no prob no charge could not believe how helpful melia was Two flights booked rapidly and holiday saved. We booked room on level and it was lovely the lounge was super with food and drink as required and staff that just could not do enough for us.The location is perfect with all the sights within walking distance and trains just beside hotel. The service in this hotel is superb with paper on door every morning water delivered every evening and turn down service every night.Breakfast has to be seen to be believed with a huge selection to suit every taste.If i had to find any fault it could only be slight traffic noise but as we live in country it could just us Iknow if we had asked for another room they would have moved us but it was not neccessary.We sampled tapas bar downstairs and food was excelent the waiter was a great source of information on what to see and do.Ten minutes walk from hotel is irish bar Kilkenny well worth a visit and steak second to none.If you visit Berlin stay at this hotel on the level it is well worth the extra money and will spoil you rotten.I just cannot find fault with this hotel and as other reviews will tell you you will not be disappointed.Thank you to the management and staff of the Melia for your help and kindness as the old saying goes when things go wrong you find out who your friends are and the Melia was not found wanting in our case. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: glamerousgran08
Reviews.Content: We were treated to the executive accomodation by our son & wife for my husbands 60th. What a treat, fantastic facilities, excellent position for sightseeing. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and the city of Berlin despite the heavy snow! The public transport and Berlin travel card excellent value. In the executive lounge, fantastic snacks, drinks and tapas all included in price, what great value.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: EuroGirl123
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, this is my second stay in two years, excellent location, comfortable and spacious rooms, glorious breakfast buffet, polite and helpful staff, but the housekeeping left much to be desired. I could see where the vacuum cleaner had been and the rest of the area left untouched, my first request to change the sheets were ignored, shower caps and robes not replaced, slimely soap left in soap dish throughout our stay(6 nights), overall not what you expect from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Fabulous Room”
Reviews.Author: Teri22
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Melia Berlin for 2 nights in January 2011. The location was great, right across the street from a main train station. The desk staff was friendly upon our arrival, which was around 10:30 a.m. Our room was ready, and we were very happy with it. The carpet felt brand new, the bed was very comfortable (especially after an 8 hour flight) and the heated floor in the bathroom was a great surprise. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine, Unremarkable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKB1701
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back with my wife, and it was a fine if unremarkable experience. The rooms were clean and decorated funkily and were of an average size. The staff was very helpful with one or two exceptions. If there's a more perfectly located hotel in Berlin, I'd like to see it. It's right next to the Friedrichstrasse Metro stop with Deutsch Bahn connections, the Spree River to the south and Unter den Linden 3 minutes to the north. There are 24-hour stores and great restaurants right by the hotel, so there's no need for the overpriced bar, giftshop and restaurant at the hotel. The room was a bit expensive, but for the location we had, we felt it was a good value. Again, it was perfectly nice, but if you're the type of traveler who needs a unique or exceptional lodging experience, you'd be wise to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “FAR FROM A BOUTIQUE HOTEL BABY”
Reviews.Author: DTrav1
Reviews.Content: If part of your enjoyment of your travels is to feel welcome and at home at your hotel. Then Melia franchise is not for you. We have just completed a 5 day stay at the Melia. You know that strange feeling you get when you feel disconnected to a place. (The hotel that is). It was if we rented a chunk of real esate from the hotel without any personal connection. There is plenty of take and precious little give. I'll tell you why. For starters The reception staff as you walk in try not to make eye contact with you in case you might ask for something. And if you do ask them for something they know ( and you find out ) you are going to be charged or should I say overcharged for most things that you ask for. There is no free internet but the daily charge if you need it is at least 17 Euro (for a measily 500MB unlikely to cope with the most basic requirements ) and daily 22 Euro for unlimited access. ( a service that is provided free at other hotels or charged at a reasonable rate). Further the staff agree that the price for this access was exorbitant and suggested I warn people on Trip Advisor. Also ask for tea/coffee facilities to have a cup on the occassions that you don't feel like going out. It will cost you another daily 8 Euro. If you want a chill out and watch a little TV in your when recovering from the amazing things Berlin has to offer if you speak English, bad luck. There only two English channels BBC News and CNN which although can be great to watch do understandably need to repeat news items. If you would like any more channels watch a movie add another 20 Euros per day for pay TV. If you speak German you can get about 12 to 15 free channels including movies channels. The token hotel type Gym is free but unfortunately the Gym machine is broken there is hardly any free weights but the treadmill does work at the moment. So you get the idea no help plenty of charges. The room is standard and might make the 4 stars they claim. The breakfast and the breakfast staff are very good however. The location is fine but in Berlin it is so well serviced by the metro that that is not critical. Irrespective please try the Metro early in your stay it is fantastic it will also give you a sense of freedom, easy to use and will open up Berlin in so many ways. (Look on wikipedia for Berlin Metro to get a handle on it.) So whoever running this Melia franchise Berlin my suggestion is to catch a lift from the 50th floor of the office building you are in get in a taxi and get over to your hotel and stand in reception smile and welcome your GUESTS. Without them you are in trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: inikamozi
Reviews.Content: Although quite a large hotel, we found a very personal service/atmosphere. Modern and very clean, efficiently run and situated close to shops, sights and attractions. The 2 restaurants were great value and the food was excellent. Worthy of special note are the staff; everyone was friendly, helpful and really put a great deal of effort into making your stay at the hotel a great experience. A couple of comments I would bear in mind: dogs seemed to be allowed into the restaurant which may be a German thing but something I was disappointed with, also, there is not any tea/coffee making facilities in the room. A great hotel and one I will definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Thompsons-Abroad
Reviews.Content: Most has been said before - the location is a major plus with easy transport links. Friendly, easy check in with excellent English; a concierge who will look after bags after you've checked out. It was cold, so we did like the heated floor in the bathroom. Only negative is the shower in bath arrangement, but it was done pretty well (no nasty curtains!). 2nd floor street view room was a LITTLE noisy due to station/trams, but OK after 11pm. Opt for the courtyard view to reduce this a little. And just why are German hotel doors sooo heavy!?!?!?! We found restaurants a bit thin on the ground and pricey in the immediate area, but walking north over the bridge towards Oranienburger Str. opens up the possibilities and price ranges - extreme prudes and young families should be warned that the Oranienburger Str to Hackescher Market walking route is quite bohemian (i.e. some 'ladies of the night' in evidence) but lively and interesting. It's then quite a short walk to A'Platz/FernsehTurm. We noted that tourist/shopping activity has moved from Ku-Dam/ Blue Church / Europa Centre area (now looking run down in parts) toward the well-developed Alexanderplatz area in the last couple of years, so if you haven't visited central Berlin for a few years this is probably as far West as you should look for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: anna1880
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, clean, comfortable warm room, on the doorstep U bahn and S bahn stations. A lot of the main sites in walking distance. Beautifully decorated for the Christmas period. Friendly, helpful staff. Could not fault.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: eva46
Reviews.Content: Hi, we went to Berlin for the Christmas markets and chose Melia based on the reviews alone and how right they were. Almost directly across the road from the train station (no noise tho), my sister and I (38 & 43 respectively) had a twin room - good comfortable beds with extra pillows, bath and shower in the bathroom (needed a warm bath after day out at markets), heating controlled from within the room and underfloor heating in the bathroom. The staff were lovely and the breakfast! - we got a deal so it was included - otherwise I think it's about 23 euro, however in our opinion we would recommend it - we didn't eat again till later on at night - whatever you want for breakfast - they had it - including champagne - sounds awfully formal but it wasn't. The train station was easy to use and we were getting to grips with the underground just as we left. Anyway - would be happy to recommend this to anyone and although I hated Berlin itself (sorry - it just felt very oppressive) the hotel was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bertiewahnig79
Reviews.Content: We satyed in the Melia hotel for two nights when visiting the christmas markets of Berlin. The hote was comfortable and welcoming. It was ideally situated for exploring Berlin and the train satation 5 mins walk away had a direct fast train to the airport. The breakfast was 15 euros each but well worth it for a treat, as they had sparkling wine to enjoy with the huge selection of tasty food from the buffet. We will be definately retutrning to Berlin and will be choosing this hotel to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Valued Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Real_Maverick
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Melia Berlin in Oct 2010 for 4 nights on a business trip. Prior to arriving I had contacted the hotel informing them about my early arrival and requested for an early check-in. The hotel had replied indicating that they were unable to confirm my room but has promised to do their best to accommodate. To my surprise, on the day of my arrival at around 9.30 am, a room was already allocated for me. They even offered me a room with a view of the river. This was great as I had just travelled 10 hours and needed to rest and freshen up. The location of the hotel is excellent for both business travelers and tourist, just by the River Spree. It is conveniently located near to S-Bahn and U-Bahn station and taxis were aplenty. In addition, it is also within minutes walk to some of the major tourist sites and there are also plenty of nice restaurants nearby. There were also many shops along the road where the hotel is situated and 2 blocks away, there is a major departmental store. I booked a ‘komfort’ room which was new and clean with a relatively big bathroom. There were several choices of pillows to choose from. The bed was comfortable and I was able to get a good night sleep. The daily buffet breakfast (which was included) was great with choices of cold and hot dishes. However, be warned that it gets really busy during mornings and you may need to wait to be seated. I did not have the opportunity to eat at the restaurant during the evenings but the restaurant and bar area in the lobby seems very lively and the atmosphere was great. If you want a good valued hotel, with great location and comfortable room, you will not be disappointed with Melia Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “First class experience all the way”
Reviews.Author: auschi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia for 5 nights. We had a room on The Level, which proved to be the best decision and well worth the extra dollars. Perfectly located for the best Berlin attractions. Walking distance to Unter der Linden, Branderburg Gate, Museum Island and it is right on the River Spree. The staff at the Level , particularly Christian went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The room was excellent and all amenities as well. If visiting Berlin make sure you stay at the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Christmas markets”
Reviews.Author: Millns
Reviews.Content: Used The Melia Berlin as a base from which to visit the Berlin Christmas markets (specifically Gerdarmenmarkt) aswell as classic tourist spots ie Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstagg etc and being directly opposite Friedrichstrasse Station allows you to do this perfectly with added bonus of direct transport to Schonefeld Airport. The check in staff were very courtaeous, the rooms large, clean and well furnished and breakfast was exceptional. I would have no hesitation in reccomending Berlin as an ideal pre Christmas weekend break and using The Melia as your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, fairly high prices”
Reviews.Author: Monia-Ma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located downtown, close to Potsdamer Platz and the subway station (very good communication). Brightly decorated rooms - but for me, design and colors were not very smart. In the room there is a large desk, which in my case was very much needed. Bed was very comfortable! I recommend a cappuccino in the cafe on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: donut007
Reviews.Content: Although it was our first trip to Berlin, we have travelled to Munich and Frankfurt in the past as well as many european captials. Melia was by far the best hotel we have stayed in of the lot. Location of the hotel on fredriech strasse was excellent right near the shopping and trains. The room faced the river which was beautiful come night time esecially with all the restaurants lit up aloing it. Service at the hotel was top notch as well as the restuarants. We booked a few months in advance and a got an excellent rate on the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbamiles
Reviews.Content: I agree totally with all the other reviews.There is nothing I can comment on in a negative way about this hotel. I have booked my next stay at the Melia Berlin for next month and I am looking forward to it. I can recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a central location. The room was clean and quite stylish, an element that is a characterestic of the whole hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only thing that i disliked was the price of both breakfast and internet access. To have breakfast at hotel, you should pay 23 euro per person while internet access is slow and expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a great location”
Reviews.Author: rondreizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel after i stayed two nights at Potsdam. The hotel has a great location, walking ditsance of the Brandenburger Tor, checkpoint Charley and other sightseeing points. The trainstation is 100 meter from the hotel and for 4 euro's you can take the train/tram to Kurfurstendam, that will tke you 10 minutes. There is a parking under the hotel for 20 euro per day. There is fast wireless internet for 18 euro's a day. The room was big, clean and looked new. The shower was in the bath tub (always hate that cause you can fall). But it was a good shower. Nothing to complain, friendly efficient staff, smooth check in. The hotel also had a very good price compared to other hotels. We had a room above the Friedrichstraße with big windows. But you couldn't hear much outside noise from cars or trams.

Reviews.Title: “My 50th Birthday in Berlin-Geburtstag in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay; 17 June - 20 June 2010 After a great stay in 2008, we returned to Berlin for my 50th birthday and decided to stay on the Level. This was a great decision and worth the extra expense. We arrived before 10 am but were in our room in less than 15 minutes. The room was great except that there was no electrical outlet near the head of the bed so I had to run a cord across the room at night. Everything was clean and the turndown service was fantastic. We had a corner room so we could see north on Freidrichstrasse plus a great view of the bridge and the River Spree. The weather was great so we could look out the window and enjoy the festive atmosphere of the river, the World Cup watchers at riverfront cafes, and the party boats. The Level lounge provided us with two computer terminals (one of my complaints from my prior review and still one if not staying on the Level), unlimited beer, wine, and snacks throughout the day (had to be consumed in lounge area), concierge service from the nicest, most helpful staff, and a great, freshly prepared breakfast. I thought the breakfast I had downstairs in 2008 was more extensive, but the Level breakfast is fresher, less crowded, and offers such personal service. I think I saw one of the guys the next stay at the parade but not sure since he wasn't wearing his work outfit-just what was underneath it! For my birthday, we arrived at opening time, 7 am, and stayed three hours. I had a bountiful breakfast and at least 2 bottles of champagne-how often do you turn 50?! Breakfast the last two morning was great also but only about 30 minutes and just a few glasses of the bubbly! We bought one of the Berlin bears in the Level lounge as a souvenir. I can't wait to return to Berlin in 2011 and will either stay here or the new Tryp Berlin! We bought at 72 transportation card at the airport which also included entrance to the museums on Museum Island and got our money's worth. We rode the TXL bus to and from the airport (get off at Unter dem Linden and Friedrichstrasse and walk 200 m north or connect at the Hautbahnhof but you end doing as much walking plus there are stairs and train waiting times). We also rode the trams, the U-bahn, the S-bahn, and more busses. All trams and trains were on honor system! Efficient, quick, safe, and clean. No worries about getting around Berlin! We were lucky that the weather was great, we had some good meals, and were able to join in the 2010 CSD celebration. We stumbled on to party at the Galleries Lafayette on my birthday evening and had a great afternoon at the parade in former West Berlin in the Tiergarten area. We are leaving in 2 weeks for Munich and will stay at the Tryp Muenchen and stay on their top floor. I hope the Melia Berlin Level didn't spoil me too much! I got so excited about Germany when in Berlin that I ordered the German Rosetta language course in July and am now on Level 4 out of 5 in just over 3 months. Next time, I will be able to enjoy Berlin much more in the native language. Vielen Dank Melia Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great position, good service”
Reviews.Author: elerem2002
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - clean, bright, modern. Great location for exploring the main tourist attractions of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, clean, perfect location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: matildesotomayor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week to celebrate wedding anniversary in Berlin. Location is in top condition, spacious room and bathroom, always clean. Train and metro station adjacent with many ethnic food places around. Walking distance to Museum Island, Branderburg Gate, Oranienburg Street. Very nice staff, multilingual. Security for accesing rooms and hotel areas. Would stay again for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, top service”
Reviews.Author: Victripper
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! I selected it based on TA reviews and its location on the river. The location was perfect - right opposite the Friedrichstrasse U-Bahn and S-Bahn (one stop from Central station) with access to everywhere from the Eastside Gallery to the Berlin Philharmonic from the station just across the road. It is VERY central, easy walking distance (2 to 20 mins), to the major attractions of museums, galleries, Checkpoint Charlie etc. We stayed six nights and were upgraded to "the level", which colours my review as the service received well exceeded the reasonable deal I got by booking early. The room on the 7th floor had a great view and a fully opening window/door. Unlike my original booking, this included breakfast and the buffet here (on the Level) exceeded any I've eaten anywhere, including the Windsor Hotel in Melbourne, which is outstanding. The range of food, from cereals to eggs that could be cooked to order, to beautiful smoked salmon, camembert etc etc was amazing. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Staff at reception and on "the Level" were very helpful with putting our postage box together and arranging to post our cards. There are two computers and a printer available on our floor, and others, I think, in the lobby. My only criticism of this place was the wifi access. It was available, but not free - for a smartphone it was 9 euros, more for a laptop or iPad, and had to be paid per device i.e. two people want to both access email on their own phone, they have to pay twice. You don't stay connected automatically, which was also annoying, although you seemed not to have to put the password in every time. If the rest of the service had not been brilliant, this would have brought the hotel down to 4 star in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and a Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jersey1977
Reviews.Content: A+ location in the heart of Berlin in close proximity to everything. Room was as expected, no suprises. Reasonably priced and tasty room service and a nice tapas bar downstairs. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ PAUL
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin Hotel is wonderful. Well located. Modern and comfortable. We stayed four nights at the hotel on the 7th floor....the Level. Tasty breakfast in Level private dining room; tapas and open bar in evening (free!!!); private computers for guests on the Level; evening turn-down service. We loved it. Near Museum Island, Brandenburg Gate, Check Point Charley, Berliner Dom, Unter den Linden, charming restaurants along street to Museum Island, and River Spree boat tours. Wonderful location and fantastic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: SagerP_S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a prime location for exploring the city

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Angie1105
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Melia was great. The rooms were stylish, comfortable, and well designed. The bed linens were lush. The hotel staff members all spoke great English and were most helpful. The location could not have been better...close to the main Museums and several restaurant areas. The breakfast was unparalleled. It was delicious and bountiful. We usually like to try different hotels on a return trip to a city, but I would have to say that when we return to Berlin, we will go right back to the Melia. Our only complaint was that they charged for Internet use, but they did have a fairly low price option using their computers.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: zeniatrips
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days on the Level (Club Class). What you buy is SERVICE, peace and quiet, cleanliness, proximity and good food. Secure. Quick access through 5 elevator shafts. Location (center, "mitte"), with S-Bahn (our preferred) and U-Bahn and trolley right on the doorstep. Concierge has excellent referral of good restaurants and most helpful in reserving and charting the course. Special feature: haute cuisine at base prices with chef Marcel Scholtun, disciple of famed Tim Raue. Outstanding presentation, dedication to detail, researched and refined menu; just delightful time at Cafe Madrid. Throughout, assistance in German, Spanish, French and English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Level”
Reviews.Author: Lambi
Reviews.Content: Have nothing but praise for this hotel, everything was just excellent. We stayed at The Level on the 7th floor, which is recommended if you care for that little extra, including a very rich breakfast and a high level of service. We enjoyed the Tapas bar on the grouind floor too.

Reviews.Title: “A top choice for location and value”
Reviews.Author: Mair1945
Reviews.Content: We chose Melia Berlin based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not sorry. The location is scenic for a city hotel—right on the Spree River—and within a 15 minute walk of many major "must see" sites, such as museum island and the Reichstag. Additionally, the "S" bahn (local trains) and "U" bahn (underground) are less than a block from the hotel. We stayed on "The Level," which is basically a "concierge" floor, offering a lounge for breakfast from 7 to 10 a.m., snacks and drinks until 10 p.m., and hors de 'oeuvres and open bar from 6 to 10 p.m. Since we do like our cocktails, this was an exceptional bargain, considering a drink in the bar downstairs was Euro 9! The breakfast offerings were excellent, ranging from pastries to smoked salmon to eggs cooked to order. The lounge is staffed with a helpful concierge who can offer restaurant suggestions and make reservations. Two computers with Internet access were available at no charge in the lounge. Otherwise there was a hefty charge for wifi in your room. Rooms were very comfortable and clean and contained 2 easy chairs, a desk, and a flat screen TV. Our only complaint was that we couldn't adjust the AC low enough and had to open the window at night, exposing us to traffic noise—which wasn't all that bad. We did not eat in the Tapas bar, but did try the restaurant. Our meal there was not one we would recommend, however. There are a number of restaurants within a 10 minute walk, some good, some not so. Ask the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for a long weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ralpha
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes that the Melia was the right hotel for us and our friends to use as our base for a 4 night stay in Berlin and it was. The position is ideal; it is near so much including the Friedrichstrasse station. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and well equipped. The breakfast was as good as many other reviewers have stated - probably better than at other Melia hotels where we have stayed previously. We booked very early and got an excellent flexible rate on both out room and the breakfast. If we go back to Berlin, I wouldn't bother to look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK ... very Spanish”
Reviews.Author: Chachachingching
Reviews.Content: Date of stay 08 October -11 October 2010 I'm currently in the hotel as I type this; it's my first day here and so the style of my review will reflect the fact I'm writing this in 'real-time' so to speak. My friend and I arrived and waited for someone at the desk to serve us - which wasn't too long. The place wasn't overly busy but the two staff who were manning the reception desk were busy dealing with phonecalls and other hotel guests. We arrived there at circa 11am and were given rooms - so great result - no waiting around. The porter took our luggage and took it to our rooms who was a lovely Ethiopian chap who spoke excellent ... fluent English and showed us around the room and all it's functions. We stayed in rooms on the 3rd floor. Considering we both had single rooms the rooms were very big and the the bed appeared to be two single beds pushed together we made for a very wide bed. However the the bedding was also for single beds ... so no double duvet - strange?! The single duvet aren't comfortable and kept falling off - why not have a large duvet since the room has two single beds oushed together??!! There were footprints in the room, which I thought was odd... not my footprint. I think they ned to give the carpet a very good clean. We wanted to go to lunch and did have designs on going to the tapas restaurant in the hotel - despite my protestations to my friend given the reviews on Trip Advisor I'd read before coming. In the foyer on the way to the tapas bar, we happened upon the porter who suggested that we go out and eat in the main shopping areas rather than eat in the tapas bar as he didn't consider it to be very good! So I was particularly pleased he said this given my initial reservations. So we ended up eating in a cafe called Boulevard Friedrichstrasse which served German food was excellent and of very high quality. After going for a walk in the evening we had a coffee in the cafe/bar attached to the hotel, which was ok and fairly non-descript. I then went to check out the gym which is located on the 8th Floor. The gym was less than inspired. The equipment looed like that of a hom gym rather than a professional hotel gym. The free weights consist of two dumbells - I am quite disappointed as I used a lot of suitcase space on my gym clothes! Good points - Location situated a few minutes walk from the river, Brandenburg Gate, Reistag Spacious clean rooms/bathroom 24-hr gym facility and clean sauna equipped with towels, sunbed and sun-loungers Bad Points - Gym equipment WiFi - not free (should be in this day and age) and costs a very pricely 17Euros per 24hrs or 10Euros for 1 hour. Business rates are even higher 22Euro for 24-hrs and 88Euros for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “stay at melia hotel berlin”
Reviews.Author: lkjhgZurich
Reviews.Content: berlin has so many hotels to choose from, very difficult to say where to stay. this place is a business hotel with a international crowd, many spanish visitors due to the chain's home. reception staff is extraordinary helpful, from airline web check in to giving directions to arranging a late breakfast. on the lower floor inner court rooms one feels a bit observed when the courtains are open, but the interior is new and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to relax after a day of Museums / Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyPerth
Reviews.Content: Its in a great location - you could walk to pretty much all major sights if you felt inclined, however when we were there it was so hot we got taxis everywhere. The rooms are modern, clean and relatively spacious, great showers! We stayed in the executive room, which came with free breakfast, free drinks & canopies 5-10pm and free internet in the business section. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: winerunner52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights in a tour group for Berlin Marathon. Quick check in - but if there is a large group you would have to wait! Due to Marathon, and tourists in general, hotel probably full, but other than the breakfast on Marathon day it was not obvious. Breakfast was very good - lots of choice and while things did run out on Marathon day staff coped well and replenished as soon as they could. Room very comfortable and quiet even with air con on and main road outside. As in many hotels worldwide non-free WiFi is an issue - but a fact of life. There are two pc's for a few euro an hour in the corner of the lobby bar. Had one evening meal in Cafe Madrid (also where breakfast was served). We had a la carte but buffet was available. Meal was excellent - presentation, flavours, and quality, service at a good price. Courteous and helpful staff at all times. Hotel is in ideal location to walk to many famous sights U-Bahn station and bus stop are 50mts from entrance, S-Bahn is 150 mts. Plenty of restaurants, cafes and shops near by. Thoroughly recommend and would return if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: richcath1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Berlin Melia having found it was offering very good rates for the standard of hotel it is.We were not disappointed.This is a really great hotel,right in the centre of Berlin,surrounded by bars and cafes that stretch from the local station down to the river & then link to the Hackescher Markt. Although we had booked the most basic room we got a river view from our opening,floor length double window.Great for watching the river trips etc.The bed was huge with more pillows than anyone could ever need,the bathroom was very high quality and the room had a fridge & flat screen TV.The soundproofing was spot on,we never heard another guest or any traffic noise.This is a top modern hotel. We cannot recommend it highly enough.Ten out of ten.

Reviews.Title: “ridiculous they call this a 4.5 star, i've stayed in better 3*'s with better service and features”
Reviews.Author: Jiggawha
Reviews.Content: Arrived in a big que in reception, took 20 mins to check in at the very end of the check in things were obviously bad when they were dead set about charging 17 euro a day for wifi. asked to speak to the manager who blamed spain (head office of this outfit) then swisscom their providers. Then the director of sales a Matthias [--] eventually came and talked to us but not before coming to see who we were first then letting our tour guide come over to do his work. He was no more interested in resolving our complaint then practicing his false smile and being smug about my lack of knowledge of Berlin. Single beds, a dire green colour throughout, views of a wall.. oh but it was clean, which is guess is expected.. 4.5 star.. ha ha ha ha ha ha ha what a joke.. PS there's free internet in a coffee shop around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “If you are touring in and around Berlin for a while, this hotel is for you”
Reviews.Author: NormBC
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin offers two irresistible attractions for the person staying more than a day or two in the area: really good rooms and an excellent location. The Melia Berlin's rooms vary in size, but are typically much bigger that the cookie cutter ones you will find at 'business hotels' the Berlin Hilton--and yet the Melia is in fact also very popular with European business travelers. These rooms are tastefully appointed, with excellent beds, plenty of storage space, and very large, well designed bathrooms. Melia rooms are likely to be particularly valued by those who need a little quiet time while traveling. If in contrast you need just a clean bed and a shower and are out all day, there are cheaper alternatives out there. Location? The Melia is located within easy walking distance of all the major museums, the Concert House, and everything South to the bottom of Friedrichstraße and West to the Brandenburg Gate. A subway station and rail station are both about two blocks away. Good value restaurants can be found just to the north across the river, and at least four really posh ones are within a fairly short stroll. Tegel Airport is about 20 minutes away by taxi (fare, about 20 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Location matters”
Reviews.Author: Venkatesht
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and turned out to be the right choice. My wife and I spent 3 days there with our 3 year old on our first visit to Berlin. For first timers to Berlin, we would recommend that you start off with a boat tour which starts just next to the Hotel. Once done, you can use the hotel as the base to cover most of the tourist sites. Numerous cafes/restaurants close to the hotel proved to be convenient. Earlier reviews had criticism of the breakfast coz of the cost, but we found the breakfast to be perfectly ok and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in ideal location. Great...”
Reviews.Author: AnneR60
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in ideal location. Great room with lovely views over the river Spree. Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: BJPDunfermline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Melia for three nights on a city break in Berlin, the hotel is very nice and perfectly placed for trains from the airport and walking distance from most of the major attractions, we bought a 72hr travel ticket for 22 euros each when we arrived at the station, this gave us unlimitted travel across Berlin either by rail,metro, tram or bus which was great value for money. Breakfasts in the hotel were fantastic, rooms were very comfortable and spotless, all in all a perfect hotel for a sightseeing break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eleanorcoyne
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights iin august, Very good hotel-had an inside room on 6th floor no noise,Excellent location near many tourist attractions and situated in one of the best parts of the city.Breakfast is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for that 1st class weekend away - 4 Star indeed :)”
Reviews.Author: cbrass
Reviews.Content: Hopefully this review will help those looking to find a top notch hotel with easy access to all the tourist spots. We looked through similar reviews and were still unsure of where to stay, but staying in the Mitte area of the city was a briliant choice. LOCATION After landing, the train station is right next to the airport, just a 2 minute walk. There is an express train every half an hour that stops at most of the major tourist sposts and costs just 2-3 euros each (the same trip by taxi is 50 euros per cab, no comparison), four stops and just another 20 mins later you get off at the station; "Friedrichstraße". Walk out of the station and 150 yards towards the river and you get the the Melia hotel, close enough for easy commuting and yet far enough never to hear one single train. The transport system as a whole is great, you can buy a day pass if you wish which costs about 6 euros each and this alows unlimited travel on buses, trains and the underground. To be honest though, depending on your itinery, most of the areas area accesable by a 20 min walk. Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate, TV Tower, The Reichstag and many more are even less. My advice is don't waste your money on the open top bus tours, take a 1 hour boat trip up the River Spree and you will get to see where the main highlights are situated (the stop for this is right outside the hotel lobby, the 4 hour one would be too long as there isn;'t enough sites to fill the time). HOTEL ROOM You probably know now that i loved the location so onto the hotel itself. From the moment you walk into the lobby untill the second you check out you will see that there is little or nothing to complian about. The checking in part was simple and quick and the hotel is imaculately clean. We booked into a Comfort room but as i had heard reviews on the Level Rooms i decided to enquire on arrival. The receptionist explained that the suppliment for this room was 60 euros a night which i was reluctant to pay as the hotel had already cost us enough but i asked to be shown the room available. The standard rooms are all on floors 1-6 whilst the Level (executive) is on the 7th. The rooms are spacious, recently modernised, air conditioned and kept spotless. They are also realy well insulated and stop any noise passing through the walls. These rooms are larger, they face the river, they have complimentary bath robes etc and best of all you get use of the executive Lounge. EXECTUTIVE LOUNGE The lounge provides breakfast up until 10 am where continental, British and Spanish foods are available along with a selection of inclusive hot and cold drinks, including champagne. From 11am untill 6pm they put out and top up a wide selection of soft drinks, hot and also beers. Finally from 6pm to 11pm they provide the same but also spirits and a wide selection of Spanish snacks which always differ and taste outstanding. Through the exec restaraunt there is a relaxing lounge whhich is just like being at home with great views. In here there is a TV and lots of different daily newspapers. A point to make is that i never saw any children on the Level or in the lounge areas so it may be worth checking out if they are permitted. If you arent in the exec rooms then you have to eat on the ground floor, the times to do so are shorter and there is a lot less choice. Also a free newspaper is sent to your room everyday. BOOK IT RESTARAUNTS If i'm honest the first of our three nights, we arrived late-ish so just sat in the exec lounge and filled up on the snacks supplied. However, the second night, we decided to eat in one of the hotels restaraunts. We chose the Spanish tapas one which was a typical type but the quality, presentation and value was well worth it. There was a second international restaraunt on the 1st floor but we never got to try it, don't be put off this hotel if you read bad reports of the food because we can vouch for it and if Spanish isn't your choice then there are pleanty of places to eat outside the hotel, all within a five minute walk. NIGHTLIFE If you are like us and enjoy a leisurly stroll at night, eat out and try a few bars then this place is perfect. As i say places to eat are close and easy to find (Saturday was rather busy so not a bad day to eat in), and on the other side of the river Spree there is a quaint river side street with several bars to sit back relax and drink, or dine if you so wish. BEWARE!!!!! On the other side of the river is a restaraunt called The Grill which is a really lovely looking place but be prepared to pay the earth, it cost 70 euros for a Steak and Vodka with Cranberry Juice, and to be honest the steak was discusting. I made the mistake of not checking the prices first and got caught. For that i wanted a cow. Apart from this all the rest were fine and value for money so don't be afraid to try the local cuisine.
