POINTS TO NOTE: 1) 1hr cruise, not the 4hr. 2) Don't take the night one as there isn't much light along the river so you won't see many sights. 3) Tell the hotel staff its a special occasion and they will treat you like royalty. 4) Visit the TV tower in the day as the views are great. 5) Stay away from taxis. 6) Stay in the Level if you like peace and quiet. 7) Try the hotels food on the Saturday as twn is busy. 8) Pay a trip to Alexanderplatz for hustle and bustle and also the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sir_felix1
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the heart of Berlin is in perfect location next to trainstop Friedrichstraße, about 15 easy minutes nice walk to Brandenburger Tor. Take a room to the inside, this might not be nice, but very quite and the view to the river Spree costs extra. The breakfast buffet is excellent and can be well recommended. They even have 4 different newspapers (some English). As this is a Spanish hotel chain, a lot of Spanish is spoken there. If you are a Spanish speaker - this is the hotel to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Eleni X
Reviews.Content: Best place, best stuff, best rooms, everything perfect! If my english was good, I would write something more but I rated this hotel with a few words!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ready2travel06
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights - very nice modern hotel. Having a MAS card promotes the breakfast buffet (very extensive - delicious!) at 'two for one' cost. At check-in this was stated as 11 euro. At check out - 22 euro! This confusion lead to some disenchantment with the hotel. Definitely clarify the total cost of the buffet at check in!! There are alternative places for a quick light breakfast outside the hotel. Also, the Tapas restaurant attached to the hotel ... menu beyond tapas - not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Huyggens
Reviews.Content: We spent a long week end in this hotel. Melia top quality in the best part of berlin. We booked the Level. impressive.

Reviews.Title: “the most excellent choice for a perfect stay in berlin”
Reviews.Author: stavySalonika
Reviews.Content: The best choice a family could make to be able to have a really excellent and comfortable stay in berlin especially when having teenage children with them. The hotel is perfect very comfortable and within walking distance to everywhere. Unter den Linden and all historical sights can be reached in moments on foot or by S-bahn,U-bahn and buses100 and 200 which go everywhere and are a stone away from the hotel.The trams which also run to the east side of Berlin go up and down Friedrichstrasse in front of the hotel. Boats up and down the Spree river also begin next to the hotel bridge. And of course coming from the airport and having to carry your luggage only 50 metres to your hotel is very relaxing. Dont bother taking the breakfast deal ,15 euros per person is a lot of money when you have everything around you.Great breakfast and lunch room just next the hotel a great Starbucks a few steps away a fantastic bakery across the street all open all day long. And Rossman supermarket just across the street.No problem about having breakfast or coffee anytime you wake up! The only very annoying thing I must rever to about the hotel is the very late cleaning of the rooms. When you return exhausted from your daily sightseeing at about 4.30 it is very annoying to find the staff in your room still working and needing about an hour more to finish without you being able to go even to the toilet!!!!!When I complained at the reception and said that the children needed to rest they apologised and noted down that they will tell the staff to do our rooms earlier since we go out very early in the morning and return this time. The next day the same situation ended up with me having to find the lady in charge of the cleaning staff on the second floor who of course was very embarised and apologised and sent someone right away when I explained that I had kindly asked the reception for a second time to send someone and had been waiting for over an hour to have the childrens room cleaned and keeping them meanwhile in my room without them being able to take their shoes off. All the family wasent able to rest that afternoon the time was nearly 6oclock in the afternoon and because of the outragious behaviour of the reception training boy?????? we had lost our afternoon rest which is very important when you are on vacation and have made a program which has to be kept if you want your family to have a nice time. I thought of mentioning it to the hotel manager but that would probably mean losing even more precious time. Anyway we only had two more days left so we put our DO NOT DISTURB signs outside our rooms for the rest of our stay to find some peace at last!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny78
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks over the River Spree, and is walking distance to all the sights. The U and S-Bahn stations are a few steps away as well. The room was absolutely beautiful! Huge, super-comfortable bed within a massive room. We chose a room with a balcony and were happy with people watching from above. The staff was courteous and friendly. We booked the hotel 6 months in advance and got a crazy deal on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations - Nothing too exciting. Good Location though!”
Reviews.Author: isla_bee
Reviews.Content: I expected this hotel to be out of this world. its way too expensive - I was offered Breakfast at €22 per person or if I booked it when checking in, it would by €15 per person, as if they were doing me a favour! I politely declined! It has a great location but I'm not sure its good value for money. Room very basic - tv hasn't enough choice for english speaking patrons. There was only two channels we could watch. No tea/coffee/water facilities and for a hotel of this standard I would expect this at least. On plus side, the beds were extremely comfortable. Air conditioning hit and miss!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove around Germany (our first time to Germany) and we found everthing excellent about the hotel. Location excellent, clean, modern,comfortable, quiet, freindly and helpful staff. As we had a car, there were no free car parks at the time of arrival, so the concierge kept going down to the car park (there was a conference on at the hotel) to see if people had left. He called us on our mobile, told us of the free car space, wnet with my husabd to park the car. Now, I call that good service. Yes, as usual breakfast at hotels is expensive, so I cannot comment on the food, but there are plenty of cafe's around to get breakfast. The bar was great, the barman let us taste some of their wines before decieding what wine we were going to drink. We chose this hotel due to the reviews and were not in the least disappointed. Hopefukky one day I will go back to Berlin and would stay at the Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: Woofarama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good. The staff are lovely, the rooms are lovely the underfloor heating in the bathroom is really good. Room service food was really good. The location is great you really can't beat it. Unfortunately it's a shame that the beds that we had in our room were so uncomfortable that for 2 nights of our stay we barely slept and had to cancel some of our plans as we were so tired. The staff were great and changed our room and although the 2nd room's beds were better they still weren't that comfortable. It's all very well saying that no-one has ever complained about the beds before, maybe they thought it but didn't say anything! Anyway, although we found the beds uncomfortable for those reading this you might not and I would definately recommend this hotel to you. As stated before, its location is great, accross from the train station and next to the river - go on a river tour, but make sure you have commentry in english - we had 3 hours of German! There are plenty of places to eat - for just a snack go to the train station as there are loads of places there. Or go accross the bridge and go to Vaparetto and have their lovely pizzas. Also at the end of the block going into the center underneath all the railway arches there's a few good places to eat there. Tours are a must and Brewers tours from outside Bandy Brooks Ice Cream place are fab. We did the 3rd Reich tour and Tony is a mine of information - make sure you have comfy shoes on as this tour will last about 5-6 hours! Also, walking tours in English were really good - we did the cold war tour and it was fascinating as it shows all the areas where there is still loads of the wall standing. After the tour we went to the Stasi Museum which is at the old stasi headquaters - it's very atmospheric. I would have liked it more if there had been english translations for the displays but you can get the gist of what's been going on as there are thousands of photos! Also don't forget to go to the holocaust memorial - it's really interesting and very well put together. Museum island is great - you absolutely must go and see the newly opened Altes Museum which has the bust of Nefertiti which is stunning. The museum itself was amazing. Also go to see the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church - it is beautiful. Berlin is a fab city with a lot to see so make sure you get a good night's sleep and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “"ideal for Business traveller, good location, nice restaurants close by"”
Reviews.Author: altkoenig1975
Reviews.Content: modern, clean business hotel. No excessive frills, but very modern rooms, the hotel feels much newer than some of the established chain hotels. Also, usually less expensive than the big chain hotels, but offers equivalent quality. Good location close to the river with nice restaurants on the river side (just across the river from the hotel). Walking distance to the parliament, 20 minutes to the chancellors office. If you want to combine your business trip with a quick sightseeing stroll, I recommend walking up the river to see the parliament building, the chancellors office.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Modern, Spotlessly clean, Excellent service, Very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Whale_shark_23
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; we had the cheapest 'comfort' room and it was modern, exceptionally clean and newly decorated. We had a quiet courtyard view and two doors that opened fully, plus air conditioning. The bathroom was particularly nice. Service was excellent. We were allowed to check-in 5 hours early at no extra charge, which was particularly appreciated after a long, early-morning journey. The hotel was good value too. 10/10 and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tineke_9
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to the Friedrichstrasse station (includes underground), close to 'Unter den Linden ' en Museuminsel. Nice spacious room, well equipped bathroom Wonderful breakfast buffet with sparkling wine, smoked salmon, ...

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paparisvas
Reviews.Content: The Melia has an excellent location overlooking the river and a 2 minute walk to the S (trains) and the U (underground) in Zone 1. It is a pleasant 10 minute walk to the Reichstag. The hotel is confortable and well laid out. Some bad things were no porter to help with suitcases and the elevator is through the restaurant which is rather bizzare. Alos WIFI access is very expensive. You should get a Melia card through the internet as you get breakfast at half price (11 EUR rather than 22EUR) and we upgraded our room for just 15Eur per night which was great. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: minidog
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January 2010, for 4 nights. After getting a good deal online, I was really pleased with the room, which was pretty large, with a very big bed, nice modern bathroom and TV with English channels in the mix. In terms of cleanliness, the hotel is immaculate. There's wireless internet, but it's not free -- although I could access emails/Twitter on my iPhone without paying. If you want to do work on a laptop, you'll have to pay. We had a pretty high room, with views over the river ... nothing special to look at, but I have no complaints. The hotel is in a great location on Friedrichstrasse, very close to the train/subway station. You're no more than 12-15 minutes walk away from the Reichstag, University and Brandenburg Gate. At the Melia, you're also not too far from the bus stop from the airport -- get off the bus at Unter Den Linden, which crosses with Friedrichstrasse, the road on which the hotel is located (but if you have a lot of luggage, you might not want the extra 5 minute walk to the hotel). The Melia staff were polite and helpful. I didn't use the restaurants or room service -- it looked okay, maybe a little expensive for what it was, but I'd always choose to eat outside of my hotel when travelling anyway. There's so many good places to eat in Berlin; just check your guide book. There was some complimentary drinking water in the room, then the rest of the minibar had a charge -- a bit pricey, but not the crazy prices you might expect, though. I'd definitely consider staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fab4lawsons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the melia berlin for a weekend break and paid extra to stay on the Level. The service was excellent & staff really friendly and helpfull. The room was immaculate with a brilliant view over the river spree. The most comfortable bed ever with an amazing array of pillows our bed was even made ready again at bedtime with a bag of sleepy sheep left on the pillows. Staying on the level gives extra benefits of being able to have coffee anytime in the breakfast room & in the evening alcholic drinks were also available plus nibbles also a smoking lounge if needed all included in price. The location is perfect for visiting all berlins highlights and station nearby which was very easy to use. We loved the whole experience of staying on the level and would definately stay again there wasn't anything we didn't enjoy about our stay the hotel made it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Zerovis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife whilst undergoing an operation in Berlin. As we were going to be using the room quite a bit whilst recovering we opted for 'The Level'. The rooms were spacious and modern and beautifully decorated. They supply five or six different types of pillow and the bed was extremely comfortable. I cannot praise the hotel enough, not only meeting but exceeding my expectations. The staff were extremely efficient and friendly. The food consisted of a European style buffet with eggs cooked to order and snacks were available throughout the day. We only saw four or five others in the private eating area in our time there and added to an exclusive feeling. Next to the eating area is a relaxation lounge where you can smoke. This has air conditioning so it always feels fresh and not smokey. Room service, whilst not cheap, is reasonable and I had one of the best steaks in my life. We also had an evening meal at the main restaurant overlooking the river and was blown away with the food and service. The hotel is well situated for all of the major attractions within a 10-20 minute walk, taxis are plentiful and reasonable. Berlin has a lot to offer but in my naivety and if it wasn't for the operation I wouldn't have chosen Berlin as a destination. Now I can't wait to go again, and I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BelfastNelly
Reviews.Content: Loved the Melia. Excellent staff, room was large, very nicely decorated, great bathroom, lovely balconette. Room service a joy after a tiring trip there. Hotel spotless and in a great location. Choose the Melia- you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl789
Reviews.Content: Came to berlin for a long weekend with my husband and stayed at the melia hotel. It was right near the train station and right on the river so great location. The hotel itself was nice and clean, big bed, they only gave one bathrobe and pair of slippers though. the bathroom was nice. there was only two channels in english bbc news and cnn but no matter. we had breakfast at the hotel one morning - we got it for half price so 11 euro each since i am a sol melia member but full price is very expensive at 22 euro each for breakfast. there was a lot of choice however and the breakfast room had a nice view of the river.\ Overall would recommend this hotel and would stay again if the price was right

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: smeewee
Reviews.Content: hotel has the best location, price and service. I would definately go back to this hotel for future trips. The location is right next to a station with just about all sites wihtin walking distance! breakfast not worth it.. better to buy food from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational for first visit to Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Astronomer61
Reviews.Content: First trip to Berlin. The Melia could not have been in a better location for tourists. Pretty much equidistant from the Reichstag, the Pergamon Museum and Unter Den Linden. Friedrichstrasse U-Bahn and S-Bahn and Bahnhof are a hundred feet away. Whilst the foyer area is bland the room was great and having a balcony with a view of the Spree was a treat... (and a view of the Berliner Ensemble Theatre!). Our rating is based on staying in the room category that they call 'The Level' rooms. These give you access to an incredible breakfast spread set up in a group of rooms which include a lounge and more importantly great staff including a manager/concierge who in our stay was a fantastic help including showing extraordinary patience with a PC connection that wasn't behaving for us. We paid about 230 Euros a night and I think this was great value. Only complaint is the gym equipment is well below standard most frequent travelers would expect.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: robp26
Reviews.Content: had a good experience here, the only challlenge we had was that we wanted to stay for 3 nights, but for some reason the rate for monday was twice that of sat and sun nights so we chose to move somewhere else instead. service and location good. room good. bear in mind that most basic double rooms in germany give you two single matttresses and two single duvets side by side fyi.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location; great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyCA21
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a friend's advice we decided to stay in the area near Unter Der Linden and Friedrichstrasse. She was right; we were walking distance to most major sites and only two or three blocks from Berlin's fabulous transportation system. I booked our stay with Expedia after researching many Berlin hotels. We got a fabulous rate, approximately $150 for our room, without breakfast. We will definitely look for the Melia name in the future. Our room was near the corner of the hotel with a spectacular view of the river and windows that opened! All the amenities (robes, toiletries, AC, minibar, etc.) were provided along with heated bathroom floors. The room was very large, with a small table and two chairs along with a long desk. Bed was very comfortable with good linens; as with most European hotels, the comforters were too warm for our taste, so housekeeping provided top sheets. There is a tapas restaurant and bar on the main floor, and another, more elegant restaurant in house. The gym and spa area looked good, but we walked all over Berlin instead. I highly recommend a restaurant on the other side of the river, west of the bridge, and past the street with the Berthold Brecht theater; don't remember the name, but it was touted in one of the guidebooks as being a former hangouts for reporters, politicos, etc. It was packed on a Monday night, so we ate at the bar. The pork chops and saurrkraut were delicious and the people watching was great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tellerIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay at the Melia and I can highly recommend this hotel. As mentioned earlier it is in a great location within walking distance of all the main attractions. The train station is just down the street and it is not sleazy or unsafe, my self and my girlfriend found it to be a very safe area and friedrichstrasse is a very upmarket street with lots of designer shops. There are also lots of restaurants bars and cafes close by. I was in two minds whether to stay near Alexander Platz or here, I was glad I chose here because of its location although Alexander Platz is only a 15 min walk away. The only downside is the breakfast is very expensive 22 euro per person, we were offered a discount rate of 15 per person when we checked in but we declined as there are lots of places literally next door to the hotel where you can get breakfast from as little as 4euro. Besides breakfast finishes at 10.30 so you have to be up early even if you've been out late the night before. The hotel is clean, quiet and the room service is very good. There is a lovely Tapas bar/restaurant attached to the hotel and the food here was great. I would Highly recommend the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT EAT IN THE RESTAURANT!!”
Reviews.Author: strawberryjellybean
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good things about this hotel - its in a good location, near the train station but also close to the river and a good selections of bars and restaurants. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the quality of the bedding is very good. Now for the bad points. The rooms were quite small, the air con could not be set below a certain point which we found too hot for us at night. The cost of extras such as wi-fi, mini-bar, movies and breakfast was high - apart from the wi-fi we didn't really mind any of this. Finally we made the mistake of eating tapas in the restaurant one evening - my advice is stay away! The ding of the microwave along with the speed at which our food was brought to the table set the alarm bells ringing in my head. I understand that restaurants often pre-prepare items however I do not accept that every single item in a large order should be reheated in a microwave before serving. Not one single plate we ordered was freshly cooked. Worse my garlic chicken came out hot on the outside and cold in the middle. Worse again I found a large lump of a plastic bag in another dish. When I called this to the attention of our waitress she giggled and said she would replace the chicken. Now I firmly believe that if a diner's food is returned cold then the serving staff should make it a priority to reheat and re-serve the dish. Not here. As the minutes ticked by I watched our waitress dance in front of the 'chef' (microwave operator might be a more accurate job title) who was obviously on a break. Twenty minutes later I called her over and asked her to forget the chicken and just to bring the bill. She looked surprised and 'kindly' offered not to charge us for the cold chicken or the jamon with plastic. Needless to say we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel for the rest of our stay. To be honest the experience has put me off staying at the Melia next time I am in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the melia hotel for the...”
Reviews.Author: USA123WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the melia hotel for the weekend. It is a great hotel. It is spotlessly clean and has large rooms. The best part about the hotel is it's location. It is on the river, in between the Mitte disctrict, with all attractions being in walking distance. It also has great restaurants around it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and Central”
Reviews.Author: erichschlaikjer
Reviews.Content: I was mostly just passing through Berlin this time, but had Sunday evening free and stayed here. Total cost 97 euro. Room was quiet and clean. Bathroom was relatively fancy. Internet access was exorbitant so I went without. No handy alarm clock so I used my phone. I had missed the Holocaust Memorial last time, and it was easy walking distance. I had dinner at StäV, which is nearby and nice if you want cheap German food and a view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments, despite all the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: yorkietrav
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 4 night stay on The Level and was highly pleased with all aspects. As we arrived at Schonefeld airport the transfer could not have been simpler with the train ticket costing a mere €2.80. Location was perfect either for walking, catching the U-Bahn, boat trips on the River Spree or joining Insider Tours (for a couple of guided walking tours which incidentally were well worth it). We were delighted with our room, which although not overly large was perfectly adequate, as it overlooked the central courtyard and so was nice and quiet but also had fabulous views of the Berliner Dom, the red brick clock tower of the Rathaus and the TV Tower. No noise from within the hotel either despite being close to the lifts which was good as there is nothing worse than listening to every toilet flush and bath running etc. Service was excellent and friendly throughout.The light went out above the shower and was replaced immediately and we were able to keep our room until 4 p.m. as we had a late afternoon return flight. Breakfast and evening drinks (with tapas selection) in The Level lounge were first class. In fact I would definitely recommend staying on The Level as if you book sufficiently well in advance you can pay the same as you would for an ordinary room without an included breakfast. The bathroom was modern, spotlessly clean and a triumph for German/Spanish (?)plumbing and tiling. Room had tea/coffee making facilities which were replenished daily as well as a mini bar which was not really necessary given the drinks available in the lounge. If I was going to be really ‘picky’ the bed, despite having good quality linens and pillow menu was a little bit unyielding for my taste and not quite as comfortable as some North American chain hotels offer. However, this would not stop me staying here again. In fact 4 days is nowhere near long enough to see all the sights and sounds of such a modern, progressive and vibrant city - so we will definitely be back. Incidentally, we felt very safe walking around at all times, our only minor gripe was the entrance costs for galleries/museums (in the region of €12 each), but then we are suffering from poor currency exchange rates and spoilt by the fact many museums in London are free.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_in_Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a two week trip in Germany and Paris, Melia was definetely the best value for money on this trip and in a long time Very impressed with this hotel on many levels Everyone has already said it, but I will say it again; great location, nice strolls to many of the sites, public transport on your doorstep room, was really good, great size and fantastic bed, the wife was really impressed with the bathroom breakfast, one of the most impressive selections I have ever seen, and fantastic quality service was for the most part really good and on top of this was at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great base for sightseeing, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lovemyholidays88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Berlin for four nights, Monday through Friday. Our room was 614 and looked into the courtyard so had no view but was very quiet, which suited us. We were very impressed with the room, beautifully equipped, very clean, comfortable and modern. We got excellent tourist advice from the hotel staff from concierge to porters. The hotel location on Friedrichstrasse is great and within easy walking distance to Unter den Linden, Brandenberg Gate, Reichstag, Tiergarten and Checkpoint Charlie. It was also close to the railway station and river (great cruises too). There was a good room service but restaurant eating was quite expensive (for example, 22 euro per person for breakfast). There was a superb alternative across the road in the station though. There is no tea/coffee facility in the room, but we were aware of this, so we took a travel kettle which worked out fine. I would definitely recommend the Melia Berlin, and would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Berlin over the 3 day holiday weekend and have only positive things to say about the hotel. From the tourist’s perspective the hotel’s location is just perfect. It is walking distance to the Brandenberg Gate, Unter den Linden, and Museum Island. I have no idea how the previous poster could find the area “unsavory”, as it was rather quite central and felt very safe, even when walking around at night. The hotel is not by the main train station, but rather by a subway / street car stop, which is actually quite convenient. Our room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. We loved the king size bed with tons of comfy pillows. We had a room facing the courtyard so it was also very quiet. The reception staff were friendly and efficient. I guess the only slight negative is that the hotel breakfast was quite expensive and so we ended up eating elsewhere. But there were lots of nice cafes and restaurants in the immediate area so it wasn’t a big deal. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...I've Been to Better”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva
Reviews.Content: It was okay. I expected better based on previous reviews. Location is central and very close to Friedrichstrasse train station, making it very convenient, however, I generally find areas that close to train stations are a little unsavory, and this was no exception. We saw a couple IV needles on the ground and a used condom. The accommodations themselves were good. For whatever reason our room didn't get cleaned one day - not a huge issue as we're fairly tidy people, but would have appreciated it. We've found most hotels these days offer free wi-fi and were quite surprised at the astronomical charges they had for theirs. Overall, we didn't find the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good standard for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHews
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest but a good location and very large comfortable room. Best breakfast sread I have seen for a while which cancelled out the need for Lunch.! Mainly used for Business so you get all the extras you'd expect. including a helpful concierge Very close to station and easy to transfer to Schonefeld airport in 20-25 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ACVIANA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, large comfortable rooms, wonderful staff. Breakfast is pricy so I decided to skip it and went across the river for 1/2 the price. Pet peeve: no coffee/tea maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: kimstone2
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in ideal location but make sure you sign up (internet) for the MAS loyalty card to get the 2 for 1 breakfast which at 22euro is expensive but well worth 11euro. Staff deserve a special word of praise as they were always friendly, helpful, and courteous and would go beyond the call of duty if necessary (eg they organised some special things for a fellow traveller's 60th birthday). Would also reccommend the 'Insider Tours' walking tour (c15euro & 4 hours) starting just outside Hackescher Markt station (if you get Kenny as a guide, that's a bonus). Berlin Welcome card (from internet or tourist info. offices) to cover all public transport costs is well worth while too.

Reviews.Title: “Best position you could want”
Reviews.Author: DavidHBerkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Four days in "The Level" -executive rooms on the top two floors of this modern and well appointed hotel on the river in the middle of the old centre. This has to be the best situated hotel in Berlin. From the hotel you can walk to the Reichstag (view from our room), the cathedral, a host of museums, Unter den Linden, The Gendarme Markt the Brandenburg gate, the Friedrichstrasse shops and arcades, and the Hackesche markt area in fifteen minutes. Also the Friedrichstrasse station , two minutes away, is the biggest hub for all of Berlin's S bahn (overground) and U Bahn (underground) rail networks so you can get anywhere in the Berlin area , including Potsdam, really conveniently. Nearby you have a row of riverside restaurants including the Vaporetto which we found to be of decent quality at good prices. We'd been due to stay at the Circus till our trip was cancelled by "ash" and had to change when we rearranged. I have no experience of the Circus, and albeit I know its a lot cheaper it is also much less conveniently situated for most tourism in Berlin. The hotel itself was fine; albeit that the "Level" experience insulates you from the mainstream hotel to a large degree. Breakfasts were good and varied, and the drinks and nibbles made available to Level guests were fine too. The room whilst not large was certainly big enough, and bigger than I've had in many city centre hotels. Everything worked, everything was of decent quality , and whenever we asked for help we got it. In all our expectations were exceeded and our hopes were met.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a 1st time visitor to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dp2009
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights at the Melia after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. It was a very nice hotel, great location near one of the main stations and overlooking the river. We upgraded for a superior room with river views and doors that open out onto the river. I don't think these rooms were quite worth the extra money as the river wasn't the spectacular city view I had maybe had in mind (it's no Paris or London!) although they would be nicer in the summer. Hotel is very well maintained, nice modern rooms and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HunterA
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend in Berlin and chose to stay at the Melia Berlin from the reviews on Tripadvisor - what an excellent choice. As well as being in a great central location our room was clean and well kept with a spacious bathroom, we couldn't have asked for more. We did not have breakfast included as we enjoy going out in the morning and finding local cafes for breakfast but it was offered to us at a much reduced rate when we checked in. We did have a room that was away from the street and was incredibly quiet but I am not sure what the rooms facing onto the street would be like in terms of noise as you are very close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Recently built hotel with Spanish character, but hot stuffy rooms”
Reviews.Author: OldChap33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2010. Very good location indeed. Modern hotel, with Spanish features eg tapas bar. Lovely rooms, lovely bathroom. We paid £107 per night inc breakfast, through Expedia. Actually there was a large breakfast restaurant right next door you could go to if you wished. But the hotel breakfast is really really excellent, get it included if you can. The hotel is a few yards from the canal; an hour's boat trip is excellent, and starts nearby. The bedroom temperature in the hotel wouldn't go lower than 23c, the hotel supplied a thick duvet rather than the preferred sheets and blankets, it was so hot we didn't sleep much the first night. We asked the hotel for sheets and blankets instead of the duvet, and they gave us one sheet only which wasn't much good. No free wifi, but the desk said you could eat at the breakfast place next door and they gave you free wifi!! Anyway, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLR&SLR
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend in Berlin - we stayed at the Melia Berlin - on the Executive Floor (the Level). The room was spacious, clean, comfortable (the bed and pillows were just so comfortable!!) and very quiet (a bonus in a big city!). The amenities were adequate:tea and coffee making facilitie, flat screen, info on Berlin, hairdryer, etc...The bathroom was very good, even though the toiletries could have been a bit more "exciting"... The breakfast at the Level was fantastic. You could choose between English breakfast (beans, sausages, bacon, eggs, meatballs, etc) and/or continental (pastries, bread, jams, etc) Everything was very good. The location is fantastic - you are 10-minute walk away from everywhere. And the station next door is great for small eateries (there's even a fish&chips place!), little supermarket, newsagent, etc... I would not even look at staying anywhere else but the Melia Berlin if I went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dghp9
Reviews.Content: Booked the Melia based on previous reviews and they are all true. Super clean rooms, great location and easy access to the airport at the train station across the street. Berlin is a great city to visit with lots of the main sights accessible on foot. Highly recommend the Melia

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice, great hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: vayio
Reviews.Content: First of all having payed 65 Euros/night, for 4-star hotel room, at the very centre of Berlin, it's something extraordinary by its own. Hotel is located near Spree river, 5 mins walk from Unten den Linden, 10 mins walk from Branderburg's gate, the Reichstag and museum's island from the other side. Also Friedrichstrasse (hotel's street), is the city's main shopping avenue. There is the S-bahn and U-bahn station near the hotel, which is very convenient. From there Alexander Platz is 2 stops away, the zoo 3 stops away, also Branderburg's gate 1 stop away if someone wants to avoid the 10 mins walk. Best of all, the express train line from Schonenfeld airport stop right there. Around the hotel are many cafes, restaurants and also small ones that offer sausages (wurst), and doner on foot. Inside the train station, exist many shops, bakeries and super markets open till late night, some of then are 24 h open. The room was just perfect, comfortable, spacius, with a king size bed with perfect matress and many comfortable pillows, shiny bathroom, LCD TV, free internet, safe,well soundproofed ect. As a conclusion Melia hotel is an excellent choice in every way and a great value for money... For me is the ONLY choice if I visit Berlin again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LineAndersen
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend the Melia Berlin hotel. Perfect location, very nice and clean rooms and fantastic breakfast. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: annelizabethSurrey
Reviews.Content: The Melia is right in the heart of Unter den Linden with shops, bars and restaurants on the doorstep. We paid a little extra for a room with a river view which was well worth it. Would recommend the bars and restaurants that run along the side of the river as they are good and close to home after a hard day pounding the streets sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Les005
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, spacious bathroom. Great breakfast, the locationwas amazing... right around the corner from Museum Island. We walked everywhere in Berlin.... Love this city !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Melia Berlin. The locaion is perfect, near the U Bahn and S Bahn, walking distance to many restaurants, museums, and main tourist atractions. The rooms was spacious, with a king size bed, comfortable, modern and clean. We got a view of the river. Staff was cordial. The hotel order a taxi to take us to Tegel Airport and cost about E$ 20,00. Nearby we recomended the restaurantes: Ganymed, fancing the river, a italian restaurant called Vapiano at Mittelstrasse, and just around the corner a Bistro, Guten Morgan Franz. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: vidhusagar
Reviews.Content: True to the reviews we enjoyed a great stay at the hotel. It enjoys a great location,service is excellent and amenities good. You will not regret the choice and I will surely go back if I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Sagar S
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Melia Berlin. The hotel is located about 25 meters from the U-Bahn (Metro), giving you quick access to all parts of the city. The executive floor is convenient and all drinks and snacks are free between 6 and 10 Pm. The staff are friendly and happy to serve you. They kept my luggage for a few days without any hassles. The hotel has a Tapas bar and a Spanish restaurant. You will find a number of other hotels around the Melia. The rooms are big and clean and the flooring in the bathroom was well heated for winter. I would go back to the Melia if I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “we were really pleased with it”
Reviews.Author: RuaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short break at end December and were very pleased with this hotel. It is really comfortable and the location is brilliant- so close to the station and within walking distance of the main sights. We enjoyed a night in the various bars across the river near the theatre. Would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel excellent value”
Reviews.Author: 29hillcrest
Reviews.Content: We got the airport express train to the Friedrichstrasse train station just walked across the road to the hotel The hotel is in a really central position, Friedrich Strasse is in the heart of the city: you have the main tourist attractions just a short walk away and plenty of restaurants and bars nearby . The U bann is outside the hotel and is a short hop down to checkpoint charlie if you are feeling lazy , The rooms in the hotel are big with a good sized bathroom , the rooms were keep spotless all the times . We had a room facing the courtyard and it was nice and quiet . The bed was large and very comfortable best few nights sleep in any hotel . We did not eat in the hotel but the staff very helpful especially at the front desk ( Christin ).Would recommend this hotel . We bought the welcome pass at the airport and this covered all local trains trams and buses and you also got discounts into certain attraction when you buy the ticket it comes with a booklet giving the full details, try taking the no 100 bus as this goes from the Alexanderplatz to the berlin zoo and it covers some of the main tourist stops great value as it is covered by the pass

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, and pleasant in every way”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Jetten
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most pleasant hotels I ever stayed in. The building is only a few years old with a nice modern and warm design and nice views over the river Spree. Some rooms are facing the street, some the river, and some the courtyard. I had a standard room facing the street, with a side-view of the river. It was spacious with tasteful lighting (there are for instance lights under the bedside table, allowing for a dim lighting effect late at night), quiet aircon, good beds and a selection of pillows, a nice seating area with two comfortable chairs, and windows that can be opened to let in some fresh air. The bathroom was equally nice and spacious with bath (I would have preferred a separate shower, but I guess you can't have everything). Some reviewers have complained about the noise of the trams. Although I'm a bit sensitive to noise I did not find it a problem; the building is very well isolated. But if you want to avoid any risk then ask for a room facing the courtyard. The hotel has good wifi, but it comes at (an acceptable) 9 euro per 24h. The breakfast room on the 1st floor has huge windows offering great views over street and river, and the selection of food is very wide and of excellent quality. If breakfast is not included in your rate then make sure to register with the MAS rewards loyalty programme before your stay or at check-in. This will get you a free breakfast for your partner, which brings down the cost from 22 to 11 euro per person. The breakfast is well worth that money, so don't deprive yourself of this pleasure by going to a bakery story in the station. On my next trip to Berlin I will definately stay in this hotel again, and I will recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Great_Idea
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel. We paid 99 euros a night and had two dogs with us. You can not pick a better place to stay. You have everything you could ever want. The staff is so wonderful. The location is perfect. You can't go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Foxhills2
Reviews.Content: Very, comfortable new hotel, 200 metres from Friedrichstrasse SU station. Very convenient for most of the main tourist sights and museums - all walkable within 10 - 15 minutes. We booked a Comfort room and on arrival asked for a courtyard view. It was very quiet but if you want early morning tea in the room take your travel kettle! We chose not to take breaksfast at the hotel as it was 22 euros and found several good alternatives at half the price. Particulary the Ampelman cafe under the railway arches by Museum Island was very good. Take the breakfast for 2 which comes with a glass of Prosecco. Also if you are planning to visit the TV tower, go for 10am and take breakfast in the revolving restaurant for 10 - 15 euros. We took the free walking tour starting from the Brandenburg Gate at 11am or 1pm. An excellent way to get an overview of the main attractions and history of Berlin. Guides first class. A thoroughly enjoyable 4 night stay at this hotel, we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Brumblodwyn2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and were very impressed. It is very close to all the main museums so its location is great. We had booked a standard room without a view but when we arrived were offered an upgrade (at a cost) to a river view room. We found the room and in fact the whole hotel to be spotless, it almost looked brand new. The front desk staff were helpful and polite when we arrived and when we checked out. We only ate some lunch in the tapas bar on one occasion which was fine (fairly standard fare), however the breakfast was very good with a great selection. We didnt find the noise of the trams disturbing (we were on the 6th floor) just a slight rumble every now and again however as it is so centrally located this would probably be the case for most hotels. Very impressed and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and The Best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNorway
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Melia Berlin. The location is great as it is close to both shopping and attractions. Rooms were nice, and service as well. The one thing that really stood out was the breakfast... it was simply the best I have ever experienced. They actually serve champagne at the breakfast, and the selection of breakfast items is huge. They also have a pillow menu, offering all sorts of pillows. Will definiately go there again if coming to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sparklintan
Reviews.Content: Melia Berlin is a very very nice hotel located right next to a major S/U Bahn station. We stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of January right after they had a huge snowstorm. It was very cold outside but our room was very nice. I would have given this hotel 5 stars if the restaurant would of been less expensive and breakfast and internet would of been included. Besides that, the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped. We were pretty jet lag coming in and thankfully we didnt take the 15 euro breakfast that they offered on check in because we missed breakfast every morning. The train station had a dunken donuts and pastry shop in it which was only a couple euros. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't agree that this is a nr. 1 hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marius76
Reviews.Content: I and my girlfriend stayed in a junior suite from the 22nd to the 24th of January. I agree with you all that is good value for money, good location and sevice. BUT: You will hear the traffic and the metros passing the hotel every 5 minutes. The windows are noise isolated, but you will hear the traffic even though the windows are closed. And you will hear a lot if you open the windws. There are also wall to wall carpets in every room (wall to wall carpets belong to the 80s !), so if you have allergies: stay away. Its not possible to keep wall to wall carpets 100 % clean. I made an agreement of a late checkout on Sunday, but they called and asked us to leave the room. There is no free wireless internet, and it costs you 9 EUR for 24 hours. This was my first stay in Berlin. I can not imagine that this is the best hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MFH17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great loaction for all transport linkd to get around. Staff very friendly, very courtous and professtional. On arrival was offered the breakfast deal at 15 euros which was good value ompared to normal rates. Definately would recommend this to others hotel and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Spain in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flier07
Reviews.Content: The Melia is located directly on the river and within easy walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. We booked a suite with a balcony and it was extremely well appointed for the price. The service in the hotel was excellent, as were the tapas in the restaurant. We ate our breakfast in the business lounge and there was a wide variety of options and we were left wanting for nothing, except for perhaps some sweet mustard for our weisswurst. If we ever return to Berlin, the Melia will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with executive floors..”
Reviews.Author: Josephken
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from January the 15th to the 17th, its comfortably located at appr. 15 min from Tegel Airport (car/taxi) and just down the stresst from Friedrichstrasse underground and strassenbahne. Large hotel nestled next to the river Spree. Me and my friends had all opted for the bit more expensive option and booked a "level" suite or a junior suite. This gives you access for free to the rpivate dining and breakfast room, a smoking lounge and is absolutely worth the extra Euro it costs. Otherwise the hotels staff is most polite and service minded. Would absolutely return to this hotel next time I stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthGirl
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. I chose the Melia based on TA reviews as I wanted somewhere close to transport links as I had heard Berlin was spread out. We weren't disappointed as it is located very close to a main line train station. Our flight arrived at 10pm and by 11pm we were sat in the hotel bar. The only thing I was disappointed about was that we only had one dressing gown and we had booked for 2 people, we didn't complain as the front desk was always busy but it was quite a simple thing. Berlin is a great city to visit even in the freezing cold, we had left the UK almost at a standstill due to the snow and Berlin was covered in it and life carrys on as normal. We did a bus tour for 20 euros which I would recommend in the cold as we saw the sights on a nice warm bus! We also bought a 2 day travel ticket which was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed!”
Reviews.Author: PanayiotisMykonos
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The interior as I entered the hotel was not so impressive, but the welcoming and the fast check in reward my first impression. Furthurmore the room was the best experience. The bed was super double with many pillows and very comfortable..a rest to die for!!! The bathroom was big and calming enough for moments of relaxation. My room had a river spree view and although in the centre was very quiet. The only problem was that not all of the stuff was speaking English and could never communicate with the house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bjoern K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the melia last year and it was the perfect hotel in the perfect location. Within seconds of U Bahn and S Bahn and right on the river spree. Walking distance to the Museums Insel and many restaurants and the main Blvd and Branden Burg Gate. The rooms are comfortable na dthe front desk staff was very friendly and accommodationg with early check in and so on. If you visit Berlin this is a great choice of hotel to saty at.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen90
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights stay at the Melia. Having read reviews on here i was expecting a good hotel and wasnt disappointed. The location is excellent, only a short walk to the Reichstag and Brandenburg gate (which was ideal on New Years Eve!) We stayed in THE LEVEL accomodation where you get access to a special lounge serving drinks and canapes in the evenings. The room was a good size and clean and you had tea and coffee making facilities in the room. On the whole the service was good and the staff friendly. However we asked for more coffee for the room which we got from the LEVEL reception. We used some of the sachets that night and left the others on the side. When we got back from our day sight seeing the remaining 'extra' sachets had been removed from the room, we presume by the chamber maid, which we found odd. The turn down service didnt happen on the last night and we were given no glasses to go with the complimentary water we had been given. The tapas bar in the hotel was excellent and good value. If we return to Berlin we will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: A pleasant 4 stars hotel perfectly located that is available at decent prices. The room was comfortable and quiet. The sauna is small and not the most beautiful but this was a minor concern.Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location and much much more!”
Reviews.Author: marcolet
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Melia and like many other reviewers I agree that the location is great. The hotel is almost directly across the road from the Friedrichstraße station where you can get the train directly from the airport (€2.80 for a single trip) and also get S Bahn and U Bahn which make getting around the city very easy. Over the bridge from the hotel are a few lovely bars - Van Gough, Berliner Republik, Standige Vertretung - and plenty options for places to eat are close by. From the hotel it is walking distance to the Reichstag (book lunch to avoid the queues), Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz, Gendarmenmmarkt (lovely Christmas market there) etc. Our room was an executive room on the 8th floor and was spacious and comfortable - looked exactly like picture on hotel web site. We were overlooking a courtyard and in the distance could see the Tv Tower. Good shower, tea coffee making facilities etc, 2 dressing gowns, 2 pairs of slippers and all the usual room amenities. Breakfast was included in our room price and was great. There was plenty of choice of both hot and cold food - cannot see how anyone could complain abut it. There was also a cooking station where omelettes/eggs could be made to order. Plenty fresh fruit, yougurt, pastries, juices etc. We ate just before 8 each morning - seemed to get busy after that time. We ate in the Tapas Restaurant on our first night - it was very good. No free internet - rate I was charged was €4 for half an hour or €6 for an hour. I had also thought about staying in the Regent or the Hilton - having passed both they are also in great location. There are probably about 10 minute walk from the Melia - however am glad we chose the Melia for the transport links and little bars/restaurants close by. Had also looked into staying at the Radisson Blu and when passing it we went in to have look at the acquarium - I think that the location of the Melia is a little better I would have no hesitation in recommending the Melia and would stay again if returning to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: garistodemou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located on the Friedrichstrasse, giving you the opportunity to walk to all the major city sites. Superior room was very comfortable, and with a lot of amenities. Breakfast was abundant and with a large variety of fresh Spanish and German delicacies. The TAPAS bar-restaurant is one of the best we have ever been, and a hot spot for Berliners. The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke great English. However, the hotel provided NO free internet connection, instead they overcharged it by 10euros/hour, or 17 euros/day, which we consider absurd!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiger363
Reviews.Content: We travelled recently to Berlin for the Christmas markets and after reading previous reviews the hotel did not disappoint. It has a fabulous location right next to the train station and we walked to all the main tourist attractions as previous reviewers. We had a comfort room and it was very spacious, clean and a comfy bed just what we wanted. As before breakfast was pricey at 22 Euros each so we didn't bother just found some places out and about. If we go back to Berlin i would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cruella55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days whilst visiting the Christmas markets in Berlin. The main reason we chose this hotel was the location and we were not disappointed. You can walk to most of the main sights from here - the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Alexanderplatz, Gendarmarkt etc etc. Plus it is right opposite the station so handy for travel both to/from the airport and around the city. The hotel is spotlessly clean throughout and the staff are lovely, so helpful and friendly. We stored our suitcases both when we arrived at 9 am before we checked in, then again on our last day after check-out. Check out the huge gingerbread house and sleigh in reception, both made by the pastry chef, they are incredible! Rooms are large and well-appointed with huge, comfortable beds with lovely soft duvets and pillows. And don't forget to turn on the underfloor heating in the bathroom, the switch is over the bidet! Robes and slippers are provided, my only gripe being why do they only give you one robe for a double room? Highly recommended hotel, great value too!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: JD1709
Reviews.Content: We were expecting great things having read other reviews. We weren't disappointed. Firstly, the hotel is in a wonderful location - close to the station and a short walk to all major sights (Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz, the Cathedral, Gendamenmarkt, museums etc). The only time we needed a train was to Charlottenburg - and the station was right there! It was a special weekend for us and we requested a higher level room - we were given an upgraded room and a gift - which was a wonderful extra touch. The staff were friendly, offered us great recommendations for restaurants (and booked them) and were quick to help with everything. The room was spacious, clean and quiet - everything you need for a few nights away. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: canddr
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of the location as we had stayed in Freidrichstrasse previously. We were delighted! The room was huge with a massive bed and a beautiful bathroom. Only one small disappointment, no tea/coffee making facitlies but superfood is just next door and there was no problem bringing a cup in to the room at the end of a long day visiting the sights. Our journey from the airport was an adventure as neither of us speak fluent german and only found out when we reached Ostbahnhof, and everyone was getting off, that the RE train terminated there and we had to change to an S-Bahn to complete our journey. Fortunately, we knew which S-Bahn trains continued to Friedrichstrasse so it wasn't too bad. I believe that this is temporary.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Toff
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a very early flight at around 9am to drop the luggage off but were instantly checked in - a really big tick for the Melia in Berlin for that. Also because we had upgraded to The Level were given a complimentary breakfast - excellent. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff very helpful. The breakfast on The Level is excellent with everything you could wish for. Also the free bar and tapas in the evening is also very good. There is a turn-down service in the evening which came as a bit of a shock - the maid tapped and immediately walked into the room! The only downside is my room faced the enormous Ernst and Young building opposite which is just being completed. Once all the offices are manned it will be like staying in a zoo! I have added a photo of the view from my room and you will see just what I mean. Also there are extensive roadworks outside the hotel on Friedrichstrasse and if you were on a lower level than floor 7 I should imagine this could be a problem too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you're heading to Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppa
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at the Melia in Berlin. I'd recommend it to all. It's just off the main drag (Unter den Linden) and is close to a great S-bahn station, but anyone who's been to Germany knows the public transport is tip top anyway! The rooms are well sized with a double bed, TV, storage space and a functional bathroom. Breakfast was too expensive for us to have (about 30 Euros for 2!!) but there are plenty of cafes along Friedrichstrasse and in the station. The staff/concierge were very hepful and basically I cant fault this place! It's well within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate and other main tourist sights. We caught the TXL shuttle from Tegel airport for 2 euros which dropped us off at the Brandenburg Gate (about a 10 min walk away) rather than pay a 30 euros taxi cab and this was extremely easy!

Reviews.Title: “Melia Berlin - Perfect all the Way Around”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on positive experiences with other Melia hotels around the world and consistently good reviews on this and other travel boards. The hotel is modern and quite new and well positioned on the River Spree. We had a room facing the courtyard which was quiet even though we slept with the windows open as we could not completely turn off the heat and the rooms are kept warm. Our room was very spacious and well appointed with lots of storage and a large bathroom equipped with deep tub and large walk in shower. We opted for an upgrade to the Level and felt it offered good value. In addition to personal concierge service, a full breakfast is served for extended hours and in the evenings, cocktails and tapas are offered from 6pm until 10pm. We ended up there most evenings to rest up from busy days spent enjoying the many things this beautiful city has to offer. Melia Berlin is very well located with public transport within a three minute walk which provides access to all parts of the city. Museum Island is a 15 minute walk. Many dining options are within easy access of the hotel as is extensive shopping. This is a top notch hotel in a wonderful part of the city. During our explorations of Berlin, we noted the locations of other popular hotels and were so pleased with our decision to stay in Mitte instead of in the West. We definitely plan to return to Berlin and to the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammielc
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were extremely comfortable, and loved the wet room. The staff were attentive and happy to help with making our stay pleasurable. Tapas was lovely too!

Reviews.Title: “Go the Tappas”
Reviews.Author: redd27
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful with large rooms and very helpful staff. Whilst breakfast was expensive (as was the internet) and we ate out, Tappas in the restaurant for dinner was lovely and quite reasonable. Well located next to the river and close to the central train station

Reviews.Title: “miss this hotel and regret it”
Reviews.Author: tripwatching
Reviews.Content: everything one can expect from a hotel of this grade and a lot more. even if not staying visit it as a non resident.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a little extra”
Reviews.Author: pssmidi
Reviews.Content: We were offered an ugrade to a junior suite for 25 Euros a night. We already had booked a room on "The level", a service that includes free access to an executive lounge with food and beverages included. The suite was elegant and roomy, with 2 separate rooms, a sitting area, 2 televisions, a large balcony and a fantastic bathroom. The hotel felt brand new, very clean and modern. Maybe you don't get any feeling of the culture or atmosphere of the country you are in, but if you need that, go outside. One of my best hotel stays ever. And far from expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chicagoguy43
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Melia Berlin well located and a very comfrotable place to spend five nights in Berlin. The room was clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts were diversifed, complete and tasty. The hotel is a block away from Museum Island and near, the German Historical Museum, Unter den Linden and the Gendenmarket and within walking distance of many other tourist sites in what was East Berlin/East Germany. It's also a block away from the train station which covers the city as well as easy access to Potsdam and Wahnsee. Nearby were some of the best restaurants, both the well-recommended and local quality eateries. We couldn't have asked for more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for first visit to Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: The hotel was warm, quiet and comfortable and ideally situated for walking to main tourist sites. I was initially wary of its location so close to the railway station but there was no problem whatsoever. I agree with all other positive comments about the hotel. Transport from airport:- we always get a taxi as its convenient and we think value for money (usually) . I must recommend a2b transfers. This is a new taxi service and is excellent value for money. Our plane was early but our driver was waiting and spoke excellent English. He gave us lots of visitors tips and was very friendly and helpful. He told us that our hotel was in East Berlin. We had not realised that and it would have been helpful to have known before we booked our trips in advance. He also told us not to worry about going anywhere in Berlin day or night as the city is very safe. It was. Our taxi fare was 35Euro for 2 people- substantially cheaper than all other taxis. Tours. The Viator walking tour with Fabian was brilliant but be prepared for a lot of walking. We learnt so much but it was entertaining as well. We saw all the major sites and really got our bearings for the city. Tour was about £11 each - again amazing value. The sites are amazing too. Don't forget to go to the top of the dome in the Reichstag building. A great experience, open until 10 at night and free. Audio guide also free. Berlin is well worth a visit and we will be returning as there is so much to see. We were surprised at the feeling of space in the city- large squares, beautiful buildings and plenty of greenery. There is something for everyone here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mipanko
Reviews.Content: There's not much I can add to the glowing reviews of this hotel, so I can only confirm how well placed the hotel is to many main attractions.  We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of options available from eateries across the river to many food options beneath the station.  Lovely room, we paid extra for a riverview (just under £400pp for four nights and flight) and the bathroom is compact and bijou, including bath and shower and bidet.  Excellent tiling and use of towelling robes and complimentary bottled water everyday is a nice touch on top of the usual hotel toiletries.  Staff are very helpful if you need them. If you get bored of all the currywurst and bratwurst and fancy something different, try Supergood which is a couple of doors away - they use fresh organic ingredients!Must dos:• The Reichstag – free, but beware the long queues – we queued for nearly three hours!• The East Side Gallery – how can you go to Berlin and not see the wall?• Eat Currywurst – it’s everywhere!• The Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church – free!  Follow this with ...• Eat at Ka De We (the second largest department store in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Hotel in the Former East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TJ862
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Friedrichstrasse, only a 10 minute walk from Unter Den Linden, 20 minute walk from Alexanderplatz and next to the River Spree. We were given a very warm and informative welcome on arrival. The room was very modern and well presented with a view overlooking the river. We didn't have time to check out the gym and sauna as we were too busy touring the city. We did try breakfast on one morning, which is expensive at 22 euros per person. Reception did give us a card which gave us 2 for the price of one and there was an excellent choice of food on offer. There are plenty of other places to eat nearby though and much cheaper. Guten Morgen Franz is a lovely bistro 2 minutes walk just around the corner facing the river and you can easily eat there for under 20 euros for 2 people. The bed in the room was very comfortable and there was plenty of storage space. The flat screen TV had plenty of channels from many countries and there was also a huge choice of movies which were multi lingual for around 8 euros. To sum up this is a very modern hotel, with friendly staff and very handy for getting around on foot or using the trains from the Friedrichstrasse Bahnhof across the road.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner! Comfortable, well located, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: APM617
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night in mid-Oct on business. I agree with other reviewers: great location, easy access to S Bahn, walking distance to key sights, very pleasant room overlooking the river, helpful staff. Did not use the restaurants. Far less expensive that the 'big brand' hotels. Exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: architett0
Reviews.Content: The location of the Melia' , in Berlin's Mitte District is wonderful. You can walk to the Friedrichstrasse train station, Unter den Linden, the Reichstag, Branderburg gate, many art galleries, museums, shops and restaurants. We enjoyed staying in a room with a Juliette balcony looking towards the river Spree to the north/west. The rooms are new, very clean, very well designed and spacious. The interiors are clean and modern with good lighting. Value is good but Internet access is outrageously expensive: around 20 euros/day. Breakfast is also expensive but there are several nice breakfast spots in the immediate area ( i.e. Alt Berlin across the river to the north). Being a large hotel it tends a bit on the impersonal but the little interaction we had with staff was courteous and friendly. The concierge was very helpful in helping us find out information about current concerts. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ilanitko
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 nights stay at the Melia, and found it excellent in every way. The rooms are adaquete in size, spotlessy clean and nicely decorated. We had a room at the 7th floor , facing the inner courtyard (we didn't want to pay extra for the view..)and it was very quite. The location is a major plus - you are within walking distance from all the important sights , and you have the s+u bahn station 3 minutes away - if you need to travel to a more distant place. If you book via the hotel's websight ( usually the best rate ) - you can sign up for MAS membership . This way you earn points for future holidays , and also recieve free international newspaper every morning. As MAS members you can eat breakfast at the hotel , pay for one person and the other person eats for free. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many bakeries and cafe' up and down the street ( e.i - Kamp's , Balzac , Weidmann etc. ). Hope you too have a wonderfull stay at this hotel and in this great city !

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra few euros and enjoy The Level”
Reviews.Author: RAHolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my "host sister" for her 40th Birthday. She and I met when I lived with her family 23 years ago and we decided to get away and celebrate the years. I paid about 17€ more a night and we stayed on The Level. The lounge is wonderful and trust me, as a business consultant I've had the chance to experience many many executive lounges. Wonderful breakfast, coffee to order throughout the day, snacks during the day, cocktails and appetizers in the evening! Wonderful! The view is beautiful overlooking the Spee River and it is right in the middle of everything. It was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: princesspupule
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in "The Level" and was consistently impressed by the experience. First, even if I wasn't staying in the Level, the experience was great! The staff were helpful, polite, always went the extra mile (e.g. the concierge was closed and I needed to buy postcards and the VIP concierge let me into the storeroom to pick out what I needed even though it was 9pm). Now, the Level . . . . amazing breakfast spread that stays open to 11am and if you waltz in at 3 min to 11 (as I and my friends did after a late night), they keep everything out until you are done. Tapas, wine, beer, full bar for the evening. You could almost eat dinner there given the amount of food. Best anecdote: my friend had an early flight and settled her bill the night before and requested a taxi. As she did, the front desk clerk asked if she would like a lunch bag to take along because she was missing breakfast. How nice! Overall, I would recommend this to everyone and will certainly stay at this chain again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sugarplum79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Melia Berlin during a business trip to Berlin in September 2009. I really enjoyed the rooms warm decor and the fact that the room was very quiet despite facing the street. Bathroom was spacious and clean, had all amenities that you could ask for. Location of the hotel was perfect at least for my purpose which was to attend meetings in surrounding hotels. The street that the hotel is on has many nice shops and department stores, with all the high street brands represented. During breakfast everything was on offer that I needed in order to start the day right, and much more. Only bad thing for me was that internet was very expensive, 25 EUR for 24 hours of surfing is to me not acceptable. One should have free internet access when staying in a business hotel. Nice big comfortable beds and several pillows to choose from. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: oasa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights on our first visit to Berlin at the beginning of September. We have used the Melia in Madrid and were very happy with the standard. In addition, relations had used the Melia in Berlin and recommended it highly. Our choice was a very happy one. The location is perfect; 50 yards from the S and U Bahn station from which access to the airport was simple. 100 yards from Unter Den Linden, Museum Island, etc. We walked everywhere. The hotel was very comfortable, spacious and clean. Staff were courteous and helpful. We intend to return for an extended visit to Berlin and and we will certainly stay at the Melia. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OTTIMO!!!”
Reviews.Author: alearezzo
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD, excellent hotel in the centre of the city!!! 10 mins walk brandebugo gate!! 15 mins walk alexander platz, near the river, beautiful place in friedchristrasse!!! we enjoied at melia berlin!!! breakfast very expesive (22 euro each person)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Melia!!!!”
Reviews.Author: evemauve
Reviews.Content: When i found the smart deal about Melia hotel in booking.com(483 euros for seven night stay) I couldn't believe it!! I grabbed the opportunity and didn't regreat it at all!! Fabulous hotel, immaculate room, very spacious and sunny ,provided us with everything we needed. The beds were so comfortable, the bathroom was very big with all the amenities. Friedrichstrasse metro station was 50 metres away!! The hotel is situated on the river bank and the view is unbeatable!! I recommend it to everyone!!! You won't regreat it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahl88
Reviews.Content: Don't underestimate how great it is to be less than half a block from a major S-Bahn AND U-Bahn line! Location aside, the hotel itself was quite nice. Clean, modern, well-equipped rooms. Didn't have much interaction with the staff, but the little I did have was cordial. Tends toward a business-oriented feel -- if you like more personalized or quaint lodgings, this probably isn't your best bet. But the Melia provided excellent value and a quality room in a perfect location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Melia wonderfull like Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kajcopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Melia Berlin is a wonderfull hotel direct to River Spree and Friedrichsstrasse. We make our booking at Sol Melia homepage and I am sure that you will find the best price there. Breakfast is the best we ever have at any hotel where we stay. Room is very clean, and if you are going to Berlin go to Melia Berlin where you get a lot for your money.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: StasisWorld
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms luxerious and spacious. The room service was well priced and arrived quickly. A great location, just meters from a train station and surrounded by a great choice of places to eat, from quick and nasty at the train station, to silver service riverside eateries.
