Possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Despite being located on a major street, the rooms are quiet and I never heard any traffic noise in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Laiska
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of action, right next to river Spree. Easy to commute everywhere in Berlin area: S and U stations are 100m from the hotel door. 20 min walk to Checkpoint Charlie, 10 min to Unter den Linden. Nice places for breakfast right on the opposite side of the river if you don't want to pay the 20 EUR for hotel breakfast. Stayed on basic room, 2nd floor. Soudproofing was great: couldn't hear a thing from the busy street next to the hotel. Used the garage during the 2 night stay. Elevator goes right next to your car from the floor you are staying. Clean rooms and public areas. Nice staff as well. I just can't find any negative sides! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: newyorkrhymes
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the hotel is its location. It is a 5 minute walk to Museum Island and is around the corner from a major train intersection and shopping. The room was quiet but the air conditioning was hard to control. The breakfast buffet has a variety of foods, some of which are edible. I found a cockroach crawling on my roll. Eggs were cold and the coffee was cold 4 out of 6 days. The maid left a dirty bar glass in my room. The prices for the minibar were outrageous; who pays the equivalent of almost 5 dollars for a bag of chips? The staff were polite and friendly but overall the place seemed understaffed. There was usually a line at reception and the concierge was always busy or unavailable. I expected better for my money. This hotel is about twice as expensive as the average Berlin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central. Very comfortable and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Bruntie2
Reviews.Content: As a big chain hotel this was well run, with friendly and helpful staff, good sized rooms and was well equipped. The breakfast was OK, but quite expensive - get cheaper in nearby cafes. The location is excellent - 10 mins from all main attractions and right beside the station for longer trips. For a central big hotel, this was one of the quietest I have stayed in, which was great for a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, welcoming and service oriented”
Reviews.Author: chesternimitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for 4 nights and were thoroughly impressed with the service at this hotel. We do not speak German but the staff in fluent in English and Spanish as well as German, so that made our experience that much more pleasurable. Everyone, from the bell boy to the concierge to the front desk staff was wonderful and the rooms were clean, pleasant and roomy. Its proximity to the Spree, Museum Island, Unter den Linden, the S-Bahn and great shopping and dining make it ideal for visitors to the city. Our package included the buffet breakfast, which was expansive, to say the least. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: smileynat27
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an amazing time in Berlin! Melia Hotel, it has to be said, was fab and located in a perfect spot along the river Spree (transport a stone's throw away). The hotel was clean, rooms are spacious and staff were really friendly. Be sure to check out the nightlife down by the river - some nice restaurants and bars to chill after a fun day exploring the cultural delights this city has to offer. I would stay at this hotel and hope to visit Berlin again one day!

Reviews.Title: “Beware. Verboten.”
Reviews.Author: anonymousU_S_Europe
Reviews.Content: Melia Hotel seem to block your mobile phone access in hotel so you are forced to use the room phone. Charges are astronomical. Euro €28 for a 2 minute call. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: colbuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally 10 steps away from Friederichstrasse U-bahn and 20 from S-bahn. The main attractions in Berlin Mitte are within walking distance and so are shops, cafès and restaurants. Rooms are modern and well equipped. Unfortunately they are carpeted but very clean. Windows can be fully opened, bathrooms are equipped with bathtub/shower and bidet.We were asked if we preferred a room overlooking the street or one at the back and we opted for the latter, which proved to be a good choice because it was extremely quiet and we could sleep keeping our windows open. We had booked through the hotel website, benefiting from reduced week-end bed-only rates. Upon checking in, the receptionist informed us that all frequent travellers members of the chain reward programme could have breakfast with a 50% discount (your partner's breakfast is for free). Enrolling was very easy and could be done at the reception directly. In any case catering for breakfast is not an issue: walking one minute down Friederichstrasse, you come across Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts and there are also several restaurants on the riverside. For dinner we chose a very cosy place in Georgestrasse, under the railway: quite a funny experience to think that trains are passing over your head but we were surprised by the fact that the noise is very very limited. The restaurant (named Deponie) offered German cuisine at a very affordable rate, had a very nice garden and many memorabilia of rural life. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, thoroughly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: PeskyAberdeenshire
Reviews.Content: Booked this on the advice of other Trip Advisor Reviews. Brilliant. Beds amongst the comfiest I have ever slept in, choice of pillows fantastic. Staff very friendly. Given a quiet room on the 7th floor. Never heard a thing! Did not book breakfast. Tapas bar very nice, a bit expensive, the bar very expensive, but city bar prices are all the same. Lobby bar not open every night we were there, but no big problem really. Hotel is very central, lovely spot beside the Spree River. Over the river bridge and to the left is a really great little bar, lots of atmosphere, called Van Goch. Great restaurant to the left of the hotel, under the railway, turn left down the arches, first restaurant you come to, best German food in Berlin. Has a wonderful break, lots to see and do, not really for kids. Also got a great price of £242.00 for 4 nights from berlinhotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor scores again”
Reviews.Author: Dekard
Reviews.Content: Not knowing much about Berlin, and needing 3 rooms I went on the advice of Tripadvisor reviews. And how right they were. A great hotel. Lovely staff. All willing to forgive us lazy Brits and speak English, and always with a smile. Fantastic rooms, and great value. Breakfast at 20 euros was a bit steep, but the location, 100 yds away from a main railway station hub (Friedrichstrasse) meant there were load of cafes and supermarkets. Perfect location. An all day ticket for 5 of us was 15 euro for all transport. Easy walking distance of the tourist spots and restaurants. Cheap internet, and with a printer. Gym a bit pokey, but OK. Berlin was great!

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: billyboy
Reviews.Content: When booking, I asked for a high level room with a view and the room allocated to us could not have been better, being on the 6th floor and overlooking the River Spree. Clearly they pay heed to requests at this hotel Upon arriving at around 3:00pm there were numerous people waiting to check in, but 5 staff at the reception desk ensured that no one was kept waiting for more than a couple of minutes. Quiet efficiency appears to be the order of the day in all departments, except at breakfast time. Cleanliness, comfort and convenience are well covered in other reviews but I must comment upon the bathroom, which absolutely sparkled with freshness. Housekeeping really is of the highest standard. During our 3 nights stay the hotel was full and breakfasts were "frenetic". We tried breakfasting before eight and after nine thirty, but the crowds of people milling around were just the same, either trying to find vacant tables or carrying food and drinks to their tables. After giving their room number upon entering, guests are very much on their own. This aside, the Melia Berlin is a splendid hotel and one to which we shall be happy to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered without smothering”
Reviews.Author: Tripcom
Reviews.Content: Like so many others we stayed on The Level and paid about 192 Euros/night through the hotel website. We are very plain travelers and were treated with both warmth and great service without ever being made to feel like anyone was doing us a favor. Included breakfast had all the usual offerings plus some exceptional cheeses, marinated mushrooms, bacon/sausages, and cooked to order omelets/eggs. The Level has a seldom used free computer and printer in the lounge area and a person always available for questions or checkout. We asked for a quiet room and we were given a room at the back facing a wall - so no view but exactly what we requested. Air conditioning works great after we asked and received instructions from the night service attendant but we only used it once because the windows open several ways and easily. The room was of a normal size but contained plenty of space for suitcases and relaxing. The free drinks and tapas at the lounge in the evening provided a pleasant way to end the day, often exchanging a few words with other guests but plenty of privacy if you choose. Of course several people have already mentioned the transporatation hub just down the block with multiple U-bahn and S-Bahn lines as well as tram and bus stops, museums and shopping, Unter Den Linden and Gendarmenmarkt within easy walking distance. When I return to Berlin I will insist on staying at this comfortable, convenient hotel with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: MN_Hope
Reviews.Content: For a 1-week trip to Berlin, 3 of us stayed at the Melia (myself & an 18-year-old in one room, her uncle in another room). The location is excellent, about a block from a major subway & streetcar station (Friedrichstrasse) and an 8-10 minute walk to Unter den Linden with all its historical sites. Easy to find both good restaurants and cheap eats right in the vicinity. We paid 80-90 euros a night through agoda.com, which I found almost hard to believe for a hotel of this quality and location in a city like Berlin. I was prepared for something to go wrong when I paid the bill at the end. But it was just as advertised. The hotel is newish and right on the Spree River. Our room looked out at construction of a very ugly, huge, dark-colored new building across the street, but looking sideways we could see the river. The style of the hotel is simple, clean, and elegant. Desk, bell, and concierge service was always cordial and helpful. Our standard room was always clean, well furnished, and not luxurious in space but definitely not cramped for 2 women with luggage who did some shopping as well. The bathroom was also clean, new, and bright, just what I expect from a good, modern hotel in Europe. Importantly, we had peace and quiet with no exceptions. I was a little worried because our room was right across from the elevator, but I never once heard a sound. This could be also because the hotel was not full, but still I think the soundproofing is very good. I needed Internet access to stay in touch with work, and I paid 88 euro for a 7-day package--highway robbery compared to the many US hotels that provide free Internet, but not a dealbreaker for me. If I didn't need it for work, I probably would have skipped it and just used my mobile device access. The only slight inconvenience was that we arrived in the morning after a long flight and, although the hotel was happy to keep our luggage, we checked back several times and were not able to check in until the official 3 p.m. checkin time. There was plenty to do within an easy walk in the meantime (stroll to Unter den Linden, see the Brandenburg gate, have a coffee and excellent light meal at Kaffee Einstein - Unter den Linden), etc., but we were weary and in need of a shower. This just confirmed my general rule of trying to arrive in the late afternoon/evening on a long trip, but this time the $400 round trip airfare was more enticing than the perfectly convenient setup. Enjoy Berlin and make your "can't miss" list ahead of time, because there is a lot to do and see. The Melia makes a great central base and comfortable retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not "Great"”
Reviews.Author: marknmeils
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Melia Berlin ... it is a very good chain hotel - clean, friendly staff, relatively new interiors/decor, and well positioned near the Hauptbahnhof and on the River Spree. On the negative side, there was only one English speaking TV channel - BBC World - which can get boring very quickly, and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room (though this is not uncommon in Europe). You will probably have no complaints if you choose to stay here, but it just won't stand out in your memory for long.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: manos36
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very polite staff and one of the most comfortable rooms i have ever stayed in. My room was a comfort one at the sixth floor and it had side river view. I would stay there again without any doubt

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bankrupt2
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel and thought it was a bit expensive at £350 for three nights for a double room.but after looking at the reviews we thought what the hell and booked it with expedia who came up the cheapest, the room was spacious and clean.it had a business class sort of feel. the bed was the best i have ever slept in,including my own! we had a choice of rooms when we arrived,inner court yard or by the road.we chose the road and had a partial view of the river which is more or less on the doorstep. the location was fantastic and i would recommend this hotel purely on this aspect.everything is in walking distance and there are abundant restaurants and bars just 5 mins walk away.the breakfast was great and will keep you going all day.Berlin is not a expensive city and a good meal out did not break the bank. if i went to Berlin again i would stay here again and would not worry about recommending this hotel to my friends and family. the only fault i found was that it would have been nice to have tea making facilities or a free bottle of water on arrival.all extras where expensive including a £5 charge for using the radio on the TV!!!on the upside we paid for location and we got the best. also the room was very restful,not noisy and good blackout curtain. the best duvet and pillows ever!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in the Melia Berlin. Room was fine, clean and a good size with a view over the river Spree (Superior room) when we eventually got in (check in is 3pm but no room was available until 5pm cos of a group checking out late - when I asked to check out late 2 days later it seemed a big deal!). Staff polite but not so good at handling problems with the customer in mind. Basic rooms have internal courtyard view or street view. Location is convenient and all major sites in east Berlin are walkable. Hotel internet a rip off at 4 Euros per 30 mins. Walk over to the station and you get 1 hr for 2 Euros. If you want to hire bikes, hotel charge 20 Euro per day. Down the road is 12 Euros. And so the list could go on. Conclusion - clean hotel in good location. Would I go back? On balance probably not.

Reviews.Title: “An efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennie21
Reviews.Content: Melia is exactly what a hotel should be. Clean, nice rooms, good bathrooms, cheerful and friendly staff, convinient location ! You can even get a view of the river from the room !!! I liked the breakfast buffet of the awesome spread of hot and cold foods.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Hotels-Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mum_to_2
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I went to Berlin this past weekend and stayed at the Melia Berlin. Like other Melia hotels, this one does not disappoint. We stayed in a basic comfort room-it was big enough for us, very clean, and had a well equipped bathroom. Our room faced Friedrichstrasse so there was a bit of noise-but nothing major with the window shut and I am a very light sleeper! The a/c worked well. Staff were very professional and friendly. The hotel is in a very convenient location for most of the major sites. We flew into Tegel and used the bus/U bahn to get to the hotel with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Shemala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Berlin for 4 nights at the end of April to celebrate our Pearl Wedding Anniversary. We originally booked a Superior room through the hotel's website, but a few weeks later we found the prices had gone down and upgraded to a room on The Level which included breakfast and many other extras. Our very comfortable room, (750), had an amazing view of the River Spree in both directions. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast in the Level Lounge was excellent, we had never seen so much choice. We enjoyed free drinks and Tapas before a night out at the Friedrichstadt Palast theatre just up the road. The Variety Show Qi is highly recommended for an amazing night out. We really enjoyed our first visit to Berlin, stayed in a perfect hotel, in a perfect location and even had perfect warm & sunny weather.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eurofrog
Reviews.Content: With so many positive reviews already published here, it almost appears futile to write another one: there is very little I could still say except that I agree with the high ratings this hotel has been given so far. Location, the room, comfort, staff - all left absolutely nothing to be desired, especially in view of the modest price I paid for what is really a top class hotel. (I booked straight through their website, which was easy and efficient, too.) The only small matter I would raise is the price for the breakfast, which, at EUR 22, is quite steep (hence the four-star rating for "value" above). The quality appears to be up to scratch, though, but I always find it much better value and much more authentic to go out and have breakfast in a local cafe. I say that about almost every hotel I stay at so this is no real criticism of the hotel as such. However, with many cafes and bakeries (literally) just up the road, I would recommend not taking breakfast in the hotel but out in the streets of Berlin - or as a matter of fact on the banks of the Spree: suitable places are only two minutes away from the hotel on the other side of the river. Next time I'm in Berlin, I will definitely try and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: hetha
Reviews.Content: An absolute bargain price through ebookers so not sure what we would get for our money. The Melia is a quality hotel; location could not be more convenient; rooms are excellent size and standard for city centre. Room even had a partial river view! On a main street but still fairly quiet. No breakfast included but walked over bridge to cafe for real Berlin atmosphere - sitting outdoors beside the river in warm sun in mid April. All the bars/cafes/restaurants provided blankets in case you felt the cold. Berlin is a modern city but lots to see and do. Not to be missed: Reichstag dome by day and night (queued for over 1 hr each time) Cruise on the river Walk through Tiergarten to beer garden beside Neuer See Nicholai old quarter

Reviews.Title: “For price and quality, an ABSOLUTE MUST STAY!”
Reviews.Author: ANCOfficer82
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this wonderful hotel. First off, the location is prestine from the S-bahn, U-bahn, and a bahnhof station which is unnecessary because it is only a short walk to tourist areas such as the Brandenburg Gate, Berlin Wall, Checkpoint Charlie, Topography of Terror, TV tower, and Tiergarten Park. It also hugs the river, where plenty of wonderful restaurants and bars are located. Second the staff was extremely pleasant to deal with and extra helpful with anything we needed i.e. directions, places to dine, other info, also multi-lingual. Third, the room we stayed in (superior room w/ river view) was larger than expected for european standards and extremely clean. The only thing I can complain about is not having plush towels (and thats searching for something), but the robes and slippers sufficed. Lastly, you cannot beat the price. We stayed for two nights at a 4-star (which I think should be a 5-star) hotel and the entire weekend with parking did not cost more than 300 euro. So if you are looking live lavishly and on a budget, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: lrk2115
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one and was very pleased. Check-in and check-out was very quick and efficient. Receptionists were very nice and friendly. I stayed in a comfort room (which is the smallest type I believe) and was pleasantly surprised by how big the room was. Nicely decorated, comfortable bed and a flat screen tv. Looked over Friedrichstrasse from the 5th floor and could not hear much noise. The only thing you could hear was the tram that would pass, otherwise the windows blocked out all other noise. Didn't get a chance to check out the gym or the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here last year on my first visit to Berlin while travelling with 3 friends. The rooms are all on the small size, but very comfortable, clean lines. Nice beds and very pretty bathrooms with lots of space. The breakfast buffet is an amazing array of hot and cold foods. The front desk staff were very cheerful, pleasant, and efficient, and always helpful with directions, restaurant reservations, etc...The hotel's location is unbeatable. Just steps from the Friedrichstrasse U-Bahn station, very close to the museums, and a short give minute walk to the Uter-den-Linden. Small, but lovely, zen like fitness center with amazing city views. I really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious and modern”
Reviews.Author: roothie
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel within walking distance of museums and the Brandenburg gate. It is very near transport links - it's practically opposite one of the main stations. The room was great and comfortable - although we found the bed a little too soft for our liking. The staff were helpful and pleasant. We also tried the tapas bar attached one evening. It's probably not the cheapest place to eat or drink, but is quite nice to sit and have a drink in before you wander out to dinner. There are cheaper and i'm sure fairly decent hotels in Berlin, so if you are on a budget it may not be for you. But as a treat I think it was worth paying the extra. We have stayed at the Melia in Madrid before and I think the Melia Berlin compares favourably - the rooms are definitely a lot more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnno44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, the staff amazing. we went for our anniversary in Dec 08. Arrived on the friday evening, slight problem as TV in suite did'nt work. Got quickly moved to the suite next door with no problem whatsever. As we had a suite we had access to the exec lounge with nibbles and free drinks on an evening plus access to the gym, sauna and free sunbeds. Staff were excellent, the suite fantastic and a nice large balcony overlooking the river. Had slight problem with room service as they forgot out food one night (new member of staff forgot to write down our room number). All sorted tho and was given two free bottles of sparking wine as an apology and a large yummy gingerbread house all christmas'd up and all edible. Would definately go back again. Location is so central aswell the ideal location for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny repayment, for an incredible stay!”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December for three nights and had an excellent experience. We requested a room overlooking the River Spree and were delighted to have our request granted and to find that we could turn our gaze down the water towards a great view of the Reichstag (The complimentary Sekt was the next best sight). The staff were extremely helpful and made us feel very welcome. The room was large, decorated to a high standard and with all mod cons. We did not take breakfast but ate in local cafes that are easy to find on Freidrichstrasse or Unter den Linden. We did eat at the Tapas bar and again had an enjoyable evening tasting one of the set menus. Everything that is a must see in Berlin is within walking distance and being so close to the train station means that getting to and from Schoenefeld Airport is incredibly easy (Direct train from Freidrich strasse). I would not normally write a review on a website such as this but we had such a great experience that I needed to repay some of the kindness received.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel & Stay”
Reviews.Author: Well-Travelled_too
Reviews.Content: The excellent reviews this hotel receives are well justified. And the recommendation to upgrade to 'The Level' aswell - besides the fantastic breakfast choice, you get a superior room, membership to the 'Executive Club' area which includes beverages all day and a light evening buffet, access to the internet (using terminals there), and a few other bits and bobs. I would much sooner choose a break back here before I try another disastrous "5* All Inclusive" (sic) Turkey break (which was more expensive too!) through Goldtrail Travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: sanfrantraveler
Reviews.Content: I noticed this hotel before because of its great location, and decided to check it out for a holiday / New Year's trip. We booked a superior room all of which have a view out to the river. The room was great, no complaints at all. The view toward the bridge is nice and interesting too as there are always people walking across to and from the nearby theaters. The location is excellent for tourists - you can walk to tons of stuff like the Brandenburg Gate, Hackescher Market, shopping on Friedrichstrasse, Alexander Platz, Museum Island, etc etc. The furnishings are stylish, the breakfast is great, the service was friendly. For our last night we upgraded to a Junior Suite. Also very nice. It has a balcony, double sinks in the bathroom and a separate shower from the bathtub. The view was nicer from the Superior Room, though. The Junior Suite comes with lounge access - good tapas and drinks at 6 PM. I can't think of anything negative to say about the hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: hithyrd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia for 3 nights for a long weekend. On arrival, the check in desk person was very helpful and checked us in quickly and efficently. We stayed on the 8th floor - we weren't fortunate to have a room overlooking the river but this didn't matter. The room was huge, had a massive bed (could easily have slept 4 people!), perfectly clean with a lovely sized, squeaky clean bathroom. All of the usual you'd expect such as a welcome pack with details of services was included, plus they provided a pillow menu so if the pillows they supplied did not match your requirements you could choose a different one! We signed up for the Mas card and benefited from a BOGOF on breakfast which I'd highly recommend. Everything you could possibly want is on offer - pastries, fruit, cereal, breads, meats, cheeses and the list goes on. They cook eggs to your pleasure which is a nice little touch. The bars in the hotel look lovely too - we didn't eat/drink there but many people did. Overall, a superb hotel in a great spot. Berlin is a very walkable city and this hotel is nor means out if the hustle and bustle of Berlin. It's right by the train stop too which is great for getting to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: swedishbargainhunter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Berlin for two weekend nights in Nov 2008. At the time I found a dirt cheap rate on Expedia for 85 USD per night for a Level room inc breakfast. Price for the same dates on the Melia Website was 129 EUR per night. It’s a nice, modern hotel just right next to Freidrichstr. U- and S-bahn station. It takes about 30 minutes from Schönefeld Airport with the express train. Check-in was taken care of swiftly. Normally check-in time 15:00, but I was able to check-in at 12:00. The room was modern, spacious with a huge kingsize bed that takes up most of it. The bed was comfortable and they even had a pillow menu detailing the pillow stuffing for all the different pillows. Even though the room faced Freidrichstrasse, it was very quiet. It probably helped that the room was on the 7th floor. As for The Level treats they had a nice tray with complimentary chocolates and a bottle of water. They restocked the water every day. There’s a kettle for making coffe and tea. The bathroom was smallish but nice. They provided bathrobes and slippers. The shower was squeezed into the bathtub. To my surprise I found ashtrays in the room. It turned out that I was given a smoking room, even though I booked a non-smoking room. I asked about this, and they said that they were fully booked and my notice for a non-smoking was just a preference. They offered to try and switch the room for the second night, but I couldn't be bothered moving for just one night. As it turned out it was barely noticeable and didn't bother me. But if your asthmatic or really want assurance for a non-smoking room I would send them a separate notice for a non-smoking room. Included in The Level room was access to the Executive club lounge. There you have the choice of breakfast in the club lounge or in the restaurant. Coffe, tea and softdrinks were served all day. Between 18:00-22:00 you’re able to enjoy tapas and alcoholic drinks. They also have two computers with internet and printing capabilities available for guests. You can also conveniently check-out at the club lounge. Breakfast is served until 11.00. I tried visiting the lounge for breakfast on a Sunday at 10.00, but it was already packed with guests. I was guided to the restaurant instead. The restaurant had only a few seats available, so at these peak hours for a late weekend breakfast was a little too crowded for my taste. The breakfast it self was plentiful with hot and cold items. Personally I liked that they had a good selection of darker breads. Also it’s always a treat when you can order freshly made omelettes. As a summary the Melia aspires to be like a nicer Hilton or Marriott. However it doesn't quite reach those levels. For the rate I got I would book it every time, but at full price I would probably look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Slyph
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel at all. We upgraded to 'The Level' as these floors offer the delights of unlimited free tapas and alcoholic drinks in the evening plus breakfast and drinks throughout the day and free internet access. This was definitely worth the extra and the exclusive seating areas were great. The room itself was a good size, very clean and comfortable. I had requested a quiet room and we were indeed given a quiet room at the back of the hotel. The staff were exceptionally polite and helpful. All spoke English and were friendly and attentive. The location is great and being situated in the East of the city you are a 5-10 mins walk away from Unter Den Linden and the Brandenburg Gate. From there you can also walk further afield to the Tier Garten, Checkpoint Charlie, the Wall etc. The U-Bahn is easy to use and the hotel is very near the Friedrichstrasse train terminal. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lonech
Reviews.Content: Absolutly a good modern hotel. Spacius rooms, nice beds and so on. The photos on the hotel webpage do tell it all. We got a good price as we booked several months in advance, otherwise its somewhat expensive. The breakfast cost 20 euros pr person, this is to much. You can buy your breakfast in any of the small cafe´s by the river spree or at the Frederich station, 2 minuts away. Or you can join the Mas reward club on the hotel webpage and get to breakfasts for the price of one. The Mas reward club also offers free news paper and late check out (if possible). The breakfast is of good quality, fresh bread, bacon, eggs (at your pleasure), toast, yougurth, cheese, ham, salami, fruit, tea, coffea and so on. The interactive tv didnt work. It could be possible to se your bill and so on, but neither worked. The tv has 20 free channels, 11 german, 2 english (BBC world and CNN) and a lot of spanish channels. All the german chanells is ofcause "in german". This means that Bruce Willis speaks german. A disgrace...................a four star hotel without any english speaking channels??? Hotel in walking distance to Reichtag, Museums Insel, berliner Dome and so on. 1 minut to the River Spree and the channel boats, 1 minut to Underground station, 2 minuts to S-bahn. A tip: visit "Restaurant Schwarzer Abt", Am Weidendamm 1A. Aorund the corner from the hotel on the riverside. The serve German autentich food with homemade beer or snaps. The best that money can buy. Or the "Kaffehaus- Zint und Zucker", schiffbauerdamm street, go past the railway bridge and eat a good lunch or drink a nice cup of coffea, away from the turist traps. All is homemade. But all in all: a very central placed hotel with good service and one we would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, average service”
Reviews.Author: jimmy61Madrid
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Berlin, where I run the 2008 marathon. I had a good experience with the Melia Hotel, particularly due to its perfect location: it is really at the very heart of the city, everything that matters there is a few minutes walk : the museums, the Reichstag, the Brandenburg Tor, Unter den Linden, etc. perfect place by all mens. I must say however that the hotel is not particularly luxurious, but simply functional, and I would also say that I missed some better facilities such as a pool or a spa. So, if you are going to run the next marathon in Berlín, Melia is a good choice (the start line is a few minutes nice walk through the riverside), but be sure you hire massage service in advance elswhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ssgtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed on The Level; breakfast included. Worth it to have breakfast there with wonderful service and selection as well as wine in the evening and munchies throughout the day. Great location, can walk to many of the sites in Berlin, but also near the train. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmvik
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this wonderful hotel. The receptionists were great, always helpful and smiling. Rooms are spacious and modern. The hotel is close to tons of restaurants and shopping, and to the train and subway station Friedrichstrasse. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: highstandardsMD
Reviews.Content: 8/2008 We stayed at the Melia Hotel in Berlin in rooms on The Level and it was awesome. The reasonable Level room price included full breakfast, drinks and snacks during the day and alcoholic beverages and snacks in the afternoon. The staff was professional, friendly and very helpful. All spoke english fluently. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The hotel was close to the train and subway stations making it easy to get around in the city. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “want to stay again a t MELIA' BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: NormaJeanRoma
Reviews.Content: MELIA' BERLIN-FRIEDRICHSTRASSE:"excellent" we are a couple, we stayed for 5 nights in a standard room: room is spacious, bed very comfortable, bathroom clean and large; we stayed in the highest floor, absouletely quiet! breakfast is excellent but a bit expensive if you dont have mas card and travel in two! staff iis friendly and ready to solve any problems; location is fantastic: 5 minutes walk from Museum Island,3 minutes to get at underground and tramway; on the main Friedrichstrasse: shops, history, restaurants: try "12 Apostel" good italian but expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Melia's location makes it easy...”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysReady2Go
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights at the Melia Berlin in Nov 2007 on business. What a great find - perfect location as a base - steps away from Freidrichstrasse Station and Unter den Linden and located on the banks of the Spree. Walk from station is literally seconds - although at the time I was there the area was quite dark and being redeveloped so need to be careful when walking. Hotel reasonably new therefore accomodation was spotless. Bed comfortable and room was very quiet. Check-in was friendly and quick. Tapas bar to one side of reception with what seemed like a popular and busy bar area opposite. Having checked rates since, I suspect this hotel can be quite expensive at times - it's very much aimed at the business traveller. However if deals are available it would certainly make an ideal central base for the independent leisure traveller. Particularly easy to get to from Schonfeld Airport (approx 30 mins) and no train changes. Fredreichestrasse Station provides a useful range of shops too - so easy to stock up on snacks and drinks. Several cafes in close proximity too. Berlin itself is an interesting mix of old and new. Lots to do and see - and getting around is extremely easy. The new Berlin Central Station is an amazing site. Checkpoint Charlie a little too touristy now - but a few metres away there are reminants of the wall and a free photographic display on the WWII - called the Topography of Terror - which I stumbled across by accident and was well worth spending some time at. Tip for the hungary visitor - the Block House steak restaurants provide very good value for a reasonable steak dinner - this in a city which to my surprise wsn't too way off the mark for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Melia August 2008”
Reviews.Author: JonsAbroad
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with hotel at all. Room a little smaller than expected Initially disappointed not to get a room on the riverside of the hotel. Had a view over other buildings & super view of TV tower Opposite the Melia is major construction works of a new Dorint Hotel. So glad to be screened from building site noise. Paid extra to stay on 'the Level' included Breakfast plus free bar and guest lounge. Nice treat was to be presented with complimentary strawberries, on the first evening. Did not eat in the hotel. Just appeared to be the usual bland and very overpriced chain hotel cuisine. Numerous bars & restaurants with character, within very short walking distance. Great central location with easy access to the S & U Bahn plus tram system. All staff friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Best Central location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 12 July through 14 July 2008 Summary: Front desk staff average-some friendly others very businesslike. Very modern hotel with many extras. Location-convenient to everything-very safe area on river-just north of Friedrichstrasse train station-one stop east of Hautbahnhof on several lines-Unter den Linden just a few blocks away- located in former East Berlin where most of the sights and museums are located. I will definitely stay here the next time if I can get a good rate and especially a great one like I had for 75 euros plus 20 euros for 2 breakfasts. All negatives were minor and were completely insignificant compared to all the pluses. My rating of 4 would probably have been a 5 if they offered a free internet station (at least give a guest card for 15 minutes per day so one can check important stuff but prevent people from staying on for hours) Room #504-No view-courtyard so very quiet-might have been nice to have river side view -2 beds (very nice-good pillows with 3 different sizes-duvet cover very soft and comfortable. -flat screen tv with many channels mostly German but others too -small modern sofa-more like an exam table at the doctor’s office -minibar w/ refrigerator-didn’t use minibar -closet w/ free safe-very good plus 2 chairs and a small table -bathroom-very nice with toilet, bidet (didn’t use), good size sink, tub w/ shower and half glass door but no issue if closed properly -ample plugs but not one usable by head of bed (see negatives) Breakfast – best one I’ve ever had in a hotel-very good but very expensive (get MaS Rewards card which makes breakfast 2 for 1 so 10 euros each rather than 20 euros) Very, very large fresh selection: several types of eggs, meats, fruits, pastries, yogurts. Coffee, tea, juices, water and even champagne both mornings I was there) Excellent service by wait staff! Negatives 1)No free internet in lobby or elsewhere in hotel-as you can tell, this upset me the most-sister hotel, Tryp Buenos Aires, where I stayed in May had two free stations by breakfast area 2)Key must be in slot by door for electricity to work (only TV worked w/o it) which meant hot/stuffy room upon return for quite a while depending on outside temp 3)Light on minibar on same switch as 2 floor lamps. If you want to use outlet by bed, it will only work if light above minibar is on also-no way to turn that off just by itself Tip: Make sure all windows are closed because a/c will not work otherwise. It will keep shutting off. This is possibly why previous reviewer has “air con hell” I felt stupid after I called the front desk to fix it, and the nice guy found that the window was ajar-why maid opened it he didn't know. Suggestion/Recommendation: Take the “Free Walking Tour” –just over 3 hours and starts just east of Brandenburg Gate. We had Colin from Scotland-excellent and entertaining. We each tipped 20 euros although others were cheap. I saw 1 older lady just give him a coin! Many young adults-hostel crowd-so don’t expect them to tip big-not in their budget-but those over 35 should give more. It’s well worth 20 euros or more for the great service and knowledge gained. One of the best city tours I’ve ever taken anywhere. No hopping on and off busses plus they have a "free Bicycle tour" also. English tours at 11 am, noon, and 2 pm. Try to get Colin.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth going for 'The Level' rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ladybird_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July for 4 nights as a birthday celebration. The location is great - easily walkable distance to all the sights worth seeing. We spent much of our time in the Prenzlauer Berg district which is great for food, drink, and people watching. The inclusive breakfast and early evening drinks and aperitifs definitely make it worth booking a 'Level' room in the hotel. You have access to a private breakfast room and can arrange to check out at 4pm which is really useful for a later flight. The hotel staff were all extremely polite and helpful - they even provided a bottle of champagne on arrival as it was my birthday. We had a river view room which was lovely. The only tiny fault (if I had to find one) is that our wardrobe was a little small. I would definitely recommend this hotel - in fact I already have!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie1973
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a city break it is in the center of Berlin just beside the central train station. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The only thing was breakfast it was a bit dear so if you can book with breakfast included it would be best. This is a Spanish based hotel with a Tapas bar. But the local night life is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: Superb location! You are 5 minutes walking distance from the "Museum Quarter", 10 min from the up-and-coming, always funny, Jewish district and 15 min from Brandenburg Tor. Actually, the street (Friedrichstrasse) is a highlight by itself, as it is where the main shopping malls stands and one must-do-stops favourites as "Check point Charlie" is. Great breakfast; nice, modern decor, big, clean room, flat screen TV. There is a Spanish (Tapas) Bar in the basement that opens till late. Helpful, professional (although on the non-smile kind) staff attend in reception. As the hotel has been just one year open, decoration and stuff is modern and cool, without a trace of the classic (sometimes old-fashioned) Melia likes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rueskov
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Melia Berlin June 2008 on a business trip. Enjoyed he location, loved the al,ost new room and the breakfast. Good service, nice staff and a pleasant restaurant. Would never pay 200 Euro myself for a double room at a hotel in Europe but if you will or can make someone else pay for you this is a good place to stay in the middle of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “air con hell”
Reviews.Author: unaikerr
Reviews.Content: the hotel overall is OK, but there are some problems. the main one being that the very noisy fan in the bathroom does not switch off AT ALL all night long. If you are a light sleeper you will have problems. I complained after a very sleepless night (not what you need when you have an important business meeting the next day). from the check in staff's face I got the impression that they must get this a lot. They have a faulty room card on the door and some previous guest had written it about the fan on there - so a design flaw. The other problems for me concerned the public areas - they are drab and really not very welcoming, i expect more from a hotel like this. So when I come to Berlin again on business I will not be staying here - if you're a heavy sleeper then you maybe OK but it's a pass from me

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gut! I will return to Melia”
Reviews.Author: Kevlange
Reviews.Content: Booked a Superior room, a couple of Euros more than the standard Comfort room, but hey that was well spended Euros. The special-special 7th floor with your own check-in counter (well, more like an office desk) and free drinks and tapas buffet in the afternoon in the Levels (the name of the 7th floor) own restaurant. Really relaxed. Interior-like it was very typical hotellish. Good lightnings, comfortable furnitures (especially the beds) and clean, very clean. My next trip will be to New York and if there had been a Sol Melia hotel there I would have booked it instantly (and it have been in a top ten position for sure). I would like to give Melia Berlin 5 stars. Vielen dank.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: VANALT
Reviews.Content: we booked a comfort room for 4 nights,at this hotel, from internet.we asked a room with view at upper levels.they gave us a large and luxurious room at 6th floor with great view, as we asked....the breakfast was the better i ever seen,with free champagne every day. you can take there mas cart,so you will pay 30 euros for 2 persons. do it anyway !!!! there are many bars and restaurants just in the other side of the river.try them.at bar called vang gogh the owner play piano.....try the dada falafel at oranien str, and cafe einstein. in a few words,melia hotel was fantastic !!

Reviews.Title: “What can say !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jambodavidson
Reviews.Content: Well all i can say is this hotel is Brill!!!!!! Th hotel is in a great locaton and when you first arrive it is very impressive and you wonder if it is all like that, well you will not be dissappointed! We were in just a comfort room but it was lovely, the bed was large and luxurious, and the bathroom was very modern and clean with two showers and heated floor!! The reception could not do enough to help you and nothing seemed a problem. our breakfast was not included but as we had a MAS card we could buy one and get one free so would say if you do not have one get this filled in at the hotel right away location was great and with the train station only yards from hotel no where was out of reach would stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “Far above my expectations A Plus”
Reviews.Author: sam1351
Reviews.Content: I did some research on where I wanted to stay in Berlin and the Melia seemed to be the best location, very near the Pergamon and close to the Reichstag and Brandenburger Tor. I was a bit hesitant but went ahead and booked on line and to be safe upgraded to the Level, which is their Club floor. Upon arrival I was greeted immediately by a bellman who whisked my bags in, check in was a quick and painless process and then shown to my room. It was very spacious and well appointed. The bed was wonderful, felt like heaven after the long night of flying. Bathroom was huge and well appointed. I was expecting a better view from my room, as the web site led me to believe that all the Club floor rooms had fantastic views of the river or the city. My view was mainly the buildings a block away and in the distance that monster TV tower relic from the DDR. Breakfast was served in the club room, very nice selection and even Champagne for brunch on Sunday. Afternoon cocktails were available and the gym and sauna were pretty nice too. I loved the location very easy to reach most of the city, with one of the major U Bahn stations a half a block away. I feel I got a very good rate of 150 Euro a night, especially with breakfast included. I saw some Berlin hotels tacking on a charge of 35 Euros just for breakfast!! One bad thing, but not unusual for Berlin was the Internet connection charge 17 E a day YIKES. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay there in the future

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel just in the centre”
Reviews.Author: capap
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location for the sights of Berlin. Very comfortable rooms and bathrooms with an excellent service and a lovely breakfast in the morning. There are currently major building works just across the road and some noise may be heard at times but they did offer a room with a view across the river for an extra 20 euros so perhaps one should opt for this option if this is an issue. There is a small but cosy bar downstairs with well-priced drinks and cocktails and a tapas bar (which I did not try). However several restaurants close by as well as the underground station which is just outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: RFBoston
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on Trip Advisor we booked a four night stay here. We took the advice of other travelers and booked the exec. level which was well worth it. Excellent location with the train station in front of the hotel. U-bahn and S-bahn at the station. Breakfast buffet was fantastic. Our room was a good size, everything worked and was clean. French doors opened onto a beautiful view of the river and train station. The rooms were sound proof. I would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Melia!”
Reviews.Author: Spockie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Melia Berlin for 3 nights over Christmas. We had two interconnecting rooms, which were extremely spacious and luxurious! Got a great price of 79 Euro per room per night on the hotel website. Very convenient location short walk to Unter den Linden, lots of shops and restaurants, walk to Brandenburg Gate and near Friedrichstrasse Metro stop. Christmas lights and Christmas markets everywhere - great atmosphere! Hotel staff were very friendly and the Concierge was exceptionally helpful in finding us a tour guide on 26 December (a lot of businesses were closed over Christmas). Only downside was Cafe Madrid was awfully expensive - we had buffet breakfast there one morning at a cost of 30 Euro each!! We didn't go back! There is a Starbucks nearby and also some good cafes on Unter den Linden. We also found a very good Italian restaurant about 10 mins. walk down Freidrichstrasse over the River Spree on the opposite side of the road to the hotel - we ate there twice in fact. All in all the Melia Berlin was a fabulous choice!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best we've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Kenn0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recieved a trip to Melia Berlin for our 50th Wedding anniversary. We spent 7 days of pure enjoyment at uour facility. We were returning to Berlin after a 38 year absence. We were in Berlin as a member of the US Air Forcein the 1960's. We thought the location of the hotel was perfect as the center of our sight- seeing intention. We were able to see most everything we had a desire to see, and were happy with the nearness of yhe attractiions were wanted to see while. We were happy with the facilities available to us at the Melia Hotel. The staff were very knowledgeable and helpful in all our needs. If the occassion should again arise, we would definitily choose the Melia again. Thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Melia berlin”
Reviews.Author: susanhilton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia Berlin, excellent hotel very modern and spotless. Breakfast was good value with a loyalty card buy one breakfast for 14 euros get one free, there was pleanty of choice both hot and cold. The hotel is ideally located for Brandenburg Gate and Check Point Charlie, the museum is worth a visit. I enjoy December because of the Christmas Markets. Upon arrival at Schonenfield take train S9 2.40 euros to Frederick Strasse Hotel is on corner opposite station, there was no noise disturbance. There is a tapas bar in the hotel which we didnt try but it looked very popular. Went to a indian rest. Amrit, turn right out of main foyer and walk approx 500 yds to Oranienburger strasse dont have a starter as the main courses are huge. There is a Irish Bar en route so handy for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RbrtH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Melia 4 nights while in Berlin on business. We loved the hotel, and would definitely choose it again. Facilities are great, and we enjoyed the wonderful breakfasts in their 2nd-floor restaurant that overlooks the river. Everyone was very helpful, and the location could not be beat. Most of the major sites in Berlin are within walking distance, and you are one block away from a major train station that can get you anywhere in the city quickly. (Get the multi-day pass for u-bahn/s-bahn. It doesn't get more convenient than that!) Be sure to check out the little Italian restaurant just around the corner by the river. Some of the best pizza I've had in a long time. I took off one point for the internet connection. The Melia had one of the most EXPENSIVE internet connections I've used anywhere in the world. With so many inexpensive hotel chains offering free high-speed wireless, I'm amazed that some upscale hotels still charge. It makes a bad impression for an otherwise wonderful hotel! Overall, though, we still loved our stay at the Melia!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in mid December and found it to be the best hotel out of the 4 we stayed in in Germany. Location is excellent - only a few mins walk to the U and S bahn lines. We were lucky enough to be given an upgrade (without even asking) from the standard room to a Level room on the 7th floor. It was magnificent - spacious, modern and totally indulgent with bathrobes and slippers, a huge king size bed, a bidet, and best of all, tea and coffee making facilities (we knew not to expect this in europe so this was a bonus). It was so nice a room we immediately returned to reception to check the nightly rate we were paying! We had wifi internet access in our room but did have to pay for it. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveller74
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in December and first of all the hotel is so easy to find if you arrive at Friederstrasse Station which is connected to all the major airports. The hotel had some great write ups in Trip Advisor and all I can say is that it is a nice hotel in a great location but we did have a few problems with it, First of all it said you could check in any time after 12pm on our confirmation and we arrived at 2.20pm and our room was not ready but we were allowed to leave our luggage. secondly we asked for a river view and although the hotel was not full we were not given one and lastly we asked for a double room and what we got was a twin room with the 2 beds pushed together. The room itself was spotless and overall the hotel was the same. The location itself is first class we walked everywhere including part of the old berlin wall, the Reichstag and the Christmas markets all over the city . I would definatley stay at the hotel again and would recommend the hotel and the city to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, but everything else is extra”
Reviews.Author: csharpy
Reviews.Content: So, being an "ordinary tourist", by my standards this is a luxury hotel. It sure was one of the largest and overall classiest rooms I've slept in. Having said that, everything else is too expensive to get an excellent rating compared to other choices in Berlin. €22 for 24 hours of internet access? I don't think so. Yes, you had the choice of €18 if you only wanted web browsing access (so they are blocking mail ports for €4? - ridiculous...). Breakfast was expensive at €20 per person, but if you combine it with the cheap room rate I had found, I think it is fair. Although I didn't check it out, I'm sure it was good. I took the budget choice and used the local supermarket at the lower level of Friedrichstrasse S-bahn station to stock up the minibar. The margarita in the hotel bar got a 3/5 rating. It would have benefited from a gold tequila. It is extremely near U- and S-bahn station Friedrichstrasse, but I had trouble finding a good selection of restaurants in the vicinity (3-4 blocks of walking).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service Hotel In An Unpleasant Town”
Reviews.Author: CASTELMAR1
Reviews.Content: Very efficient and smiling welcome at the reception desk, and excellent service are provided in this Hotel. The rooms are modern, pleasant and very clean, even if the bathroom equipment is rather "cheap". Excellent beakfast with a very large variety of products, dedicated to all cultural whishes. Excellent presentation, and efficient service BUT the breakfast room is always crowded, and it may be a hard struggle to find a table on week-end days ! The location is practical (just in front of the S and U-Bahn Friedrichstrasse), but the Hotel is situated in the less elegant part of the Friedrichstrasse, at 1/2 mile from Gendarmenmarkt, and surrounded by heavy public works : well it is an ugly scenery when you get out, but isn't the typical features of Berlin ? We stayed 6 nights, that is definitely a too long time for visiting this so-called capital. We found Berlin without any charm, and of poor interest (weak museums, complex transportation network, difficult or simply not understandable indications for tourists who do not speak German, rather stiff and unpleasant locals) We were badly surprised by the pure "Sovietic" style which stands as the reference for all Berlin architecture : large avenues, ugly concrete buildings, heavy public works making noise everywhere, total disorder and dramatic lack of coherence in the urban plans : what a nightmarish scenery !!! We shall keep a good memory of the smiling staff of the Hotel MELIA, and that is highly noticeable, because a SMILE is an infinite rarity in Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gulyi88
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip, spent here one night. It is great modern hotel, I was very much impressed by the room, spacious, clean and modern and good size bathroom, too. Bed is huge, very comfy, nice bedlinen, you will have a good night-sleep here. Staff is great, speak good english, help you with any question. I've tried the hotel-restaurant as well, great menu, good-size portions and good wine-list! I would recommend this hotel, and next time back in Berlin I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myopinionWales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend at Berlin in October 2007, a city we had wanted to visit for years, and the Melia was an imporatant ingredient in our enjoyment. It is a modern, clean and comfortable hotel, conveniently located for underground and overground trains, but also in easy walking distance of some of Berlin's most famous sites e.g. Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden etc. Friedrichstrasse is a busy street that is part of Berlin's renewal, and we were pleased to have a room overlooking this lively street and the floodlit Reichstag, but there was no traffic or building work noise as the double-glazing was very effective. Although our "Comfort Room" is the more basic of the accommodation available in the hotel we considered it quite luxurious with a spacious bathroom. We booked through Opodo and thought the £71.00 per night room rate very good value for a hotel of this standard. The lobby bar was relaxing after a day's sightseeing before going out in the evening, and prices reasonable for a hotel bar. We didn't try the restaurants but the Tapas Bar looked temptin We felt 20.00euros each for breakfast was excessive and we gave it a miss, but "fruhstuck" became my new favourite German word as we sampled plentiful breakfasts in traditional cafes along Unter den Linden nearby. The hotel staff were also welocoming and friendly, and I would thoroughly recommend the Melia to any intending visitors to this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: travel4randr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Berlin, in August, for 3 nights and found it conveniently located to all the sights we wanted to see. We walked everywhere. The room was spacious, clean and modern with a flat screen t.v. and decent size bathroom. We ate breakfast, at the hotel, one morning but preferred to grab something at one of the many bakeries around the hotel and in the nearby train station. We found the best rate on Travelocity. It was $128.00 Canadian where Melia was offering the same room for $130.00 Euros (a savings of $60.00 Canadian per night).

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel- great setting for sights”
Reviews.Author: Dzinte
Reviews.Content: I was attending a political conference in Berlin and chose this hotel over the conference hotel (just down the road)based on its good reviews. Having been in both hotels I think I made the right choice. As as solo female I also look to hotels that are in safe locations for transport etc as conference events can go on late at night. The room was very comfortable for the price - exceeded what I'd had for the same price in Brighton a few weeks earlier. Nice touch of free Sleep sheep sweets at bedtime!! Trusting place with samples from the Mini bar on an open shelf. My room overlooked Friederichstrasse but I was not disturbed by traffic noise. Breakfast in the hotel 20 Euros but I got a good breakfast of rolls, cheeses and cold meats with coffe eat Adams Cafe a few minutesaway from the hotel for 6 Euros. Walk to bus stop for Tegel is about 5 mins - buses every 10 mins and cost 2 Euros 10. A taxo to the hotel on arrival was under 18 Euros. Hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Reichstag and museum island. Friederichstasse S and U Bahn close to hand. Boat trips along the Spree leave from across the road.Thus an ideal setting. Staff friendly and efficient - my bag was held until I collected it on Sunday afternoon. I would be happy to stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean hotel centrally situated. Excellent hotel service, restaurant staff a little inexperienced. Can walk to Brandenburg gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden, Jewish Museum. Excellent breakfast, although a little crowded. Close to River Spree.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: LadyWanderer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 4 nights and I can highly recommend this Hotel. Location is fantastic, right beside train station and within walking distance to major sights and restaurants/cafes. Room was very comfortable, if a little too warm for my liking. Bathroom very spacious with great shower. I didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food. The only things I didn't like were the lack both of tea/coffee making facilites and english language tv channels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dotful
Reviews.Content: Just have to endorse what everyone else seems to be saying about this stylish new hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights in August, and got one of the Level rooms for a good price. Very happy with our extremely comfortable room and bathroom. Relaxing over a free drink in the Level lounge in the evening was enjoyable. Free mineral water in room also a nice touch. For breakfast, we preferred to go down to the main restaurant for an even better choice. Service overall excellent. As for the position, again agree with others that it's ideal. Easy walk to so many sights and museums, plus fantastic transport connections. We would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, chain like but high quality, good breakfast, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: The Melia Berlin Hotel is a well situated four star hotel at the Friedrichstrasse in Berlin. Directly located at the river Spree and closely located to the next underground station. The hotel owned by a Spanish hotel chain offers modern ambiente and nice rooms. Somewhere located above Novotel and low Mariott standard. The rooms over the regular set of comfortable bed, convenient shower, a FlatTV and wide desk for working. My room price during a major fair was 170 Euro, plus 20 Euro for breakfast. The hotel offers also a Spa on the highest floor.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: italydream
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in middle of August. This was fantastic for money we paid (90 Euro). Like other reviews, the hotel is situated in the centre close to all sightseeing spots. And there is a subway station (both S and U bahn) within 5 minutes to the hotel even with luggage. So it makes connecting to the airport and the main train station very very convenient. And it's only about 10 mins walk to either Reichstag, 10 mins to Museum Island, and 15-20 mins to Brendenberg gate, all walking distance. The room is very new, modern, comfortable, and spacious, and spotless. The area is also safe, so no worry there. The hotel is also just behind the river where there are lots of restaurants along. And the staff were very helpful and a smile on their faces all the time. We didn't get the breakfast so can't comment on that. Overall, we would stay here again when we're in Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in berlin”
Reviews.Author: annette02
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in Berlin at this excellent hotel.Cannot recommend it enough for the following reasons.Firstly, it is in a superb position being really central to the most important sites worth seeing and a few steps away from Friedrichstrasse station with good connections to most of Berlin.Secondly, the staff are all polite,helpful and friendly -they go out of their way to help with anything you might need and nothing is too much trouble.Thirdly, the place is spotless,and spacious.Yes, it is very modern and may not have so much character but it is so comfortable and pleasant to return to after a busy day sightseeing.We booked on the internet and got a good price on a Comfort room (the hotel's most basic room but very luxurious!).On arrrival we were told we were entitled to 2 breakfasts for the price of one each day (at 20euros it is not cheap but this deal made it just 10euros each).The breakfast buffet was like a banquet-the best spread for breakfast I have seen anywhere.Only very slight niggle was that at peak times on saturday and sunday it was a bit of a struggle to find a clear table. It is a hotel where customers are cared for very well (eg there is a piece of paper in the room for writng down any things that may need fixing or attention, which can be put on the doorhandle-we had a slightly lose shower attachment,i left a note and it was fixed immedialtely!). This is certainly the place to choose for your stay in Berlin! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely modern hotel that met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: wagtails
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Melia in a Superior room as first time visitors to Berlin and was delighted with our choice of hotel. I booked well in advance and was attracted to this hotel as it was almost brand new and was well located to most of the historical sites around Berlin. I always compare the tariffs available from the various booking agencies and finally compare them to the hotel website. If I can book direct with the hotel at equal, or better price, then this is the way I go. In this instance I got the best price by booking a superior room direct online, which also included breakfast. We travelled from Amsterdam by train to Berlin and had an horrendous trip with a suicide up the line forcing all passengers off the train and bused to an alternative train station where we then took a further 4 trains before arriving in Berlin nearly 3 hours later than expected. By the time we arrived at the hotel we were very hot, bothered and tired so we appreciated the warm and courteous welcome and a fast check-in. Even better when my special request for a room on the higher floors with a view over the river Spree was provided. The room was very spacious with a pleasant decor, large comfortable bed with an abundance of pillows and a large modern bathroom. The view over the river was very relaxing and the heavily insulated glass window/doors kept out any noise from the street below, yet could be opened for fresh air. As it was now after 9pm we decided to use the hotel dining room rather than wander around looking for suitable restaurants. Some prior reviews indicated that the hotel dining room was not the greatest and when we entered to find that only one table was occupied in the huge room we had second thoughts. I am glad that we stayed because the meal and the service provided was one of the best we had in 6 weeks of travelling around Europe and the cost was reasonable.Not being familiar with european wines we were also delighted with the waiter's recommendation after we described the characteristics of the type of wine we prefer. The same huge dining room was used for breakfast which was excellent with a wide and varied choice. You could even have champagne if this is the way you prefer to start the day. Location was just as I had expected. A short walk to the SBahn which was important to us as we were travelling by train to Munich after leaving Berlin. Also we had to join a walking tour the next morning only 1 rail stop away. Just across the river was a string of reasonable quality and popular restaurants which we sampled on the next 2 nights. Besides these restaurants was a small park where an impromptu fireworks display lit up the immediate area for about 15 minutes on the next night, which we enjoyed from the comfort of our room. We also took a river cruise with its departure point right in front of the hotel. The staff we encountered during our stay were friendly. We find that it always helps to try and greet them using our best attempt at there own language and treat them the way we would like to be treated - always works, and the excellent service and response to our requests flows from there. When we checked out we said that we had had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel and would have said so in writing if their feedback form was in english as well as german. Berlin is an interesting place to visit, but probably not a city that we would come back to again and again. But if we did, we would certainly consider staying at the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Melia Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jetset87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Great! The location was amazing, right next to the S-bahn and within walking distance of soooo many sites! The room was very very spacious and the bed was so comfortable and clean. All the ammenities were great... the flat screen tv, the big bathroom, the Sauna and gym, the view over the canal etc. Check in was a little rough because we arrived at 6am and even though i had asked for an early check in they didn't have our room ready until 3pm. But they locked up our bags so we could go explore the city. Breakfast is very expensive but i would recommend walking to a bakery inside of the S-bahn station across the street (they actually have really good food) or there is a starbucks about a block down the street. I would recommend this hotel to everyone because it was a very comfortable stay...and the price is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparks07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days at the Melia in July and truly loved it. The rooms were modern and spacious. Flat screen TV, heated floor tiles and large windows that open were just a few of the added touched that made this hotel a great choice. Our room, 454, overlooked the Spree River and although there is not a balcony, it was just as good. You could open up both of the floor to ceiling windows and enjoy the view or rest on the iron railing and breathe in the fresh air. The two tub chairs were very comfortable as was the king bed. Breakfast (included in our price) was fabulous complete with Champagne. The hotel was also convenient to trams, sights and great restaurants. We hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel near all the sights”
Reviews.Author: MosquitoSweden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Berlin Melia for two nights in july 2007. We had a junior suite ("the Level") on the 8th floor. The room was large and very well equipped. The bathroom was spacious. Everything looked new and very clean. Bathrobe and slippers was supllied without cost. The breakfast, which was included in this category, was served in a special breakfast room for Level guests only. It was delicious. The staff was very polite and always ready to help us. Nearby, across the river Spree, we found a nice Indian restaurant, and many other eating places. The excursion boats on the Spree are some fifty meters from the hotel entrance and museums are in walking distance. S-Bahn and U-Bahn (Bhf Friedrichstrasse) are also very near the hotel. I can honestly highly recommend this very fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to American standards”
Reviews.Author: NoneColumbus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is apparently owned by a Spanish company and is located in what used to be East Berlin. It is close to a train station and is about a ten minute walk away from the Brandenburg Gate. The check-in went smoothly. All the desk clerks spoke acceptable English. The room was acceptably large and clean. The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was large and clean. The selection of TV channels in English was miserable. About all they had that was sort of worth watching in English was a British news channel. I was particularly amazed by an English language channel that contained only programming about what a great place mainland China was and what a wonderful government it had. It was pure propaganda and nothing else. Maybe it was a holdover from the days of East Germany. I never saw anything quite like it. That was their idea of what their English speaking guests would want to watch? It is incredible they could be that out of touch. Our guide suggested avoiding the hotel restaurants. He said they were expensive, had very slow service and their food was not all that great. They were virtually empty the whole time we were there, which seemed to confirm our guide was not the only one holding that opinion. Anyway, there were many restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. It was Sunday and the banks and about every other business (except the restaurants) were closed. I tried to change money at the desk, since all the banks were closed. The clerk said she didn't have any cash to do that. We had to go quite a way to find a restaurant that took credit cards. Most did not, making me think that part of East Berlin had not fully picked up the business practices of the West. That meal cost twice as much as what we paid the next night at a much closer, just as good restaurant, where we paid cash. There was supposed to be wireless internet in the room, but I couldn't get a signal. There was cable internet, which I couldn't get to work -- probably me not knowing how to do it. There were three computers in the lobby, supposedly available for about six dollars for half an hour. However, when I went to get my pass word at the desk, the clerk said they were out of order. I asked her when she thought they might be working again. She got pretty annoyed by that question and said she had no idea. However, the computers did work late the next morning and I was able to successfully get on the internet for my six dollar half hour. There were no ice machines. The front desk clerk said to get ice at the bar. However, the bar tender acted like I was crazy when I asked for some ice. He sent me to the restaurant, where I found no one. I went back to the desk, where the clerk asked me why I hadn't gone to the bar. When I told her the bar had refused, she sent a bell hop to the restaurant. He found a waiter outside and after a long conversation, he said he'd get me some ice from the kitchen. I waited some fifteen minutes, during which time I saw him hauling luggage. He finally came up with a small bucket of ice. I didn't try to get ice again after that. I can't say anyone was ever out and out rude to us. However, sometimes requests for help or service brought a rolling of eyes and a disgusted look. There were no shops in the hotel. The closest shops were in the train station, about a block away. There was an included hot breakfast. The selection and quality of the food was excellent. The service personnel spoke no English, but they kept the food stocked and the tables clean. This hotel was not horrible by any means. However, it just was not up to American standards. Maybe its being in the former East Germany is the reason it just didn't seem to have its act together when it came to catering to guests and having amenities you come to expect in most hotels -- even abroad. Melia may not be a company with its roots in the former East German, but the people who work there and manage it likely are. To all appearances, they have a lot to learn about the niceties many guests expect.
