While it was not the nightmare we have run into at other hotels where we have stayed a few times in the past (like the totally horrible one where we stayed in Naples [e.g., bed bugs, no air conditioning] a couple years back), we would never stay at the Berlin Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis A1
Reviews.Content: This review is written from a tourist point of view. Stayed at the Melia from 11/07/07 until 16/07/07 with wife and 2 other friends. We had 2 rooms on The Level. These were excellent if a little small. All the fittings were first class and the room was kept in first class condition. Bathroom was excellent. Lots of soaps etc. Cleaned morning and evening, fresh towels twice per day. Staff were on duty all day to assist if required. In the evening from 6.00P.M. tapas and a range of wines, spirits and soft drinks were availabe on a serve yourself basis. Breakfast is also served here. There is always lots of space. Things might be different outside July/August when businessmen return Had 2 excellent meals in the Cafe Madrid in the hotel. There are a range of restaurants just over the road from the hotel were we ate ouside beside the river Spree. It was great sitting by the riverside watching the tour boats and private cruisers going up and down the river all lit up.The restaurants were really good with great young staff. This hotel is very central and a lot of the main sights are fairly close. If you are a walker Berlin is very flat. We found all the staff at the Melia very helpful especially the staff on The Level. The hotel is also just beside the departure point for river tours. 1 hour city river tours for 8 Euro and longer 31/2 hour tours for 16 Euro are available. On the longer tour which departs at 10.00A.M. and 6.30P.M. a simple range of hot and cold food for purchase is available which is excellent for a meal out on the river. We did both tours, the longer one was the best. The short tour departs hourly all day. The hop on/off bus is the best way to see the sights-15-20Euro for all day. I was amazed at the size of Berlin. Its vast, and there are waterways and canals everywhere. Berlin will have to catch up as regards providing literature and tours for non Germans. I found it difficult to get tour details. The hotel had lots of literature but only very basic details in English. Hard luck for those who do not speak German or English. In fact all the tours I went on were for Germans with English as an add on. I found only 1 chap, a South African, who provided tours exclusively in Enlish using a mini bus. He was excellent ant took us on a Berlin city tour lasting 3 hours He showed us absolutely everything in places where the larger bus cannot go. He agreed that Berlin is unfortunately far from the standard found in Paris, Madrid, Rome etc as regards tours and info for non nationals. However, I found Berlin great and everywhere is clean. The taxis are great. One last word about the Melia. When we left for the airport my wife forgot her cardigan and left it in reception. Luckily I had the telephone number of The Level and rang them. The girls went and found the item and despatched it to the Airport and even paid the taxi. Service indeed!!! You can do so much from the Melia whether it be walking or river tours, and as somebody else wrote it still smells new. Berlin and The Melia- I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: pennytours
Reviews.Content: We booked well in advance (the price went up nearer the time). We booked 'The Level' which is the business floor. When we arrived we were checked in on the 7th floor special check-in. Our room was comfortable ,quiet , clean, but small. The hotel is next to the river Spree on Friedrichstrasse which is very well placed for everything . Being on 'The Level' includes a great breakfast,drinks and snacks throughout the day and tapas in the evening in a comfortable dining-room and lounge on the 7th floor. there is someone on hand to help you throughout the day. We paid 150 euros per night incl which we thought was good value for it's star rating.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: DrHotel
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, location could not be better BUT the air conditioning doesn't work properly. This problem is only just being revealed as the hotel was only opened last October so this is the first spring/summer. We complained but were told that it was 'the German way' of air conditioning...utter nonsense of course. Was too hot to sleep properly and this is only in May, god know what it will be like in midsummer. We were told that other people had also complained so it wasn't just a problem with our room

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DavidManchester
Reviews.Content: I cannot add much to the previous reviews - very welcoming hotel next Friedrichstrasse train station and a perfect central location for sightseeing. Large rooms and a huge bed, prices at the hotel bar are very reasonable, my only slight criticism would be the 20 Euro price tag for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: SpectatorBelfast
Reviews.Content: In Berlin for a short business trip.Wanted to book a traditional German hotel - but ended up with the Melia because the rate was so good for the executive floor( called The Level in the hotel). I was very pleased with this modern hotel.The photos on Tripadvisor taken by reviewers give an accurate snapshot .It is very central next to a large S/U Bann station(note surprisingly little noise ).Everything in Mitte is walkable. The Melia is also located next to the River Spee - see photos.Very picturesque from my window.Unfortunately,a site is being cleared beside the river which may limit views from the hotel in the near future.On the other hand , there did not seem to be any foundations being prepared so it may (one hopes) be used for amenity space. The room on The Level (floor 7)was very spacious and modern.The bed was massive with numerous choices of pillows. The bathroom was again large and well equiped.The bathrobe actually fitted a normal sized person !. Food in the hotels first floor main restaurant (on 1 meal ) was at a very reasonable standard for a hotel.In the wine list the Spanish wines were expensive arguably: the German wines were better value.For outside meals close to the hotel cross the bridge(ie out of town)and turn immediate left along the riverbank about 50m just past the theatre .The are approx 3 gastro style pubs and a similar no. of restaurants who prima facie cater for theatregoers. A meal in one we found good value and enjoyable.Refer to the photos again, you can see the riverside restaurants from the upstairs hotel rooms. One aspect of The Level is worthy of mention.The hotel operates a business class airport style dining area/lounge on the 7th floor for those residents who are on the 7th and 8th floors.You take your breakfast there separately from the other guests.Self service but a reasonable choice with staff very attentive.In the evening drinks and tapas are free in the lounge.On our !st night drinks and tapas were in plentiful supply.By contrast on the following night ,drinks and tapas were rather meagre.This was disappointing since the hotel had created the expectation. In conclusion ,this is a good hotel in a central ,riverside location.I shall return .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tellall1
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel and great location. Hotel has modern furnishing and luxury bathroom w/ nice soak tub for those sore legs. French doors that open so u can see down the street and across the Spree River. Even from the 3rd floor, good city views of the glass top of the Foster designed Reichstag, the glass Freidrich train stop across the street. Hotel staff was helpful, not the best. Bed mattress o k and do call housekeeping for a top sheet. Tapas rest. off lobby was nice food and good design. It was a 2 block walk to Museum Is. Do go to the German History Musuem w/ the I M Pei extention cuz it has a great permanent exhibit and temp. one on political propaganda from 1930-45 for USSR, USA, Nazi's and Italy. Buy the all day train/bus pass for 5.60 Euro cuz it's easy to jump on and off the S line[train above] U line [subway} and city buses and trams. Easy to use. Also take the U [subway stop right out side Hotel] to Kurt Schumacher stop andtransfer to the #128 bus to get to the Tegel Airport quicker than a cab during rush hour traffic [25 min] and $2.70 E only.

Reviews.Title: “It's Good”
Reviews.Author: CurdworthCruiser
Reviews.Content: All the previous reviewers have said it all. We booked 3 nights in a Superior Room B&B for a great price on the hotel web site,and to be honest our expectations were exceeded.Breakfast is superb ,the range of options available is amazing and blew away all previous hotels ,the staff were helpful and friendly.The rooms are well equipped ,new ,clean ,the decour attractive. As one reviewer pointed out it is expensive for anything outside what you have already paid for but is to be expected.The hotel Bar is ok small seating area and yes you have delegates from conferences hanging about but its not a problem ,the cost of a drink is more so, but there are enough in the area and wider afield to satisfy all needs.Can not comment on the Tapas Bar or the restaurant as we didn't eat there but i would anticipate it to be very good.The area is excellent for the tourist thing, with Friedrichstrasse Station on the doorstep, so don't pay the 30 euro taxi fare if you are flying in to Schonefeld get the train 2.10 euro per person, just as fast, but i don't think the front desk get many low fare flight customers as they are incredulous when you refuse the offer to organise a taxi for you. All of the major attractions are within walking distance but get a day ticket ,ride the U and S Bahns ,the 100 Bus (everywhere you want to go) and it also includes the Airport Express, a public transport system second to none. If you turn right out of the hotel and cross the bridge you will find the Friedrichstadtplast Theatre if you fancy a show, or if you cross and turn left an area of Bars and restaurants,not fantastic but adequate and reasonable. Berlin is a fabulous city ,go ,and stay at the Melia while the rate lasts but beware one of the reception staff he was the most unfriendly,unhelpful downright ignorant person i'd met in a long time,but he was the exception and he made me laugh,sadly i didn't get his name, but you will know him i promise, always has a piece of paper in his hand.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly great value”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_in_London28
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to it's good reviews on tripadvisor.com and a great rate on Expedia. Paid £90 for an "executive suite" which ended up being a tremendous value. With a suite you get free soft-drinks and beer all day, a great breakfast (literally really great), enough tapas at night that we skipped dinner, and a really nice room near the top floor. Couldn't have been any better. It's right near everything and only 30 seconds from the Friedichstrar S-Bahn and DB train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: directions_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights towards the end of January. We got a very good deal on --- and it was excellent value for money. Our first happy surprise was how close it is to Friedrichstraße train station, just right across the road. The station seemed to be a central point with a lot of connections throughout the city. Location wise the hotel was good for an exploring base as if you turn left out of the hotel you are immediately in the main shopping vicinity, however, to the right it was quite dark at night time and didn’t seem as built up. Check-in was very quick with very helpful staff that spoke excellent English and helped us with all queries throughout our stay. The rooms are very very clean with a nice bright decor, although they probably look smaller than they actually were due to the HUGE bed!! (haha), which was EXTREMELY comfortable with loads of pillows. Again the bathroom was very clean with plenty of towel and was always warm. Compared to another Four Star hotel we stayed in while in Berlin, Melia was well above the standard. So, things to do while in Berlin. We’d highly recommend the New Berlin tours some of which are offered everyday of the year, regardless of the weather (---p.com). Visit Potsdamer Platz where the Sony Centre is located with lots of bars, restaurants and a cinema with films in English. Try the Australian restaurant/bar here, it’s delicious – get a Death By Chocolate!!! And of course all the other usual sites such as Brandenburg Gate and Checkpoint Charlie which are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: bofcof
Reviews.Content: No doubt the price of the hotel will go up as it becomes established. We got a very good deal direct from hotel web-site that included the price of breakfast, we were also delighted with the free upgrade to a superior room on arrival. Concierge staff were polite and efficient and check-in was quick even though we arrived 2 hrs earlier than the normal check-in time. Room spotless, and bright. Liked the flower in a vase in the bathroom and the modern square sink. Umpteem pillows on the bed. Breakfast buffet was a good spread although was surprised to see no muesli in a German hotel? A good choice of cooked and cold dishes, were to be had. Location in walking distance of Museum Island (5 min) the Reichstag (about 10min) Brandenburg Gate and other places of interest. The hotel is at the far end of Freidericstrasse which has some very good shopping galleries such as Lafayette and Galleries 5 and 6 are worth checking out. Also walking distance to Gendarm Platz. Having toured Berlin and the sights I wouldnt choose it above any other major European city so think twice before picking it as a city break, but if you are well travelled and are thinking of where to go, its worth a visit but do include nearby Potsdam on your trip (easy to do by bus or train ) which is far more attractive. (we spent one night there).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexCarlisle
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel in excellent location. Staff always helpful and service very good. Only criticisms are that the bar is in an open plan lobby and seemed underused as did the Tapas bar and restaurant. Perhaps the reason for this was the other bars and restaurants nearby. Just over the river the Ganymed Brasserie was top class if a little expensive, The Standige Vertretung was a big hit for beers and wholesome German food. Also across the bridge at Friedrichstrasse 113, Ristorante Peretti served up top class pasta dishes and mammoth pizzas at very low cost. Beware of the cost of extras in the hotel, Bar drinks, mini bar etc. If not travelling alone sign up fot the MAS card (free) which provodes a free breakfast for a second person. (normal cost 20 euros)
